reviews.review: aqmazing. absolutely gorge! great for photo opportunities. The intricacy of the building style very impressive

Famous golden buddha. You will visit it while walking from Hua Lamphong station to China town.it's a famous place to visit, but you will feel silence while you go to top of the temple to meet the golden Buddha.

One building, must go. Nice building, nice buddha, go there, take the picture, get going.
Must take off your shoes before entering, you can buy a small souvenier at the top.

beautiful golden buddha. we had to pay 40 bhat for the entrance and 100 bhat or more for the museum. my friend was wearing shorts so she had to get a scarf which was 20 bhat +100 bhat deposit at ticket counter. it was a peaceful temple and golden buddha was magnificient.

Spectacular views. I visited this attraction on my first visit to Thailand with my mother and younger sister. There are some serious stairs to get to the temple at the top but anyone of average fitness or even if you're unfit can do it if you take it at your own pace. The stairs are steep but there isn't heaps and heaps. The temple is beautiful and the views out over the town around are beautiful.

Pristine and serene...... It is a magnificent place and the Golden buddha temple is worth visiting. It has great architechure and if time permits you can also visit the museum on the lower floors for a slightly additional cost.
Impressive. The place is magnificent. A must-see attraction in the city of Bangkok. Impressive decorations, view and atmosphere.
Amazing. Really nice temple defo worth the visit just to see the giant sleeping Buddha, you can stay as long or as little as you want. Really good value for money

A must see place in Bangkok. One of the wonders in Thailand, a pure gold statue of lord Buddha weighing about nearly 6 tons of gold. This staue was saved from invaders during the world war 2 by erecting a walla ccross the building to hyde it. The temple itself is a beautiful structure. Never miss this if you visit Thailand.

Another must see place in Bangkok !. This is near China town and the entrance is not free as written in some websites. Now they have housed it in a special building and one can buy the ticket for just to see the Golden Buddha alone (50 bahts ? ) or for the museum as well. The Golden Buddha is on the 4th floor but there is a lift installed for the infirm and elderly. This is a pure solid gold statue not plated weighing 5.5 tons.On the ground level is a prayer hall with a big gold Buddha statue where local folks go in to get the blessings from the monks and give offerings. There are some good shops selling Buddha souvenirs. Please do not mistake the prayer hall Buddha for the golden Buddha which is housed in a separate building in the same place.One as usual needs to be dressed appropriately and leave their slippers outside to enter the temple.
The only pure gold buddah. all other gold buddahs are actually covered in gold leaf but this one is solid gold. when you visit the buddahs this one is a must.
Amazing cultural visit. The golden Budda made of 100% gold, previously covered in cement to prevent the invaders from capturing it weighing at 5 tonnes. Real insight into the culture of Thailand!

Golden Buddha tranquil feel. Golden Buddha was a smaller less crowded site than others we visited. Time to sit and contemplate for a while. Shade and seating welcome. Not crowded with market stalls all around either. Smaller food and refreshment vendors. For 100 Tb you can release 4 birds from a cage. Kids love this.
City Tour. Very old statue of Lord Buddha. Which is made of 5500 kg of gold (according to the local guide). Off shoulder clothes and shorts are prohibited.

Big gold Buddha. Been to Bangkok a few times and have seen this marvelous Buddha before but it used to be housed in a rather derelict looking temple now it's centre stage in a beautiful marble temple. Impressive looking and interesting history. Be warned, if it's hot and the sun is shining all that marble gets super hot hot hot. As with all temples you remove your shoes. There are racks to put your shoes on then you need to scarper over hot marble and a flight of super hot steps to enter the temple. They laid out rubber matting which was Black. Who knew rubber matting had such scorching effects. Either way probably a good idea to take socks just in case :)

Very nice Buddha statue and temple. The best part about this is that entrance is not expensive. 50 THB. so its worth it. You can do this in under 45 minutes. The idol on the 2nd floor is beautiful with a tremendous shine. Definitely should be done.

very poor temple in china town. i would not have gone there if my hotel was not within a walking distance from this temple.it is in china town near the train station.just another temple of millions of temples in bangkok.you could just take a selfie photo with 5.5 ton gold statue of buddah

Very Crowded. It's just another Buddist temple. The artwork is stunning, but there is so much it becomes less interesting. Crowd control is strict, and it needs to be because the crowds are huge and the weather hot. We enjoyed watching the Monks meditate until the pulled out cell phones and spent the bulk of the time texting and used their cell phones.. It is also on the expensive at 1,000 baht each.

Nice place. Thailand is a good place for family to travell and temple is famous this country. Well this temple is not in the same line as other Wats, but it is a must see from my experience. This has Golden buddha statue which looks magnificent. Hightly recommend for travellers.

Cool budha. Visited the Golden Buddha today! We only chose to see the Buddha which was 40 baht but there is an option to see the exhibition for an additional 40 baht. Nice to see but does not require a long visit.
nice temple but we were ripped off. we paid the entrance fees but were not told that the temple was closed. otherwise a nice place but the tourists should not be ripped off

Something different and good. Well this temple is not in the same line as other Wats, but it is a must see from my experience. This has Golden buddha statue which looks magnificent.Reaching there:- Take orange boat to No.4 Marine Department- Walk or take a ride to the temple.We walked from Wat Pho through Little India and Chinatown. But if you don't have time you can directly take the boat/taxi there.Dress Code: As usual. They will provide clothes so not to worryCrowd: Less crowd than othersTip: - The attendant inside the temple is very much happy to click your pictures, and she is very good. So hand over your camera to her if she is available.- No selfie stick can be used inside temple so be respectful of the rule
Pretty. Pretty temple, liked the buddha as well. Took some time to find the ticket office. It was fun to see the schoolkids playing in the courtyard.

Temple of Buddha - You should not miss this. It is a temple of Buddha where you will find the golden statue within the temple, you will defiantly enjoy going through the place and it is common tourist visit place comes in your day toor package, you may finish in less than 1 hour but you might have to take few steps along to climb.
Golden Buddha. Ancient and very precious statue of Buddha 3,5meters high pure gold. Really worth to see this temple in chinatown

More Than Just a Gold Buddha. The solid gold Buddha statue and the temple building itself are enough to make this a must-see in Bangkok. That being said, I really enjoyed the exhibitions on the lower levels. One level contains a museum of nearby Chinatown and was truly excellent with lots of interesting and professional exhibits and information. The other level contains some information on the statue itself, though part of that was under repairs when we were there so it wasn't that spectacular, though still rather interesting. Spend the (not very much) extra money and get the combined ticket, the exhibitions are worth it.
VERY NICE!. Interesting place to at least visit one temple. It's the closest to us, since we're staying at Silom. 40B for the entrance to fourth level.

Horrible visit. We went on Monday afternoon, expecting to be spend some time at this famous temple. Never expect the place was so so crowded as if like you walk in a night market. Tourists came in buses and the line is long to get in. Important note to take: Don't wear shorts or skirts which above the knee, or else you have to rent the baggy pants from the place. Paid 500baht and we only spent about 30 minutes. The crowd is unbearable as they talk too loud and sitting anywhere to get the shade. If you truly wana enjoy the visiting this temple, please get there early in the morning, not exceed 10a.m. as this place close at 3.30p.m.
Very Nice speritual place. Very calm and amazing views, nice view of the city, met some locals that seems to have found the meaning of happiness in life.
Beautiful. It is a must place to visit. It is incredible beautiful and interesting!. No matter if you are feeling tired or it is hot, it is worthy to visit it!

a must visit but very commercial temple. it is a beautiful temple and the gold statue is a marvel to look at. there are a few steps to climb so mobility impaired people might have some difficulty. however, the temple it so commercialised that you really cant sit and enjoy your time there. ticket costs 40 baht and as soon as I approached the steps i had two different guys shoving their cameras in my face taking pics, which were then printed on to badges and offered to me to buy when leaving the temple.

the most must visit place in Bangkok : Wat Trimitr, the temple of the Golden Buddha - the statue of Buddha, Wat Pho, etc. Golden Buddha is the world's largest solid gold statue, weights 5,5 tones. It is located in the temple of Wat Traimit. The entrance fee for the exhibition is 100 Bahts, and to see the statue 40 Bahts.Closes at 5pm, so get here early. The outside architecture is still very impressive. Easy walk from the Hua Lamphong BTS station or Bangkok Railway Station.
Nice pla. Visited with my friend it was very impressive. However, it was to hot the day with get there. you need to bring some thing to drink if you go on a very hot day.
Amazing place. easy to get here by taxi, very beatiful place with amazing aura atmosfere. Better to go morning time , because very hot at day time. recomended.

One among d million temples. Best time : early winter, during less sunny hours. In temple behavior : maintain silence, dress modestly. No shorts, no sleeveless dresses. Wrap around a shawl if u r in shorts. Photos r allowed, selfies r considered disrespectful.
just the big Buddha. not much to see, but a big buddha and lots of people trying to touching it and taking selfies. not a recommended place

It's a must and it's very impressive. This historical buddist temple is located in Chaoren Krung Road, not far from Chinatown. Here you must have enough time because it's huge and a lot of things to see. The Buddha is huge ands impressive, made out for pure gold.

AMAZING. W e booked the three temples private tour,well worth it excellent knowledge from our tour guide I think its the oldest budda temple in Bangkok.There is a few steps to climb to get to the top but once inside its really worth the climb
Colorful architecture. This temple is located nearby our hotel. From MBK shopping mall took short time just around 30mins walk. We visited few times and fond it was peaceful place. Love this place
Historical Place. Wat Traimit is a historical Buddhist temple in bangkok near by China town. Amazing Golden Buddha is there and was lucky to worship this temple.
Pure gold. This Buddha is absolutely huge and is made of pure gold. Very impressive. Quite a few steps up to it if not good on your legs but well worth it.

take your time. Wow is all I have to say. It is so big and so much to see. The sight is almost overkill for the eyes with all the decoration an gold. be sure to catch sight of the monks. They do not mind being photographed. You have to wear skirt covering knees, and sleeves. If you don't have that, you will not get in, but there are street stands that sell sarongs. Buy one, they are cheap and you have a keepsake. Be sure to have a couple of hours at the least to take in the sights.

beautiful temple by train station. The temple is an easy walk from Hua Lamphong train station and last MRT stop. The temple is quite large and quite beautiful and visually quite nice to photograph. The Main attraction is the solid gold buddha at the top of the building. Seeing all that gold is worth a visit.

buddha with interesting history. We visited the Grand Palace one day, prior to which we hired a tuktuk driver to take us to some other sights, one of which was the golden Buddha.The temple (Wat Traimit) was interesting & the golden Buddha is housed seperately, a well documented history is surrounding the effigy.Another site worth a visit in Bangkok.
Buddha except golden... for 150 baht you get to see two exhibitions along with the golden buddha.imo exhibitions is not worth it.only golden buddha is 40 baht.stick with that if you ask me
Golden Buddah. A radiant Statue, and a beautiful temple. Would always recommend a guided tour .You can take a package to include more places for sightseeing.

Wat Traimit – The Temple of the Golden Buddha. The Golden Buddha temple is located near Chinatown and houses the world's largest solid gold statue. The Buddha is nearly five meters in height and weighs five and a half tons. The origins of the statue are uncertain but the style of making suggests that it was made in the 13th – 14th century. At some point, the statue was disguised from invading armies to prevent it from being stolen. It was covered with a thick layer of stucco, which was painted and inlaid with bits of colored glass. The statue remained this way for over 600 years and was discovered in the year 1955 by accident, when it was accidentally dropped as it was being moved, revealing, under a casing of plaster, a beautiful solid gold Buddha. Pieces of the actual plaster are also on public display.
Interesting temple. It is a nice temple with interesting history. It has a quite atmosphere like other temples. It worth the visit

Opulence and Magnificence . The History of this place is legendary. The statue is a classic example for deception as its original Gold form was disguised to keep enemy away for a lot of time.The Golden statue is huge @ 5.5 tons and is a must visit
5 Tonnes of gold.... Well worth the visit, amazing exhibit. No shoes are permitted to be worn inside the temple, which is typical for many Thai places
What you think of when you imagine Buddha!. This temple was my first stop in Bangkok. It did not disappoint. This was everything I imagined a temple with a golden Buddha would be!
Boring . Strange that a place of worship charges a fee to enter. Not memorable. Unless you're Buddhist, I wouldn't bother visiting it.

The golden Buddha. I was amazed with the 5.5 ton golden Buddha at the temple. The thing that fascinated me most was that it was covered in plaster and it was discovered by incident. How can you cover a 5.5 ton golden statue in plaster and not tell anyone?!
Nice but crowded. Lots of peoplr all day long. No matter if you are there on a weekend or during the week. Architecture is nice and all is well maintained. Not the most impressed by it.

Thailand . So beautiful and serene.
Just slowly wander around the grounds and enjoy the peace within the temples.
Remember though no shorts or sleeveless tee shirts and always remove your footwear....
Wonderfull Temple. it was the first temple I visit in Bangkok and probably the best. A place to see and think. Magnific decoration
Awe Inspiring. Must visit. Take in the magnificent typical architecture and massive tower. Although gets crowded, not at all difficult to find peace.
Mus tvisit place. nice temple. if you are going to Bangkok so do not forget to visit this place. awesome place in heart of city.

Nice easy temple . Close to China town central train station, and the mrt station hua lampong.
Has markets surrounding it.
Easy to get around.
Centrally located
Great place to visit. If your heading to China town.
Go at night its all lit up and beautiful. We stopped by during a food tour by tuk yuk and it was beautifully lit up and there were almost no people there.
Just a statue. The only thing to see here is the main statue. Nothing else is worth seeing. Just a small tower with a golden Buddha in it.
Lovely place . This is a great place in bkk and is a must see. Highly recommended if combined with other visits. Few hours to half day would be good.

Its amazing. To come to Bangkok and not see any of the temples is controversial at least.
This place is one of the must do's. Be in awe with your senses.
Just take in everything and don't rush.

Worth a Look. Didn't go inside the temple but it is worth seeing. It is located not far from the MRT. After looking around, we took a quick taxi ride over to Steve's Cusine on the river for a fabulous dinner.
Near to Hualampong and Chinatown. The temple is located near to Hualampong MRT station and Chinatown. Worth a visit if around, need to climb some stairs after taking the ticket for 40 THB

Golden Buddha Temple. Marvelous temple with the Golden Buddha Statue at the top. Entrance is paid. There is a currency exchange near the cash desk. In my opinion: one of "must see" temples in Bangkok. Warning: shoes are to be left outside under the open sky,

Full of restaurants. Went there to get fun in kidzania, but i was astonished by the shops and people who were there, alooooot but not crowded, no outlet or any cheap shops only original goods and amazing food.
Very beautiful. It is a fab statue in Gold. The temple is serene and pretty. Ticker purchasing sign posting all be dispalyed but could be clearer.
Real beauty. A beautiful temple, thet3s a lot in Thailand but this is worth a visit. Avoid lunch time with the big Chinese tour groups.
Must visit when in Bagkok. Great place to visit. The building is not very old, but the Golden Buddha is. Read the story before you go there. It is better to learn about it to appreciate the tour

Nice temple. Nice temple to visit, much smaller grounds than others, with the golden Buddha on the 4th floor. An impressive statue. Good for kids to learn about the culture and religion in other countries.
Having visited other temples,I recall the reclining Buddha as having a much larger space and grounds.
Nice experience overall.

Temple Tour - First and Best Stop. My favorite Wat during my tour.I did a day tour and stopped to see many of the Wat's in Bangkok on a Saturday. The grounds are very pretty and the craftsmanship is incredible, It is fascinating to see these temples and Buddhas - make sure to dress appropriately. You are outside and it is hot and humid. You will sweat - a lot in August.
great place with great views. the wife loves visiting these kind of places and this one I also enjoyed, the golden Buddha was stunning and the site offers great views of BK.
So much of Gold. its a gold and gold and gold nice architecture and good place to photography 1 time visit place.....

Beautiful complex. Our first temple so very impressed. The signage and attitude of the people about the removal of shoes could be better - people were being snapped at quite rudely and out of character for most Thai people. I understand but if it is SO important the signage and general set-up could be better.
Views. Lovely temple of the golden buddha and has some nice views. Must visit place in the city of Bangkok.
The Buddha is spectacularly casted. Bangkok has so many things to see, but a visit to see this golden Buddha should be on everyone bucket list. You must dress properly if you want to go inside.

Beautiful temple with golden Buddha. Wat Traimit is a beautiful place to see in Bangkok. After many other temples I still think this is one of the most beautiful. Do not forget to wear proper clothes (long skirt and something with sleeves) and try to come in the morning as there are not too many people early in the day.

Good for Pictures but gets boring quick. Was a great experience for the sake of taking pics, but after the pic there isn't much else to do. I was with a tour group so found myself waiting on the bench for everyone to finish. Of course its very hot and not many shaded areas so wear a hat. Also I heard the PA system say to beware of pick pocketers that were there but I didn't have any encounter or bad experience while there.......Just bored out of my mind.

Good start for China Town. Famous for Abbot, who gave blessings to Leicester City and they were Premier League Champion. Wat Traimitr is famous for many things. Of course the highlight is the largest Golden Buddha, to which you need to climb stairs. But don't worry, There is an elevator for tourist. But you won't be allowed to use it in case there is a ceremony as it is located in the ceremonial room. But the stairs are not too high to reach. Most of people made it. There is also an exhibition about China Town, which almost all tourists skip. Wat Traimit is a good start for a trip to China Town. There are many tourists from India and China but in acceptable number. Not so overwhelming like Grand Palace
beautiful!!. definitely a must visit site.centrally located,crowded.huge gold budha. the architecture is very nice

Most see!. Like we said. We loved Thailand, so all we said is good things about it. This temple is impressive, the golden Buddha is stunning which so much history. This place has three floors which you have to pay per each. We always travel "low Cost" so we decided to visit the Golden Buddha's floor and it was breath taking. Lots of turists, so be patience!

Free and beautiful in evening. We were taken to golden Buddha temple by a dubious tuk tuk, but it was free entry and worth a wonder around to see the massive golden Buddha. Particularly good photos near sunset.Be careful of the many scam artists in the area. Thai people do not naturally talk to you and avoid being sold anything - walk away and say No.

Awesome temple and Buddha. This is a very busy temple with many tourists and followers wanting to cast their eyes on such a magnificent statue of Buddha . We were in a tour group so our guide bought the tickets (allows you to visit the museum, Buddha statue itself is free she told us).Men and women need to have their shoulders covered so most tours will provide something and you need to have down to the knees covered too. You may be refused entry if you don't meet these requirements. You also have to take off your shoes to enter the area where the statue is.There are so many people that you go up 1 side and down the other. They also try to keep people moving so if you're a tourist you'll only get a few minutes to look at it. You can get some nice photos as you walk around the statue.
peace of mind. A high well furnished and looking simply best gold statuefeeling very cool, blessed and best artwork

Sold gold Buddha image. As we happened to be in Chinatown, we stopped at Wat Traimit. The temple while not that remarkable houses the world's largest solid gold Buddha image. Steps lead up the four storey temple which also has an exhibition centre on the second and third floor.

Beautiful temple!. The temple is in a great condition. It lies in the center of the city and is a must-see when visiting Bangkok. Do bring comfortable shoes as it you have to take them off entering buildings.
Golden Buda!. The statue of the golden Buda, although small in comparison with other sites. Bangkok, is significantly more brilliant and it,s worth a visit!

A Glorious Serendipity . I have visited many times, the last to escort a friend, and it is just a fabulous place. Very cramped as most inner Bangkok temples are we had our driver park away from the temple.Serendipity - read the history!
"Beautiful Temple". Beauty Temple is situated in the heart of the city, amazing experience!!!! I recommend this fantastic site.

Solid gold Buddha. Where else are you going to see a large solid gold buddha. This is well worth the trip and the museum portion where you learn about making the buddha is interesting as well and only costs a little bit more. Highly recommend.

Interesting aspect of culture to see but hot and crowded.. It gets very hot and crowded here. You will be expected to dress appropriately for a temple. For your own sake, wear shoes that are easy to put on and take off (e.g. flip flops) because you'll be in and out of them as you go into the buildings.

Another temple. I am not a temple kind of guy. I dont like seeing stuff like this. But its one of those things that you have to check off in a visit. Not going to visit any other temple again. All look the same. Sorry for any offence.

The Golden Buddha is impressive and a must see if in Bangkok. After spending the day touring the ruins, our visit to the Golden Buddha was a great way to end the day. It was the weekend of the Queen's Birthday so there were many events planned around the Golden Buddha. With it being a holiday weekend, the crowds were a bit large but we were fortunate enough to have the opportunity to get up close and it is an amazing site. The temple is well cared for and even though it was crowded, all of the people were courteous. There is an elevator for those who can not climb the steps. This is great for families and couples. There are great views of the surrounding area including Chinatown.
have a short look. Was here in August 2016. not many tourists where there so it was very nice. If you have spare time could go there.
Another must see Temple. There are many Temples in Bangkok, Thailand but this is another one that is not to be missed, it is located right in the center of town and easily accessible via a cab ride.
Great Thai Landmark. Its a magnificent temple with astounding architecture. It is surely worth a visit to understand the richness of the Thai culture and architecture
under construction. Despite this site being under construction it is still an awesome piece of history and architecture to see.
July 2015 - Thailand Trip. Great place to visit...even better when you have a guide providing information regarding the culture, religion, and construction process
Get your merits herre. This amazing temple located high above the ground requiring a ten minute hike up a couple of hundred stairs. Offers great views of the palace and surrounding area.
Not worth the visit. After viewing the grand palace and the reclining Buddha this is not worth the visit. It is one too many Buddhas to see. The reclining Buddha is a must see.
It's ok. It is a great place and you can see a 2-3 Meyers tall Buddha in gold. We were there before we saw the lying Buddha so we had not comparison.

Small temple with a nice story . The Wat Traimit can be found at the edge of Chinatown. It's not a primal aim for tourists in Bangkok, but even that cannot hold back the many busses with tourists going there day by day, mostly connected to a Chinatown-Day-Tour.If you want this place "all for yourself" you should do it in the morning at opening time. In the morning it's also easier to walk up all the steps than around noon.

Yet another Buddha temple. Bangkok and Thailand are so full of Buddha temples that you can soon lose track of which you've visited and which of them you haven't. Most temples are similar too. This one has a golden statue of The Buddha right on the middle and to reach this, you'll have to climb two floors. After seeing more temples earlier, all I could do was make a whirlwind dash around this temple and get back into my taxi. All temples in Bangkok are good!
Pure gold statue. Pure gold statue of budha inside the Temple . Musuem inside depicts the story of making and discovery of this sturcure.

Nice temple. We visited the temple although it is not the most impressive one in Bangkok but temples stay interesting, not only to watch the temple but also watching what goes on...There were people that put shoes in the wrong place in the guard threw them over the edge of the temple...individual shoes on opposite sites! Nothing to be afraid of if you put your shoes in the regular place. Just funny!

Put this on your list... I would add this to your list of temples to visit. Take time to go to the museum, it is included in the ticket, to get the idea of how the Golden Buddha was discovered and transferred. Children have free admission! Yay! This Buddha is amazing and you can actually get up close. This is a smaller temple, might want to visit early to avoid the crowds. Again remember to cover up.

Really good. This was one of our first tour of tours, the temple was for me amazing, looking at that Buddha sitting there in all that gold, I could of looked at it all day, I just love anything that has to do with Buddhas

nice temple but i think entrance is pricey. we entered the temple by 2 and then with our guide by 1200Bht (600 per pax) which is i think too pricey just to view the Golden Buddha. The view on top was nice and the Golden Buddha too. still worth an experience

Finally managed to get there!. I have been to BKK 5 times and for one or another reason I had never been able to visit the Golden Mountain. On our last visit we arrived in the afternoon so as soon as we left our luggage at the hotel we decided to go there straight. From MBK shopping mall it took around 30-40 mins by walk, even though if you hurry up it could take less. The street was so packed with cars that i suppose it would take less just to walk there. We arrived, paid the small entrance fee and quickly walked our way to the top; the mountain has an amazing 360-degree view over the city and if you go there at dusk you will be able to shoot amazing pictures, or relax at the bar at the bottom of the structure which offers good coffees and teas. Definitely a must if you have time and want to have a good view of the city

Visit. Truly awe inspiring. The gold and silver. The colours the architecture and the beautiful Buddha's. We spent hours going around looking and photographing. We had some beautiful teas and I even had my fortune told. This old man knew me better than I did myself and several predictions have come to pass. The whole afternoon was inspiring. Souveniers are really expensive.

Beautiful Temple in China Town. This Temple was close to our hotel The Shanghai Mansion in China Town and was a fantastic and peaceful escape from the street outside. Golden Buddha is amazing and we would just sit in the surrounding area taking shade from the extremely hot sun and soak up the atmosphere and serene surroundings. We visited on a couple of occasions as it was so peaceful. We were lucky to hear the Buddhist Monks praying and really loved this place.
Beautiful . Amazing history. We did both the museum and Buddha. The only way to do it and understand the history is if you do both of them. Lovely place!
Been there by chance. I t was included in my package so I had to go there . But the place didn't disappoint me , the photos clicked here come out be vibrant and colourful

Must place to visit in Bangkok. This is a Must place to visit in Bangkok. Beautiful Temple in the City, great location for taking pictures. Tip: Go early in the morning to avoid traffic if going via Car.

Unbelievable Buddha statue made of gold. Apparently the Buddha statue is made of 5500 kg of solid gold! Worth the visit just to see this. The temple is located in China town. If you take the Ferry, be prepared to walk at least 15 to 20 minutes. On a hot summer day it can be a tough ask in Bangkok.

Good insight to Thai history. This temple seems to be very accommodating to tourist esp English speaking. Buy your tickets at the ticket office for 140 thb for the full exhibition and golden Buddha which was a lot less than I was expecting. If you are used to toilet paper then bring some tissues as there isn't any. Souvenir shop also reasonably priced.

Very special place. Loved this place. The Buddha statue is amazing and very special. Loved the museum about the statue, and the story of how it was discovered under the plaster. Unfortunately I didn't leave my shoes outside with everyone else. I removed them from my feet, but carried them inside, and got yelled at and told to leave, which spoilt the visit a little, but I was there long enough to feel the special energy in the room. I didn't see any signs saying to remove my shoes, and other places provided a bag for the shoes, perhaps they need to be more specific with their signage? The place is pretty crowded and there is lots of steep stairs, but well worth the visit. It is only a short walk from the Hua Lamphong train station.

amazing. it's so hard to think that all of Thai people have contributed to this huge statue with their gold and their belongings. such a generous and devout population. the temple is worth a visit. Many temples are similar but this one holds a very special statue and I recommend seeing it
Unbelievable . No words to describe the feeling and the energy that you feel in those type of places loved it!! I was so impressed. It's just such a beautiful arquitecture.

Golden Buddha in China Town Temple with Chinese Museum. By the Entrance to China Town in Bangkok, stand this Golden Buddha in this Temple, and the Chinese Museum ! Learning Chinese history migration and pay respect to the Buddha and admire the beauty of this Buddha.
What an amazing place. truly beautiful place. The architecture is great. If you want to take good pictures, make sure you go very early or there will be many too many people around.

Essential to pack. As we went in the rainy season I took an umbrella, but I used it more for the sun, so don't go without one and U V protected too, also a small hand torch very useful for the plane and in the night time in your hotel room

Interesting, serene. We arrived here just after opening and it was very serene and pleasant to walk around whilst the day was a little cooler. We were probably only here for about 40 minutes but for us it was enough.

Golden Buddha. Location is in China town.Specials; Buddha statue made by real good meter and holy praying.Tour combination with another temple such as What Poa( Big Buddha ) and Benchamabhopit temple ( marble temple).Operation time: morning and afternoon tour.Duration; half day tour.Tai mit temple is one of temple famous and popular visit place.Talon travel is one of travel agent needs to guarantee this is your value holiday.

Stunning Temple of the Golden Buddha. This temple is by far one of my favorites in Bangkok! All the detail around is beautiful and calming. Ladies be sure to bring a wrap or bring extra clothes to cover open arms or legs because they are very strict about that. Or they have wraps you can rent for 20 baht. Great temple, worth the visit!
Amazing Temple of the Golden Buddha. The vibe of the temple is so positive and it definitely calms us down after a hard days work and it's beautiful too.

My Favorite Temple to Visit. When I first went, this incredible statue was in a concrete squat room, but a few years back they built a proper beautiful temple to house the Golden Buddha. It's my favorite because many others are amazing (Wat Po/Grand Palace, Wat Arun, etc.) but expansive and busy. I'll never forget seeing the Crown Jewels in London. You file through this long line through rooms where screens are playing documentaries and videos of the jewels close up, spinning around, from all angles. After 30 minutes of this, you finally get to see the jewels and it's a letdown after all the buildup and seeing the photos and videos nonstop. This one gets right to the point. 2 flights of stairs in a relatively small temple puts you face to face with the goods: A giant buddha statue made entirely of gold. It's simple but elegant and mindblowing to realize you are standing in front of possibly the single most valuable item you will see in your life. I try and swing by every time I'm in Bangkok, just for a quick glance and to be blown away again!

A nice temple in China Town. This is beautiful temple and less touristy than others. Entrance fee is very cheap, 40Baht only. The golden Buddha is stunning. You can climb up the stair to see city view. Located right in the center of China Town, it is easy for shopping and eating. You should come here early to see locals spraying, then walk around this peaceful area!

Small but still amazing. A short visit. A very nice temple. The Golden Buddha is amazing. We visited the Temple and then walked over to Chinatown for the day. If you are in the area do not miss this Temple.

A China Town Temple. If you are in China Town (Yarawat) you might as well stop here. By this time you may have seen a 1000 temples with Buddhas and this will be another one. I like it. It is less touristy than other temples and you will see people praying.
Amazing ... Lovely to visit, super photo oppotunities and again very interesting historically..easy to find, quite a busy area

Will always be in my heart and soul. It was truly spiritual. That is so not like me to write this but I've never met a monk who beamed happiness. It was truly remarkable.
The golden Buddha is stunning, breathing. So far it has been my favorite temple so far in all of Thailand. It impressive in size but intimate. I'd certainly recommend a visit

Short visit. At 40 Bhat very cheap to see,but not a lot of time required to see everything. My advice would be go early and then you can combine with other activities.
Really easy to get to on the MRT plus 5 minutes easy walk
Easy to find . Walk about the area. This is very good to see. The price is cheap. Locals go for free. The place so clean.
My favorite temple. This is simply a beautiful temple and I am so happy I was able to visit. I got a lot of very good pictures in this temple. Climb the stair and see the city view.
Good place to see. This is located in the city center and it is very easy to locate and it takes few minutes to visit. and they charge you an entrance ticket.

Who says size doesn't matter?. The temple contains the world's largest gold statue. The golden Buddha weighs over 5 tonnes and is more than 3 metres tall. It is worth visiting just to see all that gold. The temple is also quite impressive.
A must see in Bangkok. 5500 kg of gold, an interesting story about this statue. When visiting China town in Bangkok, make sure you don't miss this place.
A historic temple. A very historic temple which has a massive golden buddah statue. Well kept. Beautiful surroundings and exhibitions. A must see for tourists and travellers.
Pretty amazing. In some respects there are no words to describe seeing all these various temples, there is some amazing architecture and beautiful decorative designs to see.

Smallish temple with beautiful adornments, beware the scams. I only had a short time in Bangkok, so I couldn't do all of the big attractions, so I settled for this nice temple, adorned with gold. It's not huge but makes for a perfect beginning-of-the-day excursion.Two important scams I'd like to mention (these apply for other attractions and not just this one): if a taxi/tuk-tuk driver tells you the attraction is closed, ignore them, it's a common scam to get you to go to a different location and drive around for ages with them.Second one: don't pay to free the caged birds. It's horrible for animal lovers to accept, but they'll just catch more and encourage their friends to do the same. Better to not support them at all and make the practice die off.

Inspired . There is a few stories on how this budah came to be. But one thing is for sure during the time of invasion it was hidden with stucko and then forgoten about. That says a lot on about the true meaning of seclusion and being closer to spiritual things than earthly.
Well worth the walk up the stairs. A lovely Buddha in China town. Beautiful to say the least and being gold worth 30+ million pounds. Only disappointment was all the donation boxes around the buddah
Nice start to Chinatown . Visited here on my first trip to Bangkok. I was staying in chinatown so this was right next door. Really beautiful and peaceful surroundings

So nice. The temple has nice architecture design and the golden buddha is located at the 3rd floor of the temple so you have to climb the stairs to get there. Definitely a must see when in Bangkok. Ticket price to see golden buddha is 40 baht and for the exhibition is 100 baht which is at the 2nd floor of the temple. For women long clothes is required shirt with sleeves and long pants or long skirt so show respect when going inside the temple.
Impressive. Great place. Always crowded with temples but the place itself was beautiful.Not sure if the price was free since I went on a guided tour.

Awesome!. Our visit to the temple of the Golden Buddha was excellent. It's well worth a visit. There were visitor there to view to pray and to leave offerings. The garlands of marigolds were exquisite.

Nora buri hotel Koh Samui thailand. Excellent hotel. Staff were very polite and helpful. Food was great too. An added bonus was the management. Welcoming. Cocktail party with a live band and complimentary cocktails and canopes.Particular praise for the front of house manager Noon who was excellent in dealing with a sensitive issue and upgraded us to private pool villa. A thoroughly enjoyable
holy buddha. This has a statue of lord made out of 550 kgs of gold.Its unique and a must go.It gives holy water for BAHT20.must take that.

The best Buddha! . This wat is easy to get to and a bargain at only 40baht (just for the Buddha) a newer temple but still beautiful the golden Buddha is amazing! It's made from solid gold and so we were expecting him to be tiny, this was not the case!

Beautiful!!!. This was the first Budda we saw when we came to Bangkok, and it was amazing.I recommend you go with a guide on a preplanned trip, our guide was great, she told us about the History of the Golden Budda which was fascinating, so when we finally saw the Golden Budda, we could really appreciate it and the story behind it.This is quite a short stop, you don't need long, but is worth checking out.
Cool but difficult navigation. We had a hard time finding the entrance and then finding the golden Buddha. Eventually we wandered enough to find it and it was pretty impressive.
Couldn't get in. Unfortunately can't enter if you are showing any flesh so make sure you have your arms and legs covered. You can purchase clothes nearby, but we had a busy itinerary.

A must see!. The Golden Buddha is magnificent. He is so huge that you cannot capture all of him in a photo! Our visit there was unforgettable.Watch out for pickpockets! Also tourists with selfie sticks!!!
Fascinating!. There are many Buddah statues to be seen around Thailand, and this is one of the ones that I remember the most.. beautiful and mesmerizing!

beautiful golden Buddha. We only went up to the 4th level to see the Golden Buddha and skipped the exhibits. The Buddha statue is very beautiful. Would definitely recommend this as one of the wats you should visit in Bangkok.
Mandatory. One of the classic temples in Bangkok, but I would dare to say that is it 'visitable' if you have time enough in the city, if not, do not leave other places to visit it.

Wonderfull. After 6 temples you would think we would be no longer impressed by the other, but we still were. Again the beauty and marvel blew us away. The temple in itself is relatively simple compared to the others but the Golden Buddha is worth the trip. This temple is located near China town where you can find plenty of delicious local food shops.

Golden Buddha temple. Amazing temple with an enormous Golden Buddha. It is interesting to hear the history of this Buddha and how it was hidden away for many years to keep it safe and for a long time people didn't realise it was made of gold. We visited after a walk through China Town after disembarking the Chao Praya express boat. Worth a visit!

Brilliant statue. Honestly, I wasn't expecting much: just a big, golden statue of Buddha. But damn, I was so wrong.The climb up costs 40 THB and takes a few minutes. Once you're up, you go inside a grand room with the statue right in the middle. As first impressions go, it's impressive, but as you go inside, it becomes amazing.It's not just the statue itself, it's the room too. The gates are ornately decorated with gold and offer a view of Bangkok that you won't get elsewhere.Definitely visit.

5.5 tonnes of solid gold. Like every traveller we all do our feedback in bulk so it gets really hard to decide what star value to attach to it allowing other travellers an insight into whether to go or not. To be honest stars are meaningless although stars do push attractions higher up the leader board. It's worthwhile 10 mins of your time as at the end of the day it's a large irreplaceable Buddha. The history behind it is interesting.

Inspiriation. This, and all temples in Bangkok, are worth a visit, at least once every two or three years! There are too many to review here, but any serious tourist needs to see at least three or four, sit quietly in the temple or under a tree on the grounds, and just feel the place. One excellent wat, with a remarkable collection of Buddha images, is Wat Benchamapophit. In the late lafternoon and evening after sundown, it is so moving. Oh, and I would recommend visiting any of these temples WITHOUT the capability of taking photos! But that is just me.
A place to visit for tourists. Don't miss it, this will be included in a most of the trips as a complimentary place to visit. Good place to get a view of the city too.

Very impressive. Our first temple of our trip and a very impressive experience. I would love to have seen them move it from the previous adjoining site. Glad we went with a guide who gave us a great deal of background information we might otherwise have missed

A Huge Golden Buddha. You should visit this place when you are in Bangkok. It contains a huge Golden Buddha inside. It is also near Bangkok's Chinatown so you can visit it after coming here. Note that selfie sticks are not allowed to be used inside the premises. You also need to remove your shoes before entering as this is a Sacred place.

simply beautiful. this temple is quite simple comparing to the others. but the Buddha statue is amazing. I came in the weekend, and the place is full with tourist. you should come earlier if wanted better pictures.

Impressive and Lovely. This is a must see while visiting BKK. The Golden Buddha is magnificent. The beauty and serenity it evokes is memorable and you will get this wonderful feeling of inner peace while gazing upon the majesty of the Golden Buddha.
Amazing place!. Amazing place especially those who likes arts and culture. Can see alot drawings on the wall and the change of guard as well! around 5pm
a LITTLE disappointed. Extremely crowded just to see the tiny Buddha. Still not sure what all the fuss was about. No pictures allowed.
Interesting visit. Lots of stairs to climb. Not much to see. Walked here from Grand Palace. Walked along a street where nearly all shops sold huge yellow candles and statues. Fascinating
inner peace. I visit the place because it was with the tour but after visiting it i was very impressed with the craftsmanship and cleanliness in temple. The maintenance was very very good.
Stunning, a must-see. Out of this world temple - so very beautiful. packed with people and very hot, but worth it. take lots of photos!

A must see in Bangkok. Absolutely amazing part of the Thai culture. The kids (18, 17, 16, 15, 10 & 5) and we really enjoyed it and made great pictures. Although it was very busy and very warm, we could see everything really well. Excellent education about the Buddhism. Great respect for the excellent shape of this historic monument. Our blond young boys were an attraction by themselves and were subject of a picture for many of the other tourists.

Beautiful!. This was the first temple we visited in Bangkok. It was beautiful and we even got a blessing from a monk! We went early morning but the temps were ridiculously hot, so having to walk barefoot from building to building was uncomfortable. The story of the Golden Buddha is an amazing one and the local were super polite.

The largest solid gold Buddha. Wow this place was amazing. Gorgeous white marble and allegedly one of the largest solid gold Buddhas in the world. A spectacular sight and interesting piece of culture and religion. As a pro photographer I really appreciated the opportunity to photograph such an interesting part of Buddhist faith.

Stunning. I know there are lots of temples in Bangkok but this one is definitely worth a visit and it's worth paying the little bit extra to get into the museum where you can learn the history of the Buddha and how it came to be here.The whole complex is fascinating and you would need to allow two to three hours to have a proper look round.Remember that you will need to remove your footwear when you enter any part of the temple and please remember to dress appropriately, unlike a couple of girls I saw who had short shorts and strappy tops on. It's a working temple and it causes offence to dress inappropriately, so give it some thought.

Should visit if you are in Bangkok. 10 minutes walking distance from Hua Lamphong MRT. Actually we felt a bit tire when we reach to temple, however after I reach inside the temple it make my mind very peaceful. Can donate 20Bhat and get a water bottle inside the temple.
Good. Good and worth watching40 bhats per head100bhats for museum. I took taxi from grand palace to wat treimet, took 100bhatsThanksArun

The earlier the better . The cost for this attraction on the time of this writing for tourist was 140 Bhat which is worth it. Firstly the architect of the building is stunning. From the first floor to the third, apon arriving to the top you will see a very big golden budda- the shiniest one you will probably see.I would personally recommend on going here asap as several tourist will pack the attraction by mid day and also the peak temperature will make it alittle bit hard to walk up the steps. More work and less enjoyment.Be warned for both male and female, suitable clothing must be worn or you can't go inside.

Beautiful Temple.. Its best to start your trip here off early in the morning, because as 12 oclock approaches it gets extremely busy, you need at least half an hour to really take in the beauty of this place, the golden buddha is awesome. The whole temple is fantstic, i definately recommend a trip here.

Stunningly beautiful centre of worship. Part of a half day tour. Arrived early in the day which was a good move as things got very busy by the time we left. The scale of the buddha and the opulence is almost beyond belief. A local guide is essential to understand the history and significance of this site.

Story of the Chinese coming to Thailand. Not only is the Golden Buddha amazing here, but the museum underneath is great if you are into history. It tells how and why the Chinese first started coming to Thailand, then it follows how they started changing Thailand. It also tells of how they got an object that weighs so much into the building.
amaizing. you can not visit bangkok without going to the themple where they have the biggest golden Buddha image...
Excellent. Just great, another well presented site with great history and worth the time to visit when in Bangkok

worth the visit. the architecture is very unique. with colorful glasses, the whole place is very shinny! a popular place among tourists but its a must go. watch out not to burn your feet especially in the afternoon when you need to take off your shoes.

Beautiful Temple - Golden Buddha -Should Not Miss. The temple of Wat Tramit as the name says in Thai is the Temple of Golden Buddha. It was beautiful and was worth the visit. Lots of local architecture which was very pleasant to the eyes. Ticket price was 100 baht per person. Its a tall temple and single building. It doesn't have a compound or a garden where you can take a stroll.Photography in the temple was also allowed unlike The Temple of Emerald Buddha. FYI we covered four temples in one day with ease:1) Wat Pho (The Temple of Reclining Buddha)2) Wat Traimitr (The temple of Golden Budhha)3) The Grand Palace & The Temple of the Emerald Buddha (Wat Pra Kaew)4) Wat Benchamabopith (The Marble Temple) - The The marble temple was the smallest and least picturesque though the Budhha Idol inside was equally mesmerizing. It can be skipped if you are time constraint.We paid 1500 Baht to the taxi driver who stayed with us for the whole day. You need not hire any tour guide to visit the temples, just a reliable taxi driver will do ( we were 4 adults and 2 children, so hired a Toyota Innova). We were free by 1600 hrs.This temple is definitely worth the visit. You should not miss.
Outstanding . Went on a trip visiting most of the buddas & temples in Bangkok with Travelbag/Tour east. A long morning because of the horrendous traffic but well worth the visit.
Good views. This is a tall temple so good views of the city from here. Found it to be a bit busy but I suppose they all are.

Big Buddha!. This was a beautiful big buddha. Be aware that you do have to pay to go to the top, but I think it was around 100-150 baht per person (exchange rate at the time for us was 1 USD = 34 baht). We just went up to the top of the temple and saw the buddha, then headed out. On the lower levels there are more educational rooms, but that was an extra 50-100 baht and this was the last temple of our trip, so we were a little worn out. Definitely worth a visit!

Beautiful . We walked through China Town to the Temple which itself is an adventure and worth doing as you get to see the market . The Buddha is very beautiful and well worth a visit there is allot of information about it and a museum underneath .

must visit. the tempkle itself is serene and the idol is one of the most beautiful i have seen. you are to maintain silence in its surroundings. outside the temple though you will see a lot of people mostly tourist. there is another temple int he complex which is also lovely. dont miss it

AMAZING!. The Golden Buddha is one of the treasures of Bangkok. It is probably the largest lump of gold in the world. At over five tons, its gold value alone exceeds $100 million. The story of its discovery (from under a plastered shell) is well known, but , just the same, it must be seen to be believed. It is near Hualamphong Train Station, so if you are going anywhere by train, stop by and take a look .You'll never forget the experience!For us: AMAZING!!!

great. nice. we have a wishing pot. and we can add tinkling bells and the inner sanctum is great. however you must cover your shoulders and knees before entering. no sleeveless or dress please. yo wont be allowed to enter
Worth to Visit. Many classic BKK city tour include that place. You must visit that place, don't forget unwear your sandals or shoes. You must pay less expensive ticket cost.
Worthy visit. Nice place to explore with family. China Market is nearby and can be a good place for shopping. Specially the street foods on surrounding places are excellent.
stunning!. loved this temple, make sure you read the signs properly, and remove your shoes if you are in the temple, also wear modest clothing so you do not offend anyone. stunning temple
Amazing to see . Really nice temple and not as busy as the other main attractions in Bangkok, you have to pay to enter but is worth it, amazing gold inside.

A place to visit in BKK. You must visit this place when you are in BKK. Though, this is little expensive, but worth visiting there and spend few hours. Please visit by yourself rather relay on individuals as there are so many sub agents get engaged on business.
Golden temple!. Great sightseeing spot, came here on a sunny day and all the gold covered temple was shining, it was incredible, great great place!

One of the Wonders of the World. A stop arranged by our private guide (arranged by the concierge at Le Meridien). You would be remiss to not take advantage of time in Bangkok and miss this and any of the other magnificent Temples.
Must visit if going to Bangkok. If visiting Bangkok you must visit this temple. Also it is included in your city tour if already opted for. Lift facility is also available in the temple.
Move along. Maybe I was tired by this point but there was really not much to see here. Save yourself the time and go eat somewhere nice.

Must see. This is a very nice attraction. The area and people around are nice. You will find a little market at the bottom of the Temple where you can buy souvenirs at very fair price. To get to see the Golden Buddha, you will have to climb stairs (about 3 or 4 story) and will have to take off your shoes and leave them outside the Temple. Make sure to cover your legs and arms before going in Temple.

Must visit place in Chinatown . The temple is within walking distance from Hua lamphong train station, MRT Hua lomping station and Chinatown. From the train station cross the bridge to Mittaphap Thai-China road and the temple will be on your right. The place is also known as the golden buddha where they place the statue at the top of the building. At the second level, there is a The Bangkok Chinatown heritage centre and the exhibition of the golden buddha.

Tibet style with history. When we first saw the vulga birds ststue we don't know what it means. The history of cholora which had made 1/10th of the city died in 1880 and putting bodies there attracting birds is a sad story. Stairs to top of pagoda of 344 steps is a tibet style road with bells of various size to ring. Sounds of small bells form umbrella of pagoda is nature's music.

Fabulous and close to station for quick visit. Beautiful temple, remember to cover up if not you can still hire a scarf and return it to the office. It is in an easy to reach and convenient location from the train station so you can just walk it. A good aside visit if in the area.
Worth a visit . The size of the Buddha Statue is amazing.A very lovely experience going there, if you do not visit the exhibitions there you are done in 30 minutes.Quite a crowded place!
Local attraction in Central Bangkok. Temple conveniently located near public transportation and local shopping in Central Bangkok. Within walking distance of Centra Central Station hotel.
Do not miss this beauty. This was not originally on our itinerary but our guide thought we would like it and she was right. It's just a gorgeous sight to behold.
Fantastic scenery!. This was one of the temples that I liked the most. Not only the temple itself is really amazing but also as you go up the montain you have a really nice view of the city.

Ok but not amazing. Nice to see if you're in the Chinatown area, but not worth travelling to from far away. I didn't go into the museum, just went to golden buddha at top as each section is an extra cost. This place didn't feel as spiritually potent as some of the other temples in Bangkok but seemed to be more of a tourist attraction.

Golden Buddha is impressive. This temple has a beautiful Buddha to see, but also has a great museum experience. Our guide took us from hotel around 7am and it was great so quiet we got loads of pictures and we got to see locals praying which was amazing to watch them.

Must Visit. This is the starting point of Chinatown , it's a must stop . This place is near to Hua Lamphong metro station The temple structure is quite big and it has the golden Buddha. It looks fantastic and quite mesmerising. The view from the top looks super. You can have a view of the China Gate from the top. A must visit for all tourist
Five ton sold Buddha!. This is worth a stop, definitely, and it's very near Chinatown. The story of the Buddha's discovery is fascinating and the site is lovely.
Very nice temple. This was the first, of many, temples we would visit. It is a nice location on a hill and has an interesting history.

Wow. I have been to Bangkok many times but Never had visited this Wat. This time with my family we visited the Golden Temple and felt the WOW in feeling it. Simply the size of the Buddha, it's heritage and history and the wars it had withstood and now to see it in its glory was Wow.

Well worth the trip!. A little out of the way but we used it as an opportunity to get a Tuk Tuk from the river, it only took around 10-15 mins and was an adventure my 9 year old daughter loved. Once there get the tickets and its worth going round the displays on the lower floors to get the full story of the history of the Golden Buddha and how it came to be there, its fascinating. Once you see the statue it takes your breath away to imagine that much solid gold in 1 place and the glow is so different to the hundreds of other Buddhas you see around. Great little trip.
Its free!. Crowded but free. Great for the first stop of your trip. It gives you a taste of what the other temples are like.

Must do of in Bangkok!!!. It's larger than expected. Wasn't over crowded, has a small mat for prayer if you want.Nice place to relax for a bit and regain your energy after all the exploring you've been doing of Bangkok!
fantastic day out. really enjoyed visiting the golden buddha a must see, just beware of thai men ripping you off, some people are not so lucky, recommended day out tho.

Big, Bold and Calming . In the start of the hustle and bustle of China Town is the temple of the golden Buddha. The temple itself serves as a calming feature to the area. The Buddha statue is magnificent to see with so much history attached to it. A must see during travels to various temples across Bangkok

It is really golden 5 tonns of gold. . location worth visiting is the must seen. It is best with a guide to know the real story of the temple and the monks who live there. Because the celebrity of thr location is pretty crowded but visit worthit.

Golden and Spectacular! . The Temple is amazing and definitely worth a visit. The Temple is a place of worship, so being respectful is a must. The Buddha is amazing and the story behind it is worth noting.
Ideal for cultural insights . Entertaining and worth the price. Rich cultural of the Chinese history in Thailand. Would recommend some time. Unexpected discovery.

Beautiful temple. Went twice, the first day was near to the closing time, hence we did not have the chance to go in and weather was cloudy and rainy. Went the second time early in the morning, perfect timing for capturing pictures with bright skies and temple as the background.

Biggest Golden Buddha in the world. While in Bangkok make sure to check out this amazing Golden Buddha. Don't forget to pick up a flyer with the history of the Buddha while purchasing a ticket because it's history is really interesting. You're allowed to take pictures of the Buddha but filming/video cams and monopods and tripods are not allowed.

Interesting History. The Golden Buddah seemed to be created during the 13-14th century.Then invadors came to take over other territories, and the now Golden Buddah statue was completely covered with a thick lawyer of plaster stucco, painted, and decorated with different color glass. This done to prevent the statue from being stolen by the enemy. It worked, for many years it sat untouched.In the beginning of the 18th century when Bangkok was established as a new capital, the Buddah was brought there. During the middle of the 18th century they decided to move it to a new place, and while they were transferring the statue one of the chains broke and the Buddah fell to the ground and was cracked.While inspecting the damage the people noticed a gold color under the plaster and with great care they discovered the figure was indeed made out of gold!In 2010 the Golden Buddah was brought to its new home, The Wat Traimit Temple where it now reside.It's good to know the history of the Temple's you visit. It makes it a more interesting visit.
Very Nice and Peaceful place of Buddist. Peaceful place of Buddhist and very near to ChinaTown and also Railway station Hua Lamphong (around 0.4km).
No Selfies Here. Selfies with the main idol are forbidden, but ask a friend and get photographed with the idol in the frame - no questions asked!

Peace. Peaceful and always a wander wonder amidst the cityscapes. This historic place is one best Buddhist monastery's visit with musuem inside the storey.
This place rejuvenates from hectic city tour. Peace of mind.
Excellant place to visit. One of the must see places in bangkok,if you can manage to reach there on time through the notorious traffic condition of bangkok.
Beautiful place. Very nice and beautiful, the architecture is amazing along with all the greenery and water around...recommend it when visiting Bangkok.

Very peaceful. went there with my friends yesterday and this place was included in my tour package although the entry ticket is just 40 bahts and you can see two buildings one is old n other one is the bigger one

has a little more than just buddhas. I quite like that i stumbled across this temple....whilst it has a big golden buddha as its centrepiece on the top level...it also has a museum area charting the history of the area and early chinese migrants....and it was so informative...make a nice change from a place where you just snap a few customary pics.
private tour of temples well worth it. we visited three temples including guided tour including entrances fees , very informative, well worth the money.
Beautiful. The buildings are beautiful, giving one a perspective on history and calm reflection even when busy. Well worth seeing.
Wonderful photo taking. Do not miss this temple at all in Bangkok. Make sure that it is on your travel agenda -- and be respectful and take off your shoes before entering the temple.

Nice temple. This temple ticket cost only rs.40 bht. Dont get cheated with someone. I have send the pic of the ticket. Temple is nice. Dont wear cut sleeves in this temple or otherwise take a scarf from there to cover ur arms. Scarf cost 20 bht. So better not to wear cut sleeves while visiting to temple.
Golden Budha. Temple with golden budha.. full with tourist, there a money changer here u can buy something like mini stupa, budha

Temple of the Golden Buddha. Fine statue of Buddha made up of solid gold. Its near china town.
Nice architecture and scenic view from temple top.

Worth the minimal cost. This is a nice, moderately crowded temple with a very large, golden buddha inside. I was disappointed with the small size of the emerald buddha, so this was a pleasant surprise.

Get your spirit on. A delightful and unique place. Go and be respectful. Admission is quite cheap (20B) and once you climb the stairs there are drinks. Just remember to keep climbing until you are absolutely at the top.

Finally the have a suitable building for this incredible find. When I first saw this back in 1999 from what I can remember there was this gold Buddha in a white room, can’t even remember it being in a temple or much of a temple back then. The Buddha was just sitting there in this dirty white room and I knew the story about it and I knew it was a huge 5.5 ton gold statue made entirely of gold, made in the 13th or 14th century and covered in plaster until 1954 when someone chipped the plaster and saw a glint of gold. I remember thinking what an incredible find that was and that I was probably looking at the largest pure gold Buddha in the world and I think there was like one unarmed guard in the room. I guess they figured no one could possibly steal it. Well on 14 February 2010, a large new building was inaugurated at the Wat Traimit Temple to house the Gold Buddha. Now the temple fits the significance of the find. They have a very nice exhibition on a couple of the lower floors about Chinese immigration to Thailand and the Gold Buddha is on the 4th or top floor. According to Wikipedia there’s suppose to be an exhibition on the origin of the Gold Buddha but I did not see it. It’s really important to have this information in an exhibit since it’s so interesting. The only info I saw was on my brochure. Anyway the temple is now fitting the Buddha and it’s amazing. I think if in Bangkok you should make every attempt to see this and the Chinese immigration exhibition is really quite good also. No guide books were available in English. I am going to give this five stars and I’m going to assume I missed the exhibition on the origin of the Gold Buddha.

That's nice. That's a nice temple and the golden Buddha is big, But it's not surprising like the Wat Pho. Next to the Train Station, it's some to do when you are around the station, go to Chinatown or when you already saw the other staff.
So shiny.... Easy to find (although a bit of a walk from the Chinatown pier!). Reasonable entry fee and definitely worth paying - the Buddha really is an incredible sight.
A MUST VISIT!. very interesting and peaceful place, has good shopping stall surrounding Buddha below the stairs. always compare between stalls some will try charge you too much always barter price.

Great visit for the first time traveler: a must to see. A great place to visit,understand the religion,culture and customs. a must for the first time traveller but for a returner.Get your tickets early in the morning. take the local boat .it is cheaper and that all you need. Worth a visit. Definitely worth visiting.We booked through viator before we went - you get guide who comes with you and explains everything..

Golden Buddha Wat Trimit.. Situated in the heart of Bangkok, thid Golden Buddha is made up of five and a half tons of Gold. One should wear appropriate clothes when visiting (Not too short). The exterior is gilded and has a fantastic exterior and interior. Walk able distance from Hua Lamphong Railway station /MRT station. Golden Buddha statue.
Golden Buddha Temple. Great place to go for a prayer or two, it is easy to access via public transport and the Statue made of pure gold is absolutely stunning!

Amazing. Very impressive. You can pray here. Its located near Chinatown. But seriously nothing much here than a temple with good design. Oh yeah and below it, there are museum that shows Bangkok from time to time.

Majestic temple!. It's such a shame that me and my wife missed seeing the inside of this temple ( we made it at 5.05pm and temple closes sharp 5pm).
However, the walk around the temple was lovely and there are some local stalls that sells souvenirs for a cheap price right behind the temple.

Wat Traimit. Wat Traimit is a temple complex in the Chinatown area of Bangkok, just a block from the eastern entrance to Yaowarat Rd. The top shrine houses one of the largest solid gold Buddha images and is culturally and historically interesting. The Buddha image dates to the Sukhothai era of Thailand and was preserved from Burmese invasion and looting as it was plastered in stucco to hide its value from the invaders. The image only was discovered to be made of gold after the stucco broke off during an accident transporting the image some 50 years ago. Since then it sits within this temple. Admission is 40 baht. There is also a museum that covers the heritage of the Chinatown area and the Golden Buddha on a lower floor for an additional 100 baht. If you are in the area and not fatigued by the Buddha images seen in every Thai temple it may be worth a visit to see the Golden Buddha.

I wouldn’t bother (unless you’re going to Chinatown anyway). The temple structure of Wat Traimit is certainly impressive, a stepped pyramid rather like those ancient temples of Central America. There are museum displays inside the pyramid (extra admission charge) while the hall holding the Golden Buddha is on the top. Get ready for lots of stairs in the Bangkok heat unless you can find the lift tucked away at the back. From the top you get a good view of… Bangkok rooftops.We’re told the Buddha image is five tons of solid gold and who am I to disbelieve them, but after you’ve seen enough gilded statues this doesn’t actually look any different. There’s nothing special about the hall except that it’s quite small for a major temple and can be very crowded. The statue itself didn’t look anything special. In fact it was worse – the effects of harsh light coming in the doors can highlight features in a rather strange way that is exaggerated in photos. Some of mine came out as not just unattractive but with a Terminator look about them! (Out of respect I'm not posting any of those.)The temple is beside the entrance of Bangkok’s Chinatown and if you plan for your visit to include that area (and perhaps its Little India extension) then you might like to visit it. But I wouldn’t make the trip just for the temple. If you’re looking for somewhere to go having seen the “big three” temples by the river (Wats Phra Keaw, Pho, and Arun) I’d suggest Wat Benchamabophit, the “Marble Temple”. It’s interesting, very pleasant, and not over-run with visitors.

Golden Buddha Temple. A huge temple in the middle of Bangkok and nearby Chinatown. It was crowded and bustling and had an entry fee of 40bt. Only a stones throw from the Hua Lampong MRT station so it's pretty accessible by public transport.
very nice temple. its very big temple and very nice to watch . it have many ancient times sculptures and overall good time spend there.we went during evening time there.

Best time to go. Best time to go is just before closing cause if they let you in for free. We went approximately 30-40 minutes before they closed and they said we can go for free. Also you have to dress respectfully

Great Photo Opportunities. Visited the Temple of the Golden Buddha in May during a half day city tour of Bangkok; it get's extremely hot here (especially when you need to take your shoes off to enter the temple) so be careful! Beautiful temple and some great photo opportunities.
beauty. girls don't go in shorts or a dress home in long pants and mid length arm T-shirt they won't let you in. but it was beautiful
OK OK. It is advisable to visit this temple during non-traffic hour or use Motor Taxi to visit this place..! Because, during traffic time it will take almost 1 hour to cross couple of kilometres..!

Wow Spectactular. How wonderful this was, it is a must see for all walks of life.
The tour guide that was with us on the tour explained everything , and just very interesting.
When holidaying in other Countries, we live to see and hear about the Country we are visiting.
Take this tour and I am sure you will not be disappointed
Stunning Statues of Buddha. Worth a visit, inexpensive and good for a short walkabout. Use the river ferry to get there..very convenient and a short taxi ride
Good to see . It's a great place to see this temple make sure to wear flip flops because u have to carry them with u in a plastic bag inside.

Not the best temple to see. After a full week in Bangkok I saw a lot of temples with statues of Buddha. This one was cool, but probably the least eventful of the temples. The Chinese heritage museum on the floor beneath the gold buddha was pretty cool. If you go you should buy the ticket to see Buddha and the ticket to the museum.

Another "dont miss" Buddha. By the time you have finished touring South-East Asia, you have a good chance of developing "Buddha Burnout", but not from this one. The saga of how this solid gold statue survived invasions and wars is fascinating. It was made about 500 or 600 years ago, and about 250 years ago was covered in plaster to camouflage it and prevent it from being stolen during an invasion by the Burmese who subsequently invaded and destroyed the complex where it was. The statue languised in the ruins for years and aparently its golden origins were forgotten. It mover to several places before ending up in Bangkok bout 200 years ago. It weighs 5.5 tons so I found it hard to believe that anyone would have thought a plaster statue would be that heavy. After WW 2 it was being moved to a new temple and it fell on the ground and some of the plaster was knocked off and lo and behold, the gold Buddha emerged. It is beautifully cast and appears to have very little wear and tear for all of its trials and tribulations over the years. Worth seeing.

Only if want to see a Temple with an open Bangkok view. Not a place that worth the time to spend unless you want to see Bangkok from high. Entrance fee is cheap Baht20 only. Not conveniently located. Difficult to get a taxi which will accept to take you back to nearest BTS station. Close to Chinatown.
Its a golden Buddha. If you like temples it's a pretty good one they have a museum didn'd see it because I was too late.The golden Buddha itself yea it's a big Buddha lol.

Wow What a story. The Golden Buddha is in this temple by an accident, and one must surely ask the guide the story of how the idol reached here. A must visit place in the heart of China Town of Bangkok, A advice though visit it early in the morning to avoid China Town Rush......
Beautiful place and worth a stop. The story of this particular Buddha is interesting ... I won't give you a spoiler, but it is seriously impressive,

Stunning.. I found this spectacular with local people praying whilst we were there and monks blessing others. I found this truly spiritual and an amazing place. Our guide gave us a great history of the temple too.

Exhibition about the chinatown in Bangkok worth seeing. old time how Chinese into Bangkok, tools, foods, activities, all the displays in miniature and so real! feeling so "BACK TO OLD TIME HOME", enjoyed it very much with my old folks where they explains too and recall sweetest memories of their childhood. really great moments spent with my family

amazing. fantastic temple, so elaborate, I spend most of my time here just taking pictures, I would go back next time I'm in Bangkok

The Golden Buddha. Wonderful to see the 5.5 ton image from close quarters; secured by the faith of the faithful rather than iron walls and hi-fi security systems; recent compared to Wat Phra Keo and Wat Pho; Not as spectacular as Wat Arun; Do visit if you have time on hand.Minus: for senior citizens climbing up the stairs may be discouraging.
A mix of everything. At the top you will find the HUGE Buddha but on your way up, you can find the story of the Chinese immigrants and the beginning of Chinatown in which you have to pay it a visit.

Umissable, true gem in BKK. Perhaps it's not crowded as it should be (in my opinion) but that's a nice plus anyway. Please include this temple in your visit as this should not be missed.

Strongly recommended. Temple of golden Buddha is famous for its huge Buddha made of solid gold.As you enter the main gates walk straight past the shrine till you get to the ticket counter. Non interested individuals should go just for their selfies to the third floor and the pics from a height.For the wheel chair bound there are steps involved.Would recommend a guide to make the visit purposeful.A must see for the history enthusiasts.

Nice Buddha. It was a first time that I went there.It was a amazing place for all Buddhism.
I saw the gold Buddha image.It was very stunning.I pray for my health and my wealth.
If I have time,I will be visit there again.

Beautiful and historic . Watt Taimit is one of my go to temples in Bangkok, Thailand. It's located in Chinatown aka Yawarat.
