1st temple to visit in Bangkok . This was our first temple visit in Bangkok, truly amazing to see a 5.5 ton solid gold Buddha, this is quite a short visit, however we took a private tour for the day, this is where you miss all the queues and the masses of people (mostly rude) we did the palace and temples tour about 5 hours and Booked though the anatara riverside hotel in Bangkok

dazzling. the area isn't large when you compare it to the likes of the grand palace and wat pho, but this is worth the visit. my only concern was the birds they kept trapped that you can pay around 50 baht to set free which is supposed to give you good luck, it defeats the purpose as i am pretty sure those birds are trapped again and sold again in the pretense of being freed.

Heaven !. Wat Arun is my favorite temple !this temple in on side of Chaopraya river and have a very great view when sunrise and sunset.and you can find the shopping center (traditional) behind of the building. cheap and many kind.
Spell binding. One tends to get in touch with his inner self when inside the temple. Beautiful golden statue of Lord Buddha.

A great tribute to a great soul. We could reach there just before closure and we were very fortunate not to have missed this. When I saw this I felt very much elated . Thanks to some humanity still left in people we are able to see this
Extremely beautiful. Travelled here years ago when it was under construction, so I would really excited to see the finished product. Quite spectacular - worth the visit.

Don't get here after 5:00!. This was one of our top sites to see in Bangkok. We had booked a private tour that was to last until 7:00 PM so we spent several hours earlier going to the other temples and the Grand Palace. It was 5:00 by the time we arrived here and the guards had just put up the closed sign--a huge disappointment, as we weren't able to return any other day or time. So just be cautious if you're on a tour that you let your guide know you don't want to miss this one--we would have easily given up time at the flower market had we known.

Breathtaking. The statue of Buddha is just breathtaking. There is an air-conditioned museum that traces the history of Chinese settlers to Thailand. Be careful when you have to take off your shoes to visit the temple. It was 39 and sunny when I went and ended up burning the soles of my feet.

Amazing!. We family visited Golden Buddha and we were told by the local guide that the temple with golden color is real 18k gold on it. It was amazing to see and experience it live. The temple is at a height and one find it quite peaceful and calm. It's quite spacious and from it you can see China Town behind this temple. The making and built is worth watching. And explore the story behind it.

Amazing!. What an amazing site to see. Crazy to think that it is SOLID GOLD. And no security. It was very refreshing to be around something so precious and have it be surrounded by spiritualists as opposed to armed guards. Very enjoyable experience.

One of The Best Sites In Bangkok. A wonderful site to visit and learn about the culture of Buddhism. Just be prepared to walk around without shoes and socks as this is mandatory for Buddhist temples. Bring handi wipes to clean off your feet when leaving. The ground is all stone so there is no dirt to walk on.

Rubbish and expensive. The normal Thai so called religious site that they try to make loads of money from. Not too busy when I was there, although not too easy to find. You will need to be covered or hire stuff suitable.The Buddha is impressive once you realise what you are looking at (room very dark). As they say once you seen one you have pretty well seen them all. So my advice pick one temple do that then move on and save some time and money.

Nice but when there are too much...it's a little the same. I enjoy visiting the Wat, but do it at small dose or else it becomes all the same. Now they are waiting you just for your cash, the Buddhism seems there to make money...the spirit seems to be gone. But it is very nice to see.
Good for sightseeing. If you are visiting the temples this is one to add to the list. Beautiful temple as they all are. Very cheap to get access to go up to the 4th floor by stairs

Wonderful site. I spent an hour and a half wandering around the site taking photos and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. The crowds were large an if I go again i will do it in the cool of the morning as after lunch it was stifling.
Massive. Very nice to see and the temple was amazing.....the feet of the golden Buddha was absolutely massive ...it was very peaceful too

Worth a visit. This Buddha is interesting because he is pure gold but the temple complex doesn't compare to the Golden Palace, Wat Pho and the Emerald Buddha. If you only visit one complex visit the Golden Palace - if you have the stamina for more that one this is worth a stop
Impressive. Interesting place to visit for 1st timers. Quiet and Calm. It wasn't too crowded this time of the year. Would prefer to visit when there is a festival/ carnival, it would be more fun.
Amazing & gigantic Gold buddha !!!. Its indeed a reflection of the respect Thai populace have on Buddha. The 5.5 ton pure gold statue of Buddha is really astounding !!!

Interesting and a great start to our tour of Thailand. This temple was a great start to our tour of Thailand, and I am glad we started here. After the Grand Palace, it may have not seemed quite as amazing.Please don't get me wrong... it IS amazing... but the Grand Palace and it's buildings and temples can get your head a little spinny with the staggering decor of it all.Please note: As with all the places we went in Thailand, bathrooms were much more western and nice than we expected (though sometimes toilet-paper isn't at hand). However, take lots of water where-ever you go as well as sun-hats, sun-umbrellas, sun-screen, fans, and cooling towels if you can get them. Heat-stroke is a major risk especially if you are at all sensitive to the heat and humidity.
Great. Thai people love gold; that's the impression that I had from this amazing place.Very peaceful; full of India tourists at this time of the year, still very nice...

Lovely temple. Had a great experience in seeing the spirituality in this place. You can see people offering worship inside and outside the temple. But the place has been commercialized now. Difficult to walk in hot sun.

Sacred place. Visited this temple on my birthday. This temple might be small as compared to many other temples in Bangkok but for the sake of the golden Buddha, it's really worth visiting. Apparently it goes all the way back 700 over years ago during the Sukhothai dynasty. And because of war, the locals used mud to camouflage the golden Buddha. For hundred of years, the 'mud-made' Buddha was left abandoned in an old temple. It's only in the 1950's then it was discovered that it was made of pure SOLID gold! Yes! I mean pure solid gold that's weight about 5.5 tons. From what I heard, the local were trying to move the Buddha statue and accidentally hit it on something. As a result part of it was chipped and it revealed the true golden Buddha. It's considered as Thailand national treasure and you can never find another pure solid golden Buddha that's weight 5.5 tons! This sacred place is really worth a visit and perhaps you may also ask for blessings regardless of your belief.

Unique Buddha story. If you just want to choose one temple to visit whilst in Bangkok this is the one. Lovely story as to how they found the golden Buddha and the buildings are beautiful. Glad we made this port of call
Peaceful spiritual place. This place is an amazingly peaceful place.one of oldest Buddha temple of Thailand .The Buddha idol is charismatic.

Beautiful serene place. Beautiful and serene place in Bangkok, there are a good few temples in Bangkok, I think all are worth the visit and this is my personal choice, easy to get to, there are plenty of ways to get there, and as a non Thai, the entry fee is minimal and well worth itLots of place outside for refreshing our self with foods and drink, also shops and markets
"Excellent temple". As there are many temple of Buddha in Bangkok, we found this temple very impressive. If you love god you should visit this temple.

Temple in the middle of crowd buildings . That was my impression of this temple. It's surrounded by modern buildings but still be itself. I was impressed when told by our guide that the Buddha statue was made with 5 tons of gold. What a huge amount of gold. The people must be freakin' rich back then.

Worth a visit. The golden Buddah in this temple is solid gold. It is about 800 years old but found by monks in 2007, who were looking for a Buddah statue to put in a newly commissioned temple. They found. Buddha covered plaster and separated in parts. They began cleaning it and discovered it was solid gold. Value today is over $37 million usd. It is big and beautiful and easy to see up close. There will be lots of very emotional Buddhists parang in front of him but you can kneel on the red carpet for a photo.
Very Sacred Place to Visit. I request all To definately see this beautiful and excellent temple .The gold Idol is really mesmerising .

Amazing to think this stayed hidden. Given both the size and the weight of this Buddha, it is amazing to think that it stayed hidden for so long. It's beauty is certainly worth a visit and can be combined with trips to the refining Buddha and the marble temple.
Impressive - a must see. This place is impressive and really worth a visit while in Bangkok. Take a half day tour and visit the Buddhas and Temples
EXCELLENT PLACE TO VISIT SEE AND WORSHIP. One of the greatest places in Bangkok is Golden Buddha Temple. This reflects the respect of people in the world by making Buddha Statue in pure gold.

Took my breath away. Absolutely loved it here, it took my breath away. I only heard about this Buddah/Temple a couple of hours before visiting and after hearing the story I just had to visit. Simply amazing.

Bangkok and Buddha Temples Go Hand in Hand. Bangkok features more than 400 major Buddha Temples .Golden Buddha temple has Gold statue of Lord Buddha weighing almost 6 + tons of pure Gold.The Idol wasknown to have pure gold when it was shifted to new Built Temple just next to it.Lords Idols makes u Peaceful and Holistic
Beautiful temple full of history. Excellent place to learn a bit of Thai history. Very well maintained. Wonderful place to visit to start knowing about Thailand.

2 Good place in one! Very Beautiful temple and Golden Buddha image. A good museum, Yaowarat Chinatown Heritage Centre.. By visiting this temple, you can see the very nice Temple and a very beautiful golden buddha image. and yet there is a museum on the second floor. worth to visit. Only one problem is, there is so many tourists.
5 ton gold statue. A must to see who have a love for gold. Above all calm & peace comes naturally to any place of buddha.

The name pretty much says what it is.. As with everything else in Thailand, this sacred temple is intricately ornamental and beautiful. Not sure I believe that it is crafted of gold as one section seemed tarnished (& looked more like brass); but I am NOT an expert & the extreme humidity and heat may have caused that reaction?? Still, it was gorgeous & my primary concern was the essence of the Buddha symbol, not the material value of it.I would not recommend visiting the country of Thailand in late April as it was VERY HOT and humid during our entire trip.

Don't think its an absolute must to visit. Went there since it was part of our itinerary. April is a fairly cruel month to visit Bangkok and it can be touch visiting temples. Difficult to enjoy the place under scorching heat. Not an extra ordinary place to visit. Its there mostly to check the box.

Worth the Visit. Valued at roughly $250 million USD, seeing the Golden Buddha is definitely worth it. We didn't have a whole lot of time, so we visited earlier in the day figuring the crowds would be smaller, and our assumption was correct. Was also an easy cab ride from where we were staying near the MBK Center. I've heard that later in the day Chinatown gets really congested, so if that's when you're coming I would suggest taking a train. Only drawback to visiting in the morning is that there isn't a whole lot going on elsewhere in the area at this time of day. Regardless of when you visit Chinatown though, make sure Wat Traimit is part of your itinerary.

unique experience. its a very unique experience for me,sometimes when you go alone they will say that the place is close for maintenance but when you go with the tour group they will allow you to go inside.

More Gold. All of the Buddha's, whether Indian, Chinese or Thai (Siam) are painted in leaf gold. Some are fat, which are apparently the Chinese versions and some are slim.All the Budhas are impressive, my advise is go with a guide so you understand them and know how they came to be there.
crowded but the Temple is nice. A lot of people was there, its so crowded and not suitable for children. You have to wear pans, not short.

Must visit in Bangkok. The temple is situated very close to the China town area. When I visited around 5 pm, came to know its the closure time and hence moved fast around the temple as one to climb to the top of the temple. But I could not have the view of Golden Buddha. Yet the pictures I took show its a must visit in Bangkok. Opposite to this temple across the road another small temple is situated which is also worth the visit.

Unique. If you want to see 4 1/2 tons of gold, this is the place to go. The current building is quite new (I remember the old building 30 + years ago. Its elevated with lovely cooling breezes when you get up high. The building is beautiful inside & out, its peaceful even when crowded as people walk quietly around. Take time to sit & meditate to one side, nobody minds.

Bling!. How can you not be impressed by the biggest (5,5 ton) yellow gold Buddha statue in the world? And then you learn that the statue was covered in plaster for centuries, and that its golden core only became known by accident / when trying to move the statue in the 1950ies...This temple is included in many Bangkok tours; unfortunately, a visit to the Chinese heritage center (also located in the temple) is not included in these types of tours.
worth visiting while in Bangkok. Another amazing temple you should visit on your trip to Bangkok. advise you also use a tour guide to know the history of it.

Gold Buddha is a massive statue. The Golden Buddha is the world's largest seated massive gold Buddha. The statue weighs five and half tons and it is five and a half metres (yards) in height.It was rediscovered by accident after it has been hidden under a coating of plastdr to keep it from discovery by foreign invaders. The Buddha is in Wat Traimit, near Chinatown. Please remember when you visit that you are in a house of worship..

Very Nice Temple. The temple is very easy to get to from the MRT station. It's a quick walk to the location. The temple is very ornate. The Buddha statue is very golden and nice. There is a 7-11 on the way if the temperature is very hot- you can buy a cold drink. I highly recommend going here. We even took our baby to this temple because it was easy to get to.
A memorable experience. Well worth a visit. The Golden Buddha is a spectacle. Note: Ladies need to cover your shoulders and legs.

Worth visit! . Located very near Chinatown, around 5mins walking distance. Ticket around 140 bath (included exhibition and temple of the golden). Worth a visit, very classic. Do not wear short skirt, short pants... If you do not want to lose 100 bath for renting a long skirt to cover.

Five Tons of Pure Gold. You may have seen photos, or seen it on TV; but you will never get over the experience of actually standing in front of this iconic Thai relic. It is difficult to understand how anyone could have actually cast five tons of solid gold to produce this monument, but there it is; right in front of your very eyes!

stunning architecture and the golden Buddha is extraordinary.. I wish I'd come before museum closed (4:30 I think) for 1955 photos of the accidental cracking of his camouflaging plaster layer when it was discovered that this 13th century statue was not made of plaster, but actually gold. He'd been camouflaged to prevent theft by the invading armies in the late 1700's. The secret was forgotten.... wonderful history. Also architecturally and historically interesting is the imposing temple that was constructed for the golden Buddha, after being housed under a shed for a number of years in his presumed plaster days. It is sort of a a European/American federal style at the base, with classic Thai roof and ornamentation on the upper parts. It was made from the reconstructed crematorium of a previous queen, as I somewhat hazily recall.
Amazing place. Worth a visit. It's truly amazing to see. The crowds are big, so need to go early. Beautiful and amazing. Must visit on your trip to Bangkok.

Great!. This was the first Temple I visited and was recommended to go and see. The Golden Buddha was bigger than I thought it would be, and although the steps are step to climb it was worth it. It is also reasonably priced.
Classic :). Nice small temple. 1.5 dollars ticket and a quick visit to the temple made the day. The 5 tons real gold buddha is amazing

Well worth it. While not very close to Wat Arun and Wat Pho this smaller complex is well worth the visit. It has easy access from the Hau Lumphong MRT station - 5 min walk. 40 Baht for the temple, but the 100 Baht extra for the exhibits is well worth it: an exhibit on restoration as well as one on Chinese immigration and the history behind China town.

Definitely Worth Seeing. Go here, brave the blazing heat on the stairs (take some socks to put on or you will burn your bare feet on the hot marble) and stand in awe of this statue. But you won't be quite so amazed if you haven't learned that this statue was disguised and buried for centuries, so do your homework. Then look around at the locals who are just as awed. Definitely good for a quick stop while you're here.
"Golden temple". This is a very nice temple where you can see the statue of lord Buddha made by gold. Its a bit smaller temple compare to other temple. But it was very nice to be Here.
Gold, Gold & More Gold. The Temple of the Golden Buddha is absolutely beautiful. No expense was spared in creating this incredible temple complex. A must see if you are in Bangkok!

Temple of the Golden Buddha. I was informed that they used 50 tonnes of gold to construct the temple.Anyway what can be said besides its another Wat or temple in Bangkok, Thailand.However, it may mean more to a Buddhist but the heat and the huge crowd are not encouraging.

Golden Buddha. This is a smaller temple but meticulously maintained, once agin you need to read the history relating to the golden Buddha so that you get the full experience. The ground is terribly hot to walk on barefoot I suggest you slip on a pair of socks .
small and nice temple. making a tour through Bangkok you should definitively don't miss this smaller temple. The main attraction here is the golden Buddha. Small, but really impresisve.
Hot. They should have some mat or carpet on the floor .You have to remove your footwear and walking the last 30-40 feet barefoot in the Hot sun was really uncomfortable.

Gliteratti. Take off your shoes, climb stairs or take a small elevator which can fit 4 people at a time. Once you get on the roof you are awe stuck by the imposing gold and glitter. Devotees on their knees paying homage. It's an uplifting experience. The monks are very humble and dine mostly on raw vegetables for the mid-day meal. As usual the ubiquitous vendors are within sight

THB100 entrance. Just ok.. Ok for a quick visit. There is a gold Buddha inside. Apart from that, it's just another temple.It was close to my hostel (5mins walk from Loftel22), so no big deal and close to Chinatown. But I wouldn't come here especially.There is a Chinese Temple across the road (Kuan Yim Shrine). There you can enter for free and do the fortune telling shake shake sticks for free also.

An amazing experience...if you check your tourist at the door. The Temple of the Golden Buddha was a remarkable experience. The grounds are beautiful and you can purchase your tickets to see the Buddha for relatively cheap (ours were around 80 Baht) where you buy the tickets you can also rent a shawl (it is 100 Baht and you get 80 Baht back) to cover your shoulders or legs my advice is to use them. While most likely a monk will never ask you to leave or even cover up it is out of respect to their vows and the holy nature of the site. as you walk up the steps worn smooth by so many visitors and see the marks on the walls from the constantly burning incense you can feel that it is a place the deserves your reverence no matter what your religious persuasion is or whether you have one at all (my wife and I are devout athiests).
The Beautiful Temple in the elevation. Amazing .. altitude strenuous enough I ride ... but the tremendous satisfaction when I get there... incredible once ...

Beautiful temple. I recommend to visit this temple in afternoon to see the sunset. There are no many thing to do/see here. Be aware, the temple closes at 5pm! (if you arrive at 4:30˜4:45PM they might let go you in for free)
Impressive. The statue of Buddha made out of around 5 tonnes of solid gold is really impressive. The architecture of the temple is great and the history behind it is good to know.

Stunning and peaceful.. This was probably my favourite temple in Bangkok. It is situated in Chinatown and seemed less crowded than the others. The Golden Buddha has to be seen to be believed. A wonderfully spiritual place.
Nice temple, Buddha and view. This temple is on a top of the hill, so the view from there is really great.The temple itself looks nice. There is a Buddha that kids will really appreciate.

Quick visit. We had a tuk tuk driver take us there (avoid tuk tuks if you can, they try taking you to places where they get kick backs), it was a quick stop, cost depends upon how many floors you want to see. Not a large temple, but it was a nice stop.

The city has grown up around the temple..... Found this to be very peaceful despite the number of people there.Quite a few steps and does seem to relatively disorganised in parts. The staff looked a little bored though. Put that aside and take in the temple, soak up its history and you will enjoy.

Beautiful Architecture. This temple had some beautiful architecture and we spent a good 20 mins there, there is a lot of similarities to indian mythology such as the rahu kalam etc. definitely worth a visit if you have a spiritual connect to Buddhism or seeing a Buddhist temple in lade with gold for the first time.
Small and beautiful temple . Walking distance from Hua Lamphong Railway station/BTS. It's open at 8.00 am onwards. Relatively small temple but worth visiting it.

Golden Bhudda..Temple.... Wat Traimit is also a must visit in Bangkok itinerary, It can be easily reached by Subway train to Hualoumpong BTS and I alighted the Train and its jus a walk way distance from the station, Bangkok main railway station Hualoumpong s just few yards away from BTS station Subway to Hua Lampong Station and continue walking for 300 metres The Temple is amazing in its style and the surrounding Monasteries and pagodas are beautifully architecture The Traimit temple is famous for its 3metreshigh Golden Buddha weighing about five and a half tons. It is believed that the Golden Buddha is more than 700 years old. I was amazed at the holistic feel of the shrine and the ambience of the temple sanctum with golden Bhudda seated in the sanctum. The inner wall are well designed and artistically crafted The Golden Buddha was installed initially in Wat Phrayakrai in the Yannawa area of Bangkok in the reign of the KingRama III. It stayed there until 1931. When the temple had fallen out of use and was abandoned, The temple is open daily from 08.00 am. 05.00 pm. Admission is free Chinese Heritage Centre is also located and can be visited.
Impressive sight !. This Buddah is set up high , easy steps though to walk up. 5.5 tonnes of solid gold, well worth a visit
Nice museum inside. If you visit this temple to see the golden buddha, please check out the Thai-Chinese history museum on the second floor, it explains how Chinese become a part of Thai culture.

Are you ever go?. The golden mountain in thailandn,so many people in around the world ..come to ..for me just visit i year old 7 , i go with my mother ..so very beautyfull ..so long time ..part i go take all my friend visit ..all friend say ...nice place

One of the many wonders of Thailand. We were lucky to visit the temple during songkran festival. It was such a pleasant sight to see people offering water to the many idols of Buddha in a specially built area. The weather was hot but once we entered the temple and saw the idol, it was like a cool breeze.Very interesting to learn about how it was protected by plastering cement to cover it.Don't miss this place if you are in Bangkok. It's ideal to combine a half day trip to Temple of reclining Buddha, temple of Golden Buddha and the grand palace.

Typical Asian BudhistTemple. Beautifully presented. Busy at time due to New Year celebrations.. Temple is very accessible. Reachable by fun Tuk Tuk. ( only pay 1 dollar.) Completely different atmosphere for us westerners but so interesting and thought provoking. Stylish, traditional and absolutely worth an hour visit.

Small but majestic. The temple is a just a small place just be mindful of praying locals when asking to take a picture for you for some of them just stand there and just seems to be looking at the Buddha unlike in other temples I've been to where locals kneel. Entrance fee is just 40THB if you just want to see the Golden Buddha, you have to pay additional 100 THB if you want to see an exhibition. Nevertheless, the place is still majestic and worth the visit.

Amazing...!!!. We went in the morning and place was not so crowded. Took a ticket only to visit Golden Buddha statue. Ticket is not that costly but you need to pay extra to move to exhibition area. This place was amazing and well maintained. We spent about 10-15 minutes there.

First visit. It was nice. This is a good place to visit. However in late March 2016 I found the open air ground in the temple precincts was too hot to set foot on.Too many people taking selfies.....was an irritant.Would love to visit again.

Beautiful.. This is another must visit place in Bangkok.
and this is the gate to China Town. so you can have a good food after.
Unbelievable!. We spent the whole visit with our eyes bulging and our mouths open. Better than Paris or St. Petersburg.

Beautiful. . We were "assisted" at the airport by a man who was helping us figure out the taxi situation. He also wrote the address for our hotel in Thai to give to our taxi driver. He then suggested we purchase a tour with him. We were tired after flying 17 hours and he seemed nice so we did. As we walked away we figured we had been ripped off, we were wrong!! We were picked up at our hotel promptly at 9 am by a very nice lady and her drivers her was our guide for the day. Our first stop was here. She was incredibly knowledgable and an amazing photo taker. She placed us in all the right spots for photos and had great angles :) This was a very moving experience even though it was very crowded. I highly suggest going here and being apart of something so beautiful.
Absolutely beautiful.. This is another must visit place in Bangkok. The architecture is out of this world and the most stunning pictures can be taken here.
Go Early. Respect the Thai people and wear appropriate dress. You can buy loads of clothing at local stores, but a bit of a rip off. Well worth a visit.
The golden Buddha. The building has beautiful architecture were the Golden Buddha is. Not much else to see but worth a visit.
Gold plated Buddha temples shining under the sun.. If you ever wanna visit Buddha temples, Bangkok is the place. Please adhere to temple rules and you wont be disappointed.

Small temple but a must visit. We were here nice and early so not many people around, the marble temple is beautiful and the Golden Buddha and its history are amazing. We visited here as part of a Tour with Tong, our guide Onn was fantastic.
B-e-a-u-t-i-f-u-l. I fell in love with these style of architecture. The golden roofs, the extremely detailed walls. It's all worth seeing --without a doubt.

The Buddha is spectacular!. While this isn't one of the top Wats on the list in Bangkok it was definitely worth the trip! The Buddha is spectacular and the grounds, while not as elaborate as some of the others are definitely beautiful. You are also a quick walk into Chinatown!You may want to consider having socks with you. You will have to take off your shoes to enter the temple and then walk across very hot granite with only a bit of relief from the black rubber matts to get from the shoe drop to the temple door.
Can visit once . It's a huge sitting golden Buddha. Nothing much here other than that statue. Just a Buddha here. If u have visited other Temples in Bangkok then just give this temple a miss
Worth the visit. Keep a significant chunk of time to walk through the temples. Structure is gorgeous and the management is happy for you to walk through, click pictures , pray or just stay for a bit.
Amazing !. This place, is very Nice ! Inside, it's quiet ! The guard do a good job ! Outside, you can enjoy the nice view, and the chineese corner ! Chinatown in Bangkok !

VERY NICE. The golden buddha temple is on the must visit list. Entry fee, climb of a few flight of stairs and ther you have a majestic buddha all gold looking at you. Detailed explanation from our guide we were told that it is made of plaster of paris and covered with gold. A sense of calm prevails inside the temple and the prayer bells outside are also worth looking at. Nice to visit.
Nice Must watch. Very nice place with nice view . A must visit place but it would be better to visit in AC car during April end and May start as it is hot over there.

A sight to see. The size and majesty of this Buddha Statue would take your breath away even if you did not know it was made of gold. The ambience in which the statue is housed is itself a very pretty Thai picture.
Out of this world. Worth a visit quite spiritual and amazing place to look at buildings and the area one of the top places to visit in Thailand on your list
Good visit. Good visit but nothin much to see than a Golden statue of Buddha.. but it can crucifying in hotter months
wonderful to see the young monks. I arrived very early morning as the stalls where setting up. I was invited inside to see the young monks and the elders, very surreal.
Amazing Buddha Statue.. The place is very clean and has good ambience even to meditate. The buddha statue is really a majestic one...
Golden Buddha was Golden!. Not too crowded, lots of history and information. Very nice attraction. Lot's of color and a feast for the eye's.

One of the best things to see in Bangkok.. No trip to Bangkok would be complete without a visit to this temple. If you have to pick one temple to see go here. It is usually crowded with people but there is a good air about the place. Beware of people who tell you they are tour guides. They tell you somewhere you want to go is closed and then try to bring you somewhere else.

Incredible sight!. I have to say that the Temple of the Golden Buddha is amazing. I loved everything about this adventure and the tour guide we had hired to see it and to explain what were experiencing.

don't miss this. There are loads of temples to visit so we were very picky- this one is really worth it- the Buddha here stands in a class of its own- not surprising given its made of solid gold. awesome
Visited as part of a temple trip. Probably only need to stay about an hour, however good to see some heritage of Bangkok. There was also a museum , but we didn't visit that.

Beautiful!. We loved to walk around the Temple and take in the local culture. It is truly beautiful we also witnessed small restoration works (gold leaf painting) while we were there which was amazing to see. I must advise we visited in December and it was a very hot and humid day, loose fitting clothes are a must!

Not the most interesting wat in the city. we went out of our way - taking the subway to visit this wat. We didn't find it that interesting - so many other wats have more interesting art and the viewing area is actually small. In a very dense part of town - the most fun part was that it was near chinatown.
Over the Average. if you have time afterWat Pho and Grand palace (wat phra kaew) and Wat Arun you can go to this place, and this is better than te other small temples.
Impressive. A Buddha made of 5.5 tons of solid gold is pretty impressive. I stumbled upon Wat Trainit while strolling through Chinatown. I do recommend this site for a short visit.
Better before . Nice temple, but modern. The old tree filled spirit of the previous temple made it a highlight, now it's rather touristy and the beauty of the Buddha a little lost.
Unique. One of the many temples in Bangkok but not too many crowds and easily seen in half an hour. Worth going.

Simply Beautiful . Beautiful a must do if u are in Bangkok. U have to dress appropriate no sleeveless shirts or tight fitting clothes. Removal of shoes is a must u can take photos inside I would suggest to wait after the crowd rush in.

Beautiful. Had an amazing time here the buddah was lovely we also enjoyed the stalls outside there were lots of reasonably priced items to buy you must have a photo taken under the sacred banana tree and I paid a 100bahti to free some birds from a cage and gain happiness
Standard. After lots of travelling, and seeing some breathtaking temples, this one was fairly forgettable. We were in and out within 10 mins.

Wow . This was by far the best experience. You must be dressed respectful, no shorts no sleeveless... Must bring along proper attire, my daughter was in shorts, we bought a long wrap and had her wear it as a skirt. You can hire someone there to give you your.

Wat Traimit and the Golden Buddha. In the heart of China Town in Bangkok statue of Buddha in gold largest in the world. 5 tons of 18-karat gold to form a seated Buddha with his right hand to touch the ground to ask the support of the Earth Goddess and not fall into temptation. The statue was discovered by chance to the goal 'of 1900, probably to avoid that was stolen during the looting catkins Burmese was covered with stucco during transport an accidental fall was revived gold with which it was made.

Nice but crowded at times. If you want to see a huge amount of gold in one place, without a gazillion police officers surrounding it, check this out. If the place is crowded, wait a couple of minutes as most people cycle out pretty quickly.

Absolutely stunning. Temples are amazing, i blows me away when i think of the time that they have been here, plus the millions of folk who have walked exactly where i am walking now. In the history books they give you details yes, but they dont tell you of the feeling you get when your surrounded by prayer, thousands of incense sticks giving off a pungent heady aroma, and to now that perhaps right where your feet are placed now, the ancient kings and emperors of this country mat have stood right there, its an amazing feeling

Beautiful place- worth going. This was one of my favourite temples. Close to the city and easy to get to. Crowded but not too bad on the day we went. We also really liked being able to donate 100Baht to get a gold paper which is used to make other statues. (or so our guide said).

A spectacular Golden Buddha. Wat Traimit is famous because of its golden Buddha statue that weights 5.5 tons. The statue is supposed to date back to the 14th century. It was apparently housed in a wat in Ayutthaya till the mid 19th century and then moved to Bangkok. The sheer size of the golden statue is dazzling!
Famous and best. Golden budha temple is best as it is the best to see visit cause the history or story the place been maintained very well. Nature friendly and our best part of the visiting bangkok.

Peaceful. One of the must visit spots in Bangkok.Entry fees of 40 baht is applicable if we visit the temple only.We need to remove our footwear and also wear appropriate clothing( no shorts and sleeveless clothes allowed).Though if you do end up wearing shorts or sleeveless they offer you a coat or skirt to cover up. That's free of cost.The beautiful statue of Gautam Buddha radiates so much peace and warmth, calms us.Though the visit doesn't take more than 30 minutes do not skip it.
Gorgeous Statue. The Buddha was beautiful, but past that there isn't much else to see there. Lots of shops around and it was pretty crowded when we went.
Beautiful. So peaceful. And the statue is very impressive. It's great to be in such a peaceful setting whilst people pray or give thanks.
Good starter Temple. Great view of the city, and great place to start your temple tours. Not as big as the other main temples, but beautiful on its own.
A must see!. This is one of the must see temples in Bangkok. The statue is solid gold and, but, how it shines! Beautiful architecture and details throughout and also a lovely view.

Simply amazing!. Let me start off by saying I want everyone to have a great trip so please message me if you have any specific questions! I just to Bangkok March 12-20, 2016.This temple is right in Bangkok and the juxtaposition is outstanding! Here you are in this busy city, and above buildings and small houses stands this gorgeous temple! The walk up is quite a ways but once you're up there you're just standing in front of an amazing temple. And that's before you're inside! The Buddha itself weighs 5.5 TONS! It is truly amazing to view! It is a beautiful statue of a sitting Buddha, all in gold. There truly are no words to describe it. The temple itself is amazing too the way it stands out over the city. Tip for ALL Thai Temples (some may be different but generally all are the same). I did my research before, knowing how religious Thai people are. Clothing: I cannot emphasize how important clothing is for all temples. You WILL be turned away for inappropriate clothing. They have a strict code for both men and women but I think it is best for everyone to stay covered. -No shoulders showing (absolutely no tank tops for men or women)-Nothing above the knee (I wore athletic pants and a t-shirt for all my tours and had no problems. Some websites prohibit athletic wear but I just went 2 weeks ago and found that that material doesn't matter at all because they are only looking for coverage. I think for women maxis are the best way to go, making sure your shoulders are covered! Shoes or sandals are fine to wear. They will tell you when you must take off your footwear)Do not touch anything. Everything in the temples is obviously old and historic and hand done. Also, do not try and mimic what the locals are doing. To you, this is an attraction, but to them, it could be their main place of worship. Be mindful of that and don't follow what they do since they will take offense to someone who isn't Buddhist or Hindu following their actions.They will tell you when photos are acceptable. This temple didn't prohibit photos anywhere, but there will be signs posted. They aren't kidding around. We witnessed a security guard taking someone's phone and deleting photos.I also read that it is considered disrespectful to turn your back to any statue of Buddha. Thai people will definitely appreciate if you follow rule.At the end of the day, these temples are sightseeing attractions to us. Look around and appreciate the detail. There is so much to see. If you are on a tour, your guide will take you to everything you need to see so don't worry. If you are not on a tour, go at your own pace, but remember that if you rush through everything assuming it's the same, you will definitely miss some stuff.
Temple Review. Pretty cool, the Buddha was huge, nice place to visit. Lots of tourist in the temple. I really enjoyed looking at Thailand culture and religious artifacts
Nice temple. This temple was not as crowded as some of the other temples which made the visit nice. The Golden Buddha statue was also an amazing site to see.

A beautiful site. This was a fun place to visit once. It's the only one like it in the world . But don't plan a whole day around it because you probably won't need to be there for more than an hour in my opinion. Worth the visit though

Largest statue of solid gold in the world.... This temple is not very interesting in itself...it is the massive Buddha-statue made of solid gold that is the main (if not only) attraction. Glad we saw it!

An amazing story. This was probably the one place I really wanted to visit again from my 1978/79 memories. I'm sure it's now in a different temple building, as I don't recall having to climb this many steps to get to it. Nevertheless, it's definitely worth the effort to see this solid gold Buddha - the story to it (which I shall not repeat here; you either know it or can easily research it) is truly amazing. No matter what else you miss in Bangkok, do not miss this one - awe-inspiring.
Lots of Gold. The Buddha itself is impressive and the buildings are clean and interesting - but really you can do this site in about 10 to 15 minutes - so its worth a quick trip but nothing more.
Another must see item.. Another one of the must see icons to see and learn about, in order to more fully appreciate the Buddhist heritage and religious culture.

Cool, but not a must-do. The main draw of the attraction is that it's the largest totally gold Buddha statue. That's about it, nothing more. It's a very small temple and the visit takes maybe 15 minutes.
Visit this temle!. 3 floor temple. In the first and the second floor there is an exhibition. On the third floor is the Golden Budha.

Most amazing thing. This was the very first Buddhist temple that we visited on our trip. My husband is very spiritual and really into Buddhism so the visit was very touching. Its humbling to see the respect most people in Thailand pay to their faith, The Buddha and the monks. Aside from that the golden Buddha and a gigantic pure gold Buddha that weight several tons. I highly recommend!
Nice place. It was an ice walk inside. The people were nice. Make sure you go with a friend who speak Thai so you do not overpay for things there. have a great time.

Top 3 for me. After the Grand Palace and Wat Pho, this would be my top 3 temple. It's much smallwr compared to the other 2 but it is also nice. However don't over spend time visiting temples. After those 3 they are all quite alike in the end, ir even worse uglier :)

Nice ... but Crowded!. It was hot, hot, hot the day we went and rather crowded. Beautiful wat inside and out! Small compared to the other wats, but beautiful none the less. The area is small thus two bus loads will crowd the place up. The vendors add to the crowded feeling. (By the way carry some toilet paper with you the public bathrooms don't have any. They are very clean and about a foot and a half off the floor, use the handicap stall, it has a "normal" height seat.)
Big Statue. Big and huge statue.. Not much crowded. Being spiritual place, shoes has to be removed. Entry fees is applicable.
A definite must see!. We took one day to hire a local tour guide to take us to 10 stops in Bangkok in one day. this was one of my favorite stops, it was pretty cool and you have to see it.

Amazing!. My friends and I went here as part of our tour with our private van. It was hot temp. around 34c but we climbed up the marble stairs (entrance fee was 40 baht-only to see the buddah) and 100baht if with the museum. I was amazed to see the huge sized Golden buddah!!! it was around 500 tons of gold.
Live temple with many restrictions (no picture, ....). You don' t need more than 15mn to visit this temple. Nice from outside but average from Inside despite lights all over.

Very Impressive. 700 year ild Real Golden Buddha. Various monks visited as well. Be prepared to remove your shoes. Only 40 baht to enter. No queue At 9:45 am on a Friday morning. Clean and informative. Tourist info with ticket supplied. No need for a guide. Parking is mad. We visited with a tuk-tuk and he waited patientlyVarious touts wants to sell you touristy junk outside.
Lovely temple. Went here as part of a tour the main temples is massive with quite a few steps up to it. Was busy when we got there even at 9 in the morning

Rich Buddha ;). The most expensive statue I have ever seen. Big or even huge, golden Buddha and that's all. That's the thing about temples in Thailand. There are only Buddhas ;) It's worth to see it. Very close to China Town.

Gold Buddha!. Ascend in this beautiful temple to contemplate the golden Buddha. Beautiful temple structure in the middle of the city near China Town. Take into consideration that you must cover your legs and shoulders to enter to Temples in Thailand, also you are required to remove your shoes when entering the temples, so if you are not comfortable barefoot, you are welcome to bring a pair of socks since these are allowed.
dont miss. We accidentily stumbled upon this temple, our first in our visit to Thailand. What a magnifigant site.!!

clean and peaceful. Budhha temples are always clean and peaceful and this one's no exception. try to attend the prayers even if you are not pious or religious. and don't forget to take a stroll around
ehhhh. Only thing to really see is the gaint golden Budda at this location although it is on the edge of china town.

A Must See. We stopped at the Temple as part of a day tour in Bangkok. You must remove your shoes in order to visit the temple, so take an extra pair of socks. The Golden Buddha is beautiful. It is 15 feet tall and weighs approximately 5.5 tons. The Temple building is beautiful. A must see if you are in Bangkok.

Temple. Temple with 500 kg gold statue nice architecture located in city area. There is no need to guide if you go Thailand so forget to visit this place.
Thanks
Wonderful. We got a boat to the temple what a magical place, the temple is just amazing, a really lovely insight into the Buddhist religion well worth a visit.

Worth visiting. Beautiful place to visit the buildings are awesome.
Very spiritual place, with Thai people worshipping, make sure to cover up otherwise you have to wear clothes that hundreds of other tourists have worn !!
Short stop. Visited as part of an Affordable Asia tour. Max time needed 30 minutes. If you shop at the market in front be sure and negotiate.

Gold Buddha with diiference. Been to many temples and seen many, many Buddha....
This experience was something to remember...
No fellow tourists..
No waiting in line and burning under the sun...
No pushing and feeling scared your shoes will be stolen..
Just culture and Peace....

5400 kilo pure gold. On the way to China Town we visted again this nice temple.
It is amazing to see so much gold on a statue. Do not miss this temple.
Impressive. This temple was very impressive. I thought the buddha would be much larger than it actually is but it was still very beautiful.

Golden Find. Wat Traimit (and its many other spellings) is important in Thai history with how it was (re)-discovered which i will not go into here. The 5.5 ton Golden Buddha is in a compound of white buildings with the buddha residing in the largest and tallest of all the structures. There are enough steps to negotiate with most people following the direction of flow. As others have asserted the floors that are exposed to the elements can get hot depending on the weather as visitors are required to remove their footwear. There are additional steps to get into the temple itself and a representative is present to stop people from using video cameras. Inside certainly the focus is the buddha itself but it is hard to not notice the dozens of donation boxes, most made of plexiglas, located in nearly every nook and cranny. Please also take in the view from this level of the temple. And if you do want to take video of the Golden Buddha with a video camera make sure the rep's attention is elsewhere while you stand at the a bit away from the foot of the stairs that lead to the front entrance of the temple. There are restrooms on site as well as souvenirs at the entry/exit.
If it was open...... The temple and its surrounds were great to wander around, however, due to a local ceremony we couldn't walk inside.
Impressed at how big the buddha actually was. It costs 100 baht to get into the grounds, but I definitely think it is worth it. I was really impressed at how big the buddha actually was.

A beautiful place oVerrin with visitors spoiling the experienc. Having been here years ago, I looked forward to sharing the experience with friends. What a surprise to find the palace crammed full of tourists, many who were downright rude. It's hard to appreciate the grandeur without space between wiki and the buildings and buddas. It's hard to understand why the government wouldn't limit entry so people could appreciate the place.

🙄🙄only visit. I see it is good to know other people religious beliefs only to know and thanks good for islam I see it is good to know other people religious beliefs only to know and thanks good for islam

Amazing. The big gold buddha is just amazing.. No words when we saw it... This is one the most important temple in Bangkok, that days was a lot of thai. The temple looks new, and aorund was great, all was clean... Something different!!!
Largest golden Buddha. Going to Chinatown in Bangkok must go and see this beautiful solid gold Buddha. With its high of five meter . From there you can see some parts of Chinatown.

Wat Traimit. Important temple, features solid gold Buda statue. There are steps to go up to it with a good view of the área. It s located by the chinese town. They have a souvenir shop where you can buy souvenirs at a good price.

Amazing. The history of the Golden Buddha is amazing. You should take the time to learn about it during your visit. The Buddha is huge and solid gold, hidden from invaders by covering in concrete to look like a Buddha of base material, then forgotten about. "Rediscovered" by accident in the process of moving.The stairs are many, but manageable. If you visit late in the day, move quickly after removing your shoes. The stone flooring is remarkable hot in the afternoon sun.Once again, mind your dress. Appropriate dress for a religious site is strictly enforced.
One of the most popular. Temple of Golden Buddha is one of the most popular buddhism sites and is definitely worth to visit while in Bangkok.
Lovely place. gorgeous is the word. Holy place with great architecture. The structure and around is amazing. One must visit place.
Must do. Must do in bangkok visiting the golden Buddha. Just nearby the chinese district which is very interesting and typical to visit

Big Gold Buddha. The temple is nice and the Golden Buddha is the highlight, worth a visit but stay away from the Tuk Tuk drivers that hassle you across from the entry. They will offer you a cheap ride around the city but the catch is the many stops along the way to Indian Taylor's and jewellery shops.

An impressive sight!. Another"must-see" in central Bangkok, on the edge of China-town. Five and a half tons of solid gold! It is worth the climb up to this spectacular shrine. The amount of gold is staggering and the story behind it, interesting. Make sure your shoulders are covered or you will have to hire a shawl. The final steps to the temple are negotiated in bare feet, so prepare to walk smartly as, believe me, they are hot! Worth it Though!
Must see. Went here as part of the three temple tour. This Buddha is sold gold and is large. We found the temple amazing a must see. Go early to avoid the crowds.

More than just a Buddha, the museum displays are excellent. There is more to the Golden Buddha than just the beautiful Buddha statue. The story behind it is fascinating and there is a very interesting display of its recent history.The exhibition outlining the history of the Chinese in Bangkok that is housed in the same building is also excellent. While it would take a while to read it all having a comparison of what was happening in China and in Thailand during the reign of each of the kings, and the impact this had on Chinese migrants was fascinating.
Beautiful. Another 'well worth a visit'! Very hot but not too busy. Our guide was very knowledgeable of course. A beautiful temple.

Beautiful!. The temple itself is small and much less crowded compared to the more common attractions. However, there are some pretty carvings to see on the way up, and the golden Buddha is worth the visit. It is beautiful , and the story about its re-discovery was interesting!

Temple in ChinaTown. This temple of another shape and right in the heart of ChinaTown is worth a visit for there is not the pack tour-groups there to spoil the views! Check out the small museum, worth a moment...
Stunningly beautiful. Truly amazing, very hot and very busy. Take sun tan lotion, water and a sarong. Suggest you arrive early to avoid queues
Tick it off the list. Entrance is free for locals, but 40 for tourists which is very reasonable vs. other attractions. I imagined a more impressive statue, but worth a visit all the same.

Peaceful t emple. visited temple of golden buddha during my visit to Bangkok and it is a peaceful abode of Lord buddha.
Good place to visit and good to get blessings.
OMG. So nice. It's 5.5 tons of pure gold, it's amazing. The temple is also very nice, you should visit, it's one of the things you should visit in Bangkok

Do not miss the small museums downstairs. After you see the golden Buddha on the fourth floor, make sure you see the two small but excellent exhibitions on the 2nd and 3rd floors. Admission is 100 Baht per person in addition to the fee for the Buddha - but if you get the Muse Pass these exhibits are included! This isn't mentioned where you buy the tickets, but there are signs in the exhibit entrances. The 3rd floor describes in great detail how the golden Buddha was made, how it was covered with lacquer and plaster, and how it was discovered inside the plaster in the 1950s. This is accompanied by excellent English-language descriptions and artifacts such as pieces of the plaster that was removed. The 2nd floor takes you through the history of Chinese people in Bangkok. It turns out that the Chinese traders had made a settlement in the area before the Thai king moved the capital to the area, and he asked them to move further east so he could build the Grand Palace where they were living! Again this exhibit is accompanied by excellent English-language descriptions and life-sized displays of people carrying out trade and other tasks. A great introduction to Chinatown and the history of Chinese connection with Thailand.
Very impressive. Apparently over 5000 kilos of gold. Easily viewed despite plenty of visitors. Lovely surroundings and setting.

Religious Site. Located in the heart of Bangkok's China Town, the temple was built in 2010 to house the 5.5 ton of gold (USD$250 million) statue of Buddha. I enjoyed learning about the statue's history and paying my respect. It shouldn't take more one hour to complete a visit. If you are not into religion and history, I would say skip.

Real nice temple. I really liked this temple. The Golden Buddha is very impressive to see. The history behind this Buddha made it very interesting in the fact that they did not realize it was solid gold for many years.
too many tourists disrespecting. people were trashing the floor and the place is very untidy. the experience was a little different as we expected a bit more.
Do not miss!!. Beautiful place to visit. Be sure to dress appropriately. There are guides available to guide you through the temple. Souvenir shops outside.

Well worth visiting. Set off walking through the busy, crowded streets of China Town, Bangkok, looking for the Wat Traimit. We found it, standing with no great ceremony but an opening with mini vans crowded within its small car park. However to get to view this solid gold Budha was quite amazing and well worth the effort as we also got to see and be part of everyday life in China Town.

interesting trip into history and production. we went to the temple of the golden buddha in the morning time and entered after paying the entracefee of 140 baht per person the temple. we took the stair to the highest level. in which the golden buddha is. a lot of people were there already, but it was a quiet and silent atmosphere, because all the poeple spended their highest respect to the buddha image. we stayed not so long in the upper level...much longer we stayed in the levels under the buddha, because the exibition about the making of the buddha image and the transportation of the statue was very interesting and gave views to ancien methods of production combinated with the extraordinary history of this special buddha image.we can recomment the temple of the golden buddha very much...we had an very interesting trip into the buddistic culture and learned a lot of new things about political history and the difficulties during a transport of more than 10 tonnes of metal in one piece some centuries ago.

Lovely day out!. We chose a day tour to see the city temples, the Golden Buddha was one of them. It is incredible, must see. You cannot wear shorts or skirts, if you do they give something to cover with. Outside of the temple you are fine.

A temple well worth the time to see. Beautiful temple!. The crowds are insane but this is a beautiful temple!! Highly recommend that you get a guide for the day- Ot of Thai Tour Guide was excellent & made our day in Bangkok very enjoyable. (Also lets you cut the crazy lines.)

Big and heavy and gosh the amount of gold. The golden Buddha is house in an impressive temple that is worth it's value. Beautiful marble and granite are used to build the building with gold terraces. The exterior facade of the temple itself is breathtaking. Inside the golden Buddha which is at the top most level, level 4 is just simply astonishing. Read up on the history of this 5T+++ as it is interesting. Also there is two temple building make sure you go to the taller temple.
My first Buddha. When u get there, the temple is very pretty. After you get to the top and you enter and see the Buddha you realize how amazing it is.

Not just another touristic attraction, camera off!. Looking at the gigantic Gold Statue, makes you see the meaning of the story that comes with it, beyond the first layers of an unique touristic attraction. There is a more philosophical sense when you start thinking of the details of its history: at some point in your life, you have to move out of your comfort zone, facing disappointments, wrong marriage, financial hardship; your existing circumstances will shake your life during those movements, the "clay case" will crack and the day light will hit the gold version of yourself.
Beautiful temple. Beautiful temple with a lot of history and great photo ops! Beware of the market outside - you can find similar items in different markets for less

All the Glitters really is Gold.. ALTHOUGH I have been to Bangkok many times before I have somehow never been to the Temple of the Golden Buddha, so I decided to remedy that during my latest trip to Thailand.I immediately wished I'd allowed more time for my visit because, despite getting up at 7am and being ready to hit the road before 8.30am, I met twin problems that I hadn't thought of.The first was actually being able to attract the attention of a taxi or tuk tuk driver willing to take me there from lower Sukhumvit. I couldn't believe it! Normally you are waving them away by the dozen, but the rush hour from 8.30am-9.30am meant they all seemed to be taken, so I did a bit of local sightseeing, went for a coffee and then tried again towards 9.30am.I succeeded in getting a tuk tuk but even that took a while and my driver then explained to me about problem number two, namely that the temple opened at 9.30am and would already be pretty full by the time I could there.What with my driver hacking his way across the city, it was pushing 9.50am by the time I was dropped off near the temple. What I should have done then was pay him to wait for an hour or so. That's the advice I would give to anyone visiting this sight because it is not on a busy thoroughfare and when I'd finished there and wanted to move on I couldn't find a sniff of a tuk tuk or taxi even by waiting at the drop off area to try and pick one up. Very strange indeed.Anyhow, once inside I found a ticket booth and bought entry to all parts which cost 140 baht or just under £3.You will find simple but clean toilets in the lower area together with various stalls, stands and exhibitions. The latter are devoted to what is hailed as "the largest Golden Buddha image in the world".I could wait no longer and began to ascend steps to the viewing area in which this gleaming attraction was displayed.You must take your shoes off to go inside....and there it stood nearly 16ft high and weighing 5.5 tons, all solid gold.Even the tale about saving this valuable object is impressive since it was covered in plaster to conceal it from an invading enemy.It was not until 1955 that its true nature and value emerged. A new building had been constructed to enshrine the "plaster" statue but, while preparations were being made to move it, the covering plaster was partially broken, gold gleamed through and it was only then that people realised what was inside. The rest is history.My advice is to take your pictures to one side of the Golden Buddha or the other since worshippers and surrounds help to give perspective to the sheer impressive size of the figure.Away from the statue, there are a number of exhibitions -- both below and above that floor.One of the main themes is trade and there are some very clever displays depicting everything from the inside of a cargo vessel, the docks and workers unloading goods to the bygone version of shopping in Tesco!The whole site was so interesting that it was very easy to lose track of time and it was only my rumbling stomach that tipped me off it was nearly lunchtime.This wonderful attraction is well worth spending a whole morning seeing its various aspects and I would recommend a visit to anyone.

Fast , local visit. If you want to visit a temple more local to the city this is the one to visit, it's a great place to take pictures but very busy with people and a lot of locals trying to get you to buy their items.

Awesome. A solid gold Buddha? Over 700 years old? Really? Yep, really.

So worth it.. Besides being one of the most beautiful Buddhas in Thailand it has a fantastic museum on Chinese history in Thailand. It is something out of Disney World.

Make the time to visit!!!. This was one of their places you hair feel small in. It is so beautiful and understanding the history and the architecture is inspiring. Take your time, take it all in and take lots of pics.

Simply marvelous. Situated at the beginning of China town close (10 min walk) to Hua Lampong station the temple of Golden Buddha is one of the most impressive temples from Bangkok. Visited mostly by Thai people it still has a great touristic potential. The temple has a great architecture , build on three levels it houses at the third level one of the most beautiful Buddha shrine and statue. The entrance fee is 40 THB.
Got to be seen to be believed. It is impossible to think that this is made of gold. Awesome to see,Opened mouth splendor. Fabulous

The Golden Buddha is part of Thai culture and religion.. I am glad we visited the Golden Buddha and did so it's a guide. Th guide helped us learn about the Thai people, culture and the Buddhist religion. I would recommend this when you are in Bangkok.

Overpriced and way too many people. . We went today to see the temple and we felt like cattle being herded through the gate. We elected not to see the inside of the building because there were far to many people to be comfortable. The architecture is beautiful though.
Beautiful. Very nice experience, it was a busy attraction with many chairs put out and lots of people paying respect. It was ok to take pictures and everyone was friendly.

Beautiful Temple. The Temple of the Gold Buddha should be added to your list of places to see. The Buddha image had been here for many years, but just recently the new temple was built. It is a beautiful piece of architecture and well worth some photos. I personally visited the temple this trip by - taking the MRT (subway) to the end of the line at Hua Lampang and walking to Chinatown. The temple grounds are half way to Chinatown.
Very beautiful. Very beautiful place to see. The golden Buddha is amazing and the Temple also. Very nice place to see close from the Chinatown.

Hard place to find. It is was a very hard place to find as a lot of work being done when you exit the train. Took ages to get there. Its quite an amazing thing as all gold. Nice to see but not vital if you ran out of time.

Temple. Must visit the old and new temple. Experience peace and tranquility here.There are banks, rest rooms etc available.

Gorgeous, but more of the same.. As there are lots of Temples in Thailand it is easy to stop appreciating them as much the more you see them. A great place to start when visiting China Town. Wat Traimit is a private temple/museum and the story behind the golden statue is incredible. It is located at the entry to China Town - so spend 1 hour at the temple and continue down the road and explore the alleys.

Beautiful Gold Buddha. The main building has 4 floors. The gold Buddha statue is on the highest floor. The 3rd floor show the history or the gold Buddha statue and the 2nd floor is museum of Chinese-Thai. Don't miss any floor. Moreover, a building near the main building has Buddha'w relics which you could visit and pay respect to them. The temple is near Hua lum pong , the main Bangkok train station.

The worlds biggest solid gold statue, but not much more. The worlds biggest solid gold Buddha statue, but not much more.In the middle of china town so you should take the subway to get here. Taking a tuk tuk is expensive, time consuming and dangerous (they drive like crazy people).Not to crowed, easy to take pictures.As usual you have took off you shoes and hats.

Chinatown's Golden Buddha. Simply a must when you are in Bangkok. We did the whole tour and it costs a little more. That way you get the other floors in the temple and see the story of the Chinese in Bangkok. It is a beautiful ornate temple at the top and a very impressive huge Buddha made out of gold. Interesting story about how it was covered over in the past to protect it. If you cannot do the steps in the front, ask about the elevator in the back toward the left as you face the temple from the street. Blinding Beauty. The temple is stunning, and the main Buddha image is remarkable, as its history. If you go on a sunny day, wear sunglasses. The white marble cladding can be blinding. stunning. The opulence of this temple is difficult to describe. Be sure you have a knowledgeable guide or it will little more than stunning architecture.
Very nice to see in Bangkok. Went there with a local friend and it was a nice sunday morning. If you need you can also use a free wifi on top of the temple. Very nice view of the city.

worth a visit. worth a visit if your in the area, great view from the top. Lots of stairs though if that is an issue. We took the canal boat from Jim Thompson House, the canal boats are great transport - just don't get splashed by the water.

A must visit. Have been to Wat Traimit a few times and it never ceases to impress me. The story of the 5 ton solid Gold Buddha being covered up & forgotten is amazing. Get there early as it does get very crowded with tourists.

Beautiful temple. Great temple, very clean, the golden buddha is stunning. This place has a fantastic energy. We were lucky enough to sit in on chanting monks while we were there. Very spiritual. Also a good view around Bangkok from the top. Take water with you very hot.
Our first stop in Bangkok - what a beginning!. We could not believe how amazing this building is. So much money spent on this beautiful building. We loved it.
A beautiful shrine . A beautiful shrine with amazing statues.. The golden Buddha was an incredible Sight to see. The place was buzzing with tourists eager to get a glimpse of the god.
Crowded but pleasant. Place is quite crowded so please dont expect to get any peace here but you can admire the golden statue of buddha

Worth a visit during your stay in Thailand. A very beautiful landmark that is easily accessible via taxi or public transport BTS.
Visit should only take no more than hour.

do come if you have a bit more time. This temple is not nearly as popular with tourists as other Bangkok attractions; thus less crowded, which is welcome. Practically it is just one, rather tall ornate building but not as ornate as perhaps others. The view from its terraces is spectacular. The main attraction however, is the statue of sitting Buddha made of pure gold. And it shines! Not just because of all that gold, it is also quite serene and beautiful. Well worth a visit. The ticket costs 40Bahts without the museum; there are toilets at the entrance and some vendors. We came by taxi-a convenient and inexpensive way of travel. Just make sure the meter is on. We combined the visit with a stroll along Bangkok Chinatown down to a Chinese temple (Wat Mangkon Kammalawat), which is working temple and not that easy to find hiding in a side alley. Googlemaps useful.

Tonnes of pure gold. I have no knowledge to estimate the historical or aesthetic value of this statue but man this thing is pure gold - the biggest one made by gold. That fact itself makes this thing amazing I think.
a must see. amazing place with this laying huge Buddha...always busy but certainly a must visit...and the best for last to put your 1 bath in all those pots

A short visit. Based on what we saw here it is not a very big site so probably does not require more than an hour or two. There are a number of stairs to get up to the actual temple so be prepared for that, and as usual you will need to remove you shoes and be dressed appropriately to enter the temple. Without a doubt the best feature here is the the statue of the Golden Buddha, but apart from this exploring the area around the temple is well worth a few minutes. Unlike some of the other sites we visited this one was not as busy and allowed photography in the temple.

GIGANTIC SOLID GOLD BUDDHA. The temple is on the edge of Bangkok's Chinatown and the two visits can be combined. The main temple area is on top of a few flights of stairs, commanding a good 360° view of the surroundings. The sanctum contains a large solid gold Buddha statue.
lovely!!. gotta climb a few steps to get here but definitely worth it.must visit when in bangkok. it weighs about 5 tons.
A Must See!. A truly beautiful temple and Buddha. Lots of people however it's worth it to see such an amazing, spiritual piece of architecture. Get there early!

A large Golden Buddha, what can I say?. Let me start the review by stating that I visited many temples during this trip. This was not the most beautiful. It is necessary to climb a bunch of stairs, remove one's shoes, and enter a large room which seems spare by Thai decorative standards. The Buddha is large and gold. It was not my favorite Temple experience in Bangkok.

Family Vacation. Mind Blowing Golden Budha.Worshippers including Many World leaders take this best oppurtunity to visit the temple and pray.We are the lucky ones who got this oppurtunity.Definetly believers should visit in once life time and experience the wonderful work.
Wow. When I heard of the history on how the Golden Buddha came to be in this location I was spellbound. You need to dress appropriately when entering the temple.
Golden Buda. One of the Wats or temples you must not miss in Bangcoc. Its a beatifull building that nest a giant golden statue of a lay-Buda.

Exquisite Architecture. Thailand has approx 250 temples - you will struggle to get to them all, so it's important to narrow down your top few to see to save running around and missing the atmosphere of the city. I would certainly recommend this for its beauty and interest.

Simply Amazing...!!. The grandeur of this Wat is off the map....and i have seen Wats in Cambodia and Myannmar but I have to say this is amazing. I kept saying to myself "Wat Next" this is as beautiful a religious site as exists in the world.
Just amazing. A Buddha with 5.5 tons of pure gold. Check out the history. It was accidentally discovered and is not an astounding Buddha. A must see.
Chinese New Year 2016. Visited this temple 25 year ago during my honeymoon. Revisited this place on the first day of Chinese New Year 8th Feb 2016. Feeling very special on this occasion.

Shiny gold Buddha statue. The main temple building has a few levels. The Golden Buddha is located on the top floor. There is also a museum about Thai Chinese history on the lower level. The items on display are very well presented and it allows me to have greater understanding of the Thai Chinese community.

Peaceful temple. Peaceful temple located high up on the top of a symmetrically designed beautiful temple. The statue itself has more of a platinum silver sort of finish - apparently so designed to prevent theft. A magnificent Buddha - said to be made of over 550 kgs of gold

Amazing Golden Buddha. This temple houses the famous Golden Buddha which is three metres high,weighs 5 tons and is made of solid gold. Estimates put the current value at over 250 million dollars.Apparently it was covered in plaster for centuries to avoid capture until some fell off in 1955 when it was being moved and the gold was discovered.A good view can be had from the top of the temple including the adjoining Chinatown and it is situated 10 minutes walk from Hualanphong MRT station.

My Favorite Buddha Shrine. We visiting many Buddha Shrines, and this was my favorite. There are steep steps to climb to reach the Buddha. The size of the Buddha, the story of how the pure gold Buddha was hidden in an outer coating and discovered by accident, and the beauty are all breathtaking!

What an experience!. We walked from our boat to the temple which was not very far. We walked around and our guide gave us a wonderful insight into Buddhism. The temple itself was huge and as we walked upstairs it was mostly made of marble so was cool. We saw the golden Buddha which was made of solid gold and weighed approximately 1000kg.
Another huge Buddha. I was told that this was supposed to be made of solid gold at one time. Don't know if that is true but it is of an amazing size and I am so glad I was taken there to see it.
this is thailand. i would like to visit a unique place and at the same time experience the culture intermingle with that place. A must place to visit if you are in thailand.
Beautiful and sacred. Very nice temple. With God Buddha made of shiny gold.They have used 5500 Kg of pure gold to create this beautiful image. Very neat and clean temple.

Impressive. A very impressive statue, housed in an equally impressive structure. It's so close to Chinatown that you really should take in both. Entrance for the statue is a nominal fee (exhibition is extra... I didn't bother). Beware of anyone outside insisting you buy/rent scarfs or sarongs to cover up - you don't need them here.

Awesome Temple. This temple is located in the King Temple campound in Bangkok central, Beautiful decorate is golden everywhere, you can feel the 1,000 years energy in the temple.You can get blessed for the priest there
Gold gold everywhere.. This site is a must in Bangkok. The structures are amazing, gold everywhere, and incredible craftmanship went into the creation of the temple structures.

Stunning Golden Budda and complex. After visiting the Royal Palace, on your return to the water taxi & water shuttle pier, one must stop at the nearby Reclining Golden Budda Temple and grounds. The sights are stunning and the complex is also huge. You are allowed to photograph the giant reclining Budda within the temple. It is a must see stop for Bangkok.

Awesome Statue. Visited the Golden Buddha Temple. The massive golden statue of Buddha is awesome. There is a nice park nearby.
Ladies should take ensure that they wear a long dress which covers their legs. Though you have the option to rent a flowing cloth to wear around your waist.

The largest solid gold Buddha image in the world. The temple enshrines the massive solid gold Buddha image named Phra Phuttha Maha Suwan Patimakon displaying the subduing Mara mudra.For centuries the true identity and value of the image were not known, until by accident in the 1950’s it was discovered that the image was made of solid gold. The image is more than three meters high, weighs some five and a half tons and is most likely some 700 to 800 years old. It is the largest solid gold Buddha image in the world.
Beautiful temple. This buddha statue is made of 5.5 tons of solid gold. i would recommend to hire a guide for this place. it cozts about 40bahts S enterence fees.
Beautiful. Enjoyed wandering around the temple of the golden Buddha. Quite a few steps so you need to be reasonably fit to get up there but once inside it is lovely.
Lovely. Beautiful temple and grounds, moments away from all the other main attractions, a definite must when visiting Bangkok.
Golden buddha. Golden buddha is a must visit. One will definately experiance the calmness and peace the movement you enter this place.
Beautiful Buddha. Another lovely Wat to visit and admire the golden Buddha. Not much else to see in the Wat but definitely worth the climb.

Delightful Idol of Golden Buddha. Claimed to be the worlds largest Golden Buddha statue, this temple boasts a 15 feet high and 12 feet wide Buddha representing the culture and belief of Thailand. We happened to chose to visit this place out of sheer curiosity as to why this place is one of the top 5 temples in Modern Thailand. Amidst dusty traffic and busy roads stands this serene temple with gold Colored traditional Thai style temple architecture. Unfortunately, we couldn't visit the exhibition on the third floor. Nevertheless the Buddha on the fourth floor alone is worth the visit. It's usually very hot in Thailand. Carry an umbrella, some sunscreen and some shades if you plan to visit this place.
Fascinating and majestic. Spectacular opulence in the grandest of styles....excessively crowded so go early----really early! Make sure your camera is charged!
Wowzer!. This was one of my favourite temples in Bangkok, it was just stunning! It was very crowded but worth it, the gold was so beautiful and the story behind the gold buddha is fascinating!
A must see. A buddha this big and in solid gold is an absolute must for anybody visit to Bangkok. Do not mis it!
Fantasyic. This is such a stunning temple . Do not miss. Everything is so beautiful. After many temples one gets tired of temples but this one is really special.

Beautiful Temple. The golden buddha statue and the design of the temple was beautiful.
