We went just after New Year's so there were unique hand-woven "plants" made entirely out of banana leaves which devotees slot in money wishing for good luck and all for the new year. It was crowded as locals would visit the temples for the new year, praying for good tidings for the new year. It was a fantastic experience.
Loved it. Brilliant. I loved this and would go again but please remember to respect their religion Buddhism - beautiful and very scenic. if you get the chance then go.

The Legendary Golden Buddha. The place is really cool and the whole place is a historical study place, the first and second floor is mainly a recorded history of the Thailand nation during the steam age and industrial age. the decoration and explanation with picture and drawing on the wall really explain clearly, and they also made a room that really match the current style of the age that room was explaining from.The Price has to kind, one package to see the Golden Statue at the top, and the other one give an access around the first and second floor. it mainly cost 100 baht for seeing the statue and 300 baht for the whole package.
Nice but nothing shocking. . We were to late so apparently you have to be on time to go inside. The outside is nice.. Going in costs money for foreingers, it was about 100-200 baht if I am correct.
Solid gold!. If you want to see what 5.5 tons of solid gold looks like then the golden Buddha is worth visiting. It's 40 baht to visit and you can pay an extra 100 baht to see an exhibition.

Just a simple temple for photoshooting . The entrance fees is quite cheap but what to be seen inside is the same with the price. A lot of Buddha statues with the history written on each and also the big temple in the middle of the location. The temple is surrounded by river and that is all we can enjoy inside. You just need 10 - 20 minutes to completely survey around this place

Buddha - The golden one. The temple is almost in the middle of market. The statue of Golden buddha is nice apart from that there's nothing much.For ladies, you must not be wearing sleeveless or if you do you can get a cloak on rent for 20 Baht.

Stunning temple . This was a beautiful temple and contains the largest golf Buddha in the world. I would 100% recommend getting a guide as there was so much additional information available which was fascinating.

Amazing to think that is is solid gold. Stayed at the Shanghai Mansion hotel which was 5 minute walk from the Golden Buddha. Many steps to climb so not so good for the disabled but well worth the experience when you arrive at the top
A good temple to visit. This is a fascinating temple with many artefacts to peruse & spectacular at night. Lots of good things also to do close by.

Cheap and close excursion, great experience. I went here just as a quick excursion from my hotel and it was well worth it. The admission was cheap, the temple and buddha inside were awesome, and it is definitely a testament to the amazing culture of Thailand. If you have an hour or so then definitely take a stop by the golden buddha.

Overrated . I went here due to the reviews here on Trip Advisor, but maybe I had too high expectations on whole thing. It was just a big Buddha that left you thinking "wow, look at all that gold that could be used in a better way".
Wow. This is a small Buddhist temple that is important to Thai culture. As temples go, it is not that dramatic, but is you want to see what 5 1/2 tons of solid gold looks like, then go.

On the way to China town. Just outside the gate to China Town, close to the Hua Lamphong railway station. Well worth a visit. Nice building and sacred place for the thais. There's a small fee of 40 bath.
Impressive. 5500 kilos of solid gold! This buddah is amazing and the surroundings are truly wonderful. This is a must for everyone visiting Bangkok.

Largest gold seated budha. worlds largest massive gold seated budha located in the temple of WAT TRAIMIT.The statue weighs 5.5 tons.It is believed to be made in 13 th -14 th century.It is said to survived burmese invasion as it was completely plastered to prevent it from being stolen.The King Rama I brought it to Bangkok.Later while moving statue the plaster cracked revealing golden statue.In 2010 the large new building of temple with golden budha was inauguratedlift facility available.Looking at the beautiful statue,you can experience the inner peace.
Largest golden Buddha in the world.. Very large Buddha made of gold. Interesting history of temple and the discovery of this Buddha. Highly recommending visiting.
Well good. Had a guided tour round and we were knocked out by the sheer size and beauty of the golden Buddha ,best time to see in the morning so the crowds are manageable,go on treat yourself
Magnificent. Wow amazing place, in central Bangkok, very quaint and peaceful with deep and hidden beauty, a must visit for anybody

Hidden gem in Chinatown, worth a brief visit. The Wat Traimit is quite popular with both locals as well as tourists. Although the temple is nothing comparable in size to the Wat Pho site or the Wat Arun it is nevertheless impressive and worth a visit with the largest solid gold Buddha inside. There is a low fee ticket for the 4th floor only (c.1.5 USD), which allows access to where the Golden Buddha is located , or you may opt to get the full ticket for access to an exhibition on the other floor. As with other Wats in Bangkok, sleeveless or mini skirts / shorts are not allowed, shorts seem to be OK for guys.

A great wat. We stumbled upon this wat on our way from the train station to the Chinatown market. It is a large and quite famous place, so we were a but surprised that we didn't know of it, as we have been to Chinatown several times.We came early in the morning, about 7 a.m., and there were a lot of people already. You can choose to see only the statue, which is at the top, or an exhibition as well. We chose only the statue, and climbed the stairs to the top.The statue was... well,another golden Buddha, but the wat was nice and there was a view.As usually in a wat, you need to remove your shoes and cover your shoulders. You will find excellent and free toilets, a souvenir shop and and some shopping stalls.

Only takes 30 minutes to see the whole thing.. Nice quick site. Easy access. Says its 1000 steps or something. Not sure about that but its easy to get up. There is an elevator hiding in the back. Dont wear a dress the pervs sit at the bottom of the steps and look up all the girls dresses. Does cost but not much. Becareful with the taxis, always have then turn on the meter or youre being ripped off.

Beautiful temple. This is one of the iconic attractions in Bangkok. Don't miss it. There are quite a few steps but it is not bad. There is an elevator for those unable to walk up the steps. The golden Buddha is beautiful, and there are great views from the top.
Have to visit..... We hired a Tuk Tuk for the day and The Temple of the Golden Buddha was our first stop which was such a peaceful place and respect. A must visit...
Gold. This Buddha statue is made of Gold.A beautiful statue. Worth the visit.Lots of tourists. The craftsmanship is very good.
You should visit once in your life. I've been there twice in my life I prayed respect of the golden buddha for peace and to feel wonderful inside our heart .

Nice to visit ,5 tons of Gold Buddha. Its worse to buy the ticket to go up to the 4th floor, because its really cheap and the view is amasing. Its nice to walk up and look inside and see the pure gold of Buddha
Beautiful Temple well worth a visit. We spent about an hour wondering around, ensure you are covered up or take something to cover yourself with - goes without saying really!

Absolutely fantastic!!. Energy of this place is amazing... It is very spiritual and peaceful place even there are many tourists and religious people coming to bow and pray to Golden Buddha. One just wish to stay still, breathe and feel...

Majestic. While it's really not like me to be impressed by gold or ornamentation necessarily, I find this place incredibly stunning and intimate. In fact, in the four months that I've toured Thailand I've been back here 3 times. The story of how this amazing piece of artwork came to us is really worth knowing by itself. But to stand a few feet away is a feeling ... well I just can't find the words ....
golden budhha temple was a nice peaceful place. its a nice place to visit if you are in bangkok. you need to wear clothes covering your legs and arms so no shorts and no sleveless.
nice gilden temple. Amazing! Gold and Buddha figures all around! Nice feeling, no dislikes! Liked everything! The walls and roofs covered with gold cover! Nice view!

Too crowded to be enjoyed. We visited on a hot sunny day. It was the weekend and large crowds were out. We felt a little rushed through the place. All was not lost as most people were generally polite and friendly. The experience would be better with fewer people around

Too many steps. I'm not sure this temple is worth it after you've seen the both the Jade Buddha and the Reclining Buddha. It's just too much effort for so little return. There are just too many steps, and then a crowded room to see a fairly small Buddha made of gold. My advice is to skip this one and take some extra time in the area around the Reclining Buddha.

One of the must in Bangkok... Really very nice, peaceful and wonderful place...we where there for the 31 of December...the atmosphere was amazing and we had a unforgettable time....make our life better ...

Amazing . The temple look like any other temple at Bangkok, But once you go through the history of that temple you realises what makes Thai people so fond of there Temples and culture , you need to pay a entry fee but it's worth the money if you wanna know more about the Thai history. Definitely worth a trip and you can walk to the temple from Hua Lamphong station.

Worth a look. Visited this attraction as part of a group tour with Buffalo Tours, it's super crowded and not a lot to do other than listen to the history from your guide and take some photos. But it's one of those 'must see' things in Bangkok
One of the best. Certainly this is one of the more aesthetically pleasing of the temples in Bangkok. There is no pressure to pray or donate.

Crowded, but worth it. We were on a cruise ship tour and the crowds are incredible. On our visit it was super hot and humid, but the sights were worth it. I think it would be better to go independently than as part of a group. When in a group, you are so concerned about getting separated from the group, you don't have time to get good pictures.

Nice, and not full of tourists.. There are two temples here, both stunning in their own ways. The main temple was nice, and the 5.5ton Buddha at the top is great. We went around 10am and there werent many people, and then went onto the smaller temple afterwards.
Beautiful. This temple is very beautiful and it showcases the Thai culture very well. The authority have maintained the temple very well.

Worth visiting.. We visited Wat Traimit as part the a half day temple tour organized by Oriental Escape. It has an interesting history about how the golden Buddha was revealed under a stucco cover. Its a small temple and can be covered in 15-20mins. It was a bit crowded though. Worth visiting in Bangkok.

Must see. It's an amazing history of a superb idol, certainly worth a visit.Easy to get to via MRT to Hua Lamphong station (terminal station) & 5 minute walk to temple. Also worth taking in Chinatown, around back streets.
Just another Buddha .. Yeah another way to spend 20 minutes . I payed homage and moved on . You can take some great pix of the surrounding area tho .
Touristic highlight of the trip. I was amazed by this unbelieveable sight, although 'packed' does not even begin to describe how busy the entire area has been

Worth everything they say about it.. Welcome change to visit this place after huge crowds at imperial palace. Golden Buddha is some wondorous site. Allowed to take photos and easy to navigate. Cheap admission cost.
Beautiful. Very beautiful both the Buddhaa and exhibition. Can take some great pictures. Entrance fee is 100TB, a little expensive. The place is full of history

Impressive Buddha. We could not go into the overall Wat as they were busy with a ceremony but we did manage to see the golden Buddha which was quite impressive. Worth a visit as it is one of the quieter Wats in Bangkok.
Fabulous. A great couple of hours. Really relaxing, spiritual feel, monks smile st you, good for foreigners and lots of locals too

Stunning. Was right next to hotel so felt obliged to visit, Paid a small entry fee and was pleasantly greeted by Monks who guided us through the temple and explained all things Buddhism. Was a real insight. Gift shop had lovely blessed items whilst outside there was a market. Well worth a visit. Cover up please.
Wow!. Even after seeing all the Buddhas I have seen before . Just to know that this one is made of solid gold makes it a beautiful sight.

Impressive. This is one of the stops on our city tour. Crowded and the tourist does not seemed to pay attention to the signs. Many people doing selfies without showing any respect to the temple. I'm not a Buddhist but at least tourist should repect the culture of the country they are visiting.  The golden buddha is small. The tour takes only about 15-20 min to complete. We went with our tour guide so parking was not a problem for us.

The temple near China town. At one end of Chinatown, in what was once an otherwise unremarkable temple of Wat Traimit, sits the world's largest solid gold Buddha image. Made of about 83% pure gold and weighting at five and a half tons, the 4.5 meters (15 feet) tall seated image is worth 21.1 millions pounds in Guinness Book of record in 1991 A.D.
Interesting!. Very picturesque, and the exhibition was very interesting, but very overpriced though. 100 Baht? Should be 100 for both the Buddha and the exhibition.

Golden Buddha with very interesting history. Great site to visit as part of temple tour while in Bangkok, The history on the concealment and eventual recovery of the solid gold Buddha was very interesting. The tourist facilities were good. The temple architecture was impressive.
Interesting but short visit. We didn't go to the museum underneath so it was a short visit to see the golden Buddha. Interesting to see but very short visit

Golden Buddha. This was an exceptional experience the temple was a short walk from the water taxi when entering you have the choice of walking up steps or use a elevator when inside the golden buddha was stunning would recommend any visitor to Bangkok not to miss this beautiful Buddha.
Breathe taking. Do not miss this temple. It's not very large, but it's beautiful. About a 20 min ride from the Grand Sukhumbit hotel via taxi

Beautiful !!!. We were a group of 9, including 4 adults and 5 children aged between 6 and 17 .... everyone was impressed with this attraction. Close to major hotels and city center , entry price is very reasonable and is interesting to all ages including our 4 teenage children. ( if you are travelling with teenagers, this is sometime hard to achieve)

Amazing Buddha. The temple is outstanding and it contrasts with the nearby architecture. The Buddha is amazing, considering it was catalogued as the most expensive religious object in the world by the Guiness World Records.It is not worth it to pay te ticket for the exhibition in the lowers floors, pay just for the Buddha.

Temple of golden Buddha. The golden Buddha located I think third floor.I visited only this floor with 40Bht.This Buddha is very cheap to see.This is beautiful.For me is not wondeful.Because there are many Buddha images in our country.But mostly with only bronze Buddha.
Very Beautiful. We went on New year's eve and the place was decked up for the night ceremony. It was a truly amazing experience.

Worth the effort. Beautiful temple, must visit if you are in Bangkok. For elderly and those who are not fit to take the stairs, there is an elevator at the back!! Not sure how many people know about it, our guide took my mother-in law thru an elevator up to the top sanctum.

Golden Buddha. Came across this temple whilst walking towards Chinatown (Yaowarat) from Hua Lamphong station.Impressive solid gold Buddha (apparently biggest gold seated Buddha in the world) which was discovered by accidentally when it was dropped and its outer plaster casing cracked.THB 40 entrance fee to see the Golden Buddha on the 4th floor - be prepared to climb the stairs.

Worth the trip. I went there to pray for well being of myself and family. The temple is mainly for devotees to pray and I would not really classified as tourist attraction. If you do go there please observe the dress code and be sure to be in appropriate attire.

Nice attraction.... Another temple. The temple is beautiful as are majority of them in Thailand we visited New Year's Day which is recognised as quite a spiritual day for the Buddhas so there wer lots of local Thai people.Giant golden Buddha makes a nice phot opportunity And if you are interested in visiting China town it's right opposite!
Buddha!. The buddha icon is made of gold and looks truly fantastic. The sanctuary is very much kept up and enriched.

A Golden Ticket!! . A sight to see! A heavy gold statue made from.......(i'll say it again).. gold.Seeing it in its shiny exuberance.Interesting story in its discovery. Hidden for years until it was dropped and pieces breaking off only to expose the gold underneath.I'm sure there are more details but that's the summary.Be prepared to climb steps. No many, but enough to have you take an xtra breath.Ring the bells if you can. Fun to do and manifest your desires while ringing them as you walk down the line.In vicinity of China Town.
Gold all over. So many temples and gold statues but u need to see this one. Lots of steps to walk and it gets hot. very busy
Just beautiful. A lovely place to visit early in the day .There are lots of steps so maybe not so good for those with mobility issues
Serene. Nice beautiful temple to visit. The temple depicts the thai culture. One can try meditation at the temple for sometime with self

Awesome detail. The attention to detail they use while making these temples is simply AMAZING! One could only imagine the man-hours that goes into just painting the walls, let alone decorating the outside or casting the buddhas. Visiting these temples is a must if you are near the area.

Family favourite but very busy. This was my families favourite Buddha of those visited in Bangkok. I preferred the Grand Palace but this Buddha was spectacular. However the site was packed even though we visited on the last day of the Thai Xmas holidays and the city was quieter than normal.
Grand Sight. The buddha idol is made of gold and looks really grand. The temple is well maintained and decorated.
Good first point to visit but not essential. Lovely first point to visit but if you are visiting the Grand Palace and Reclining Buddha then this does not offer anything particularly new.

First temple to see in chinatown in your bangkok city temple tour. You need to climb the stairs to enter the temple. Inside you can take pictures. Then proceed to the bells to pray for good fortune. Thereafter theres another temple below for more picture taking. Near chinatown so take the time to eat at yaowarat road.
Interesting Buddha excellent museum. It was interesting seeing the golden Buddha but the best part was the museum on the 2nd floor that showed the Chinese migration to Bangkok.
Unique experience. This was a unique experience, first time in a temple. It felt great, holy and very serene. Beautiful place, as always great to experience another culture.

Good to see if you have extra time. After visitng other popular temples in Bangkok, this one is not extraordinary by any standards. But we went there as it was on the way for our visit to China town. Can go there for 30 min or so, if you have enough free time, or else skip.
Amazing. Despite the vast crowds this was so impressive. There is constant work to restore these magnificent buildings.

Temple . 5.5 tons of gold in one statue , if you do the math at Jan 2015 prices that's 188.5 million US . And don't get any ideas there's no way you're getting out of the building and it's only guarded by monks
Devotion in Action. This temple is smack in the middle of the city and is obviously revered by the believers. A nice break from the crazy life of the city surrounding it.
City tour. This was part of our tour which included city tour and temple tour. It was interesting to see the huge statue of Buddha made of solid gold.

More or less the same. If you've seen the other temples in Thailand then this is more or less the same. The Temple designs are intricate and the surroundings are well maintained. Unfortunately our "guide" wasn't exactly full of information so best advice would be to go alone and explore yourself

Temple of Golden Buddha - get enlightened. One must visit golden buddha, I was told the Buddha is made of complete pure gold weighs roughly 5.5 tonnes of gold. Beautifully made and one can take the pictures, the shoes need to be removed before you enter the goldn buddha temple.
Magnificent. Magnificent, if only for the breathtaking size and craftsmanship. Great to see the temple actively utilised by the local population for religious purposes.

5 Tons of Gold!!. We decided to do the Trio Temple tour on one day which consisted of a half day tour. We learnt so much from this temple. Our tour guide gave us the history behind the 5 ton gold statue and was really informative. We really enjoyed this day visiting various temples. With this package, we also visited Wat Po (Reclining Budda) & Emerald Temple. Stunning pieces within the city.

Amazing and not to be missed. This was our first stop in exploring Bangkok. It is amazingly rich in cultural significance, feel and depth. This was our first glimpse into Thai culture and beauty and what an excellent place to start. Take lots of photos. It is all eye candy.
A grand sight. A grand and a great place to visit.I t is a wonderful experience to see the Golden Buddha along with so many Buddhas.

Interesting. Interesting.It has great view, and temple is nice. I like the colors and energy.
Pay attention on your clothes, otherwise you have to pay for some cover. So better bring your own.

Part of city temple tour. First temple we visited in Bangkok. Very busy but worth seeing. Many many stairs to climb. After all the climbing we found out that there are elevators that will take you up to a certain level though not sure if the temple is wheel chair accessible . Worth seeing.
Amazing Temple. The Golden Buddha Temple is very nice and the Golden Buddha weighs 5.5 Tons and its and awsome sight to see this in the Temple.

peaceful.. Peaceful but bit of tourist exploited including myself :/
The holy temple is situated right next to the China Gate, very tourist friendly.
I happen to wore shorts which I shouldn't but there were none to stop me into entering the temple.

A place you should visit. As always love the Thai architecture designs with Theravada Buddhism, the biggest golden Buddha statue. Can see Chinese temples when you go to the top. Nice place with surroundings (Chinatown)

Bangkok tour stop. Visited monument accompanied with a tour guide who had excellent historical knowledge. We are a family of four with two teenagers who were fascinated by this beautiful monument. A must see in Bangkok

Golden Buddha-Must see. Golden Buddha on our last visit still housed in a narrow, small temple, he is now in a marble-clad construction - without spiritual aura of yesteryear. This temple is very suitable for wheelchairs . You come all the way up to the Golden Budda.There are elevators and ramps. This temple also visited the King of Thailand in his wheelchair . Must see.

Tour. Not much to see here really unless if you want to see what the bhuddha looks like and are amazes by Bhuddist architecture besides that all thats there is the golden buuddha and well decorations that show respect and a place you can pray. No shoes allowed u walk in bare feet.
Amazing place to visit.. This place has an amazing number of "temples" and the construction is a marvel to me. Lovely, scenic and inspiring. No shoe rule in effect and was very crowded for our visit.

It's okay in overall. My mom brought me here for saluting the buddha inside since she believed that 2015 is my bad luck year, according to the Chinese calendar. It's hard to find a good parking here. I do not know much about this place but the temple is beautiful and worth to visit.
A great visit. Be prepared for crowds and in the summer it can be very hot. That said this is a must see and pretty impressive.

Well worth the effort. Hard to go past the impressive scale of 5.5 tonnes of gold. Entrance fee is a reasonable 40 baht to see the Buddha alone. Can get very busy at times so be prepared to wait for the "perfect" snap.

Amazing structure but small. This tenple has two parts. The old temple which houses the deity for prayers and thr new one with the golden buddha. The walls are all hand painted witht thw symbol of thr current kings number 9 printed all over. The ceiling is breathtaking. Pretty serene.

Big Golden Budhha. 5.5 tons of real gold Budda Statue,amazing.The origins of this statue are uncertain. It is made in the Sukhothai Dynasty style of the 13th-14th centuries, though it could have been made after that time.
Out of this world . 5 tons of real gold Budda Statue, amazing sums it all up. Great place to visit and the history behind the statue is something unheard of. Do visit if you can.

Lovely temple!. Wat Traimit is a lovely temple, with an amazing statue of the golden buddha, which is actully made of solid gold, unlike the other temples.
A must visit when in Bangkok
Great for photography. Took some lovely photo's here and its walking distance to China town which is around the corner, this is a great location to visit along the way

Little out the way but worth it. We jumped in a tuk tuk here from grand palace and it was 300 baht (approx £6) it was quite a long journey to get here it is at one end of Chinatown. We paid 40baht each to see the Buddha. You can choose to pay an extra 100 baht and go to the exhibition too. We walked to the top floor. Shoulders and legs must be covered but you can hire clothes at the ticket office. The Buddha is very impressive the largest gold Buddha in the world.

Golden Buddha was beautiful.. This temple is great to visit on your way to the Grand Palace and Wat Pho. The Buddha was beautiful and it was interesting to hear how it had been left unknown for such a long time.
Religious place. This is a buddha temple.This place is beautiful.But nothing to enjoy.You can take some photos.And you can see the place

The Golden Buddha. We have visited on previous trips many temples, so wanted something different this time. Wat Traimit is located on the edge of Chinatown and contains a large golden Buddha image on the fourth floor.There is an entrance fee for tourists, which is either 40B for just seeing the Buddha or 140B for seeing Buddha and exhibition on 3rd floor.The Buddha sits magnificently in the temple and you can walk around the entire Buddha. The building itself is covered in marble and gold trimming, which glistens in the sunshine.Long trousers for men are requested but I saw many men wearing shorts who rented for a small fee shawls to cover themselves up.Ignore the tuck tuck drivers trying to scam you for small fees as you exit the temple and wake your way to Chinatown, which is a short walk away.

An religious statue worth 38 million pounds. What a nice building with a great expo on how the buddha was made. And the background story. Loved the place and the buddha is impressive in refinement. Also go to the temple opposite to the golden buddha to find some more spiritual time

Solid Gold!!!!!. This attraction is on the fringes of Chinatown Bangkok,so you can tie the 2 together at same time.The building housing the Buddha is a 4 storey building but with access only to the 4th floor which houses the Golden Buddha. To say the Buddha is overwhelming would be an understatement when you consider it is 'solid gold' weighing in at over 5 tonnes with an Gold weight value of nearly £30 Million!!!!!!!! Apart from the gleaming statue there is not much to see.

My First Buddha Temple. Wat Traimit is where the world's largest massive gold seated Buddha measuring nearly five metres in height and weighing five and a half tons.At some point, the statue was completely plastered over to prevent it from being stolen. The statue was covered with a thick layer of stucco, which was painted and inlaid with bits of coloured glass.[
Amazing Buddha Statue. Temple is beautiful and majestic. There are halls in the lower level to perform religious rituals. Can see nearby Chinatown.

Golden Buddha (Wat Traimit). We hesitated in visiting this temple initially because once again there was a fee involved. One can only see so many temples on a given trip! However we decided to pay the admission because of the attraction of a museum inside the upper floors of the temple that provided insight to the Chinese settlement in that area. This was a very worthwhile payment because the historical data and visual displays were excellent. There was also a section that told of the history of the construction of the golden Buddha and how it was hidden under plaster for so centuries because of invading armies. This is also a sacred site for worshippers of the Buddhist faith and it is interesting to observe the rituals of this faith.
impressive.. for some reason I was impressed by this temple more than wat arun or other well known ones. it has a unique history and definitely a must see place.
Golden Temple. This is a nice building with traditional design. Lots of tourist on this area. You can buy cheap souvernir around here.
Impressive. This is a unique temple due to the huge gold statue. It is very interesting to learn the story surrounding it.

Golden Buddha. We had a visit to Temple of Gold Buddha near china town area. According to the history , the golden buddha was completely plastered for preventing from being stolen at one stage and the true identity was discovered after 200 years time. It is very magnificent statute with great details. It is 5.5 tonnes and made of gold (estimated worth of 250 million dollars). Must visit temple.

Very Busy but worthwhile. As with most of the tourist places in Thailand it was very busy with people all jostling to get a good photo or take a look. This can be quite frustrating so be patient. Take plenty small change for the numerous donations and tips expected and wear comfy cheap shoes.

Near China Town. I wen there on 11 Decmber 2015 during Bike for Dad. This temple is so quiete and good to take picture. Located in the entrance of China town. amazing building decorated with many flowers due to King's Birthday. After taking photo we can walk to China Town to get some foods

Another must see in Bangkok. Very fascinating place to visit. Also the nearby China Town adds to this attraction. We found the temple to be a serene place to visit. The history of the golden idol being once covered in concrete to evade the enemy adds to the mystic of the place.
Nice. Can skip.. If not so fond of temples. All in all a peaceful place... Keep water and be hydrated also there is a place to eat nearby 7/11 you get burgers there

It is amazing to see all of that gold in one spot!. It is definately one of the mor popular sights. There were loads of people here but I'd imagine in summer time it is a lot busier. You could still get in to take photos no problem. I would say December is a great time to come because it is very pleasant.

You gotta be kidding ... 5 1/2 tons of gold!. The Buddah, weighing in at 5.5 tons, is solid gold, cast in nine pieces and left hiding in the jungle for centuries. Whoever hid it probably used his kingdom's entire treasury. The temple is modest by Thai standards but the image of the Buddah is by far the most dramatic anywhere in the world -- rating with the Pieta by Michaelangelo in terms of significant religious art.
Must see!. Great place to visit and to worship. Located in the city heart very near the chinatown. Great for enjoying some street food around and take pictures.

Great place or kids to run around. Staff were really nice to the kids.. This was a fun place to go with the kids, 8,7,5 and 3. You have to take a tuk-tuk from the public ferry to get there. Also fun for the kids.BEWARE of the tuk-tuks when you are exiting. We explained several time we wanted to go the public ferry. He ended up taking us down a small long alley to a private tour which wanted 2000bat. What a joke. When then had to walk out the long alley and try to find transport to a public ferry. We had no idea where we where so that was annoying. The next tuk-tuk, which was the only transport that would stop took us to another privet ferry dock. What a joke. Luckly my wife and kids stayed in the tuk-tuk so he couldn't take off and we were finally able to get to the public ferry which only cost 40bat.

It's a must see. I visit temples and similar when I need to slow down. I first visited in May after 4 days at the Dental Hospital, now 6 months later, more dentistry. Another visit to this peaceful place. My only tip is take your time, wander around, respect the tranquillity. Read a book in a quiet nook.

Peaceful and beautiful. The temple of the Golden Buddha is beautiful and you have a sense of peace when in the temple. The buddha is made of 5 tons of solid gold. We visited with a guide so we were fortunate to be taken up in a lift. You have to take off your shoes and step over the threshold. This place is a must see. Also, the view from here is great.

Calming and Satisfying. Golden Buddha has given me and my wife a pleasant feeling and calmness when we are there. First sight of Buddha was overwhelming with the size and peaceful posture. You need to visit to feel for your self.

5.5 tons of gold in one divine statue of the Buddha . Lovely new temple built to house the amazing and colossal golden Buddha. Definitely must see this. I we to in the morning and it was not crowded, so the temple was serene.
Beautiful . Beautiful temple, definitely worth the story. It's also right in the Chinatown district so it's also worth it to walk around and check the area.
the golden buddha is a must see. the only problem with this temple is it's off center locationthe temple is nice and you get a nice view

Very interesting. It´s a small place (like a small church), and you must take off your shoes to enter (as every temple there).It´s really interesting to see a 5 ton Buda made of gold. There is a nice history regarding that statue, do you know?It has more than 700 years and was made with a plaster cover to protect the gold against looters. But the people didn´t know that.In 1950´s they discovered the underneath gold hidden.
A lot of Buddha status. Went here when noon time. quit hot, but you will see a lot of Buddha status at here. within an hour can finish here.

My Morning Visit To Temple of the Golden Buddah. . I loved this place due to the Chirning and Ringing of temple bells. It gave me peace to be there at that times. It is a huge climb to reach up to the budda shrine itself but normal healthy adults can manage but I do not recommend to take the elderly there as their is no means to climb up for them . Everyone has to remove their shoes before they actually enter the main Golden Buddah Shrine based at the top of the temple. I was very happy to visit this place as I enjoyed the quietness and serenity of the temple and the Thai architecture of temples is fabulous.

The Golden Buddha. There is the biggest in the world golden Buddha statue there made of one piece of gold. People come to pray there. You can also watch an interesting religious tradition there when people cover little Buddha statues with thin golden leaves.

This temple is absolutely beautiful!. It is just a taxi away from the center of town, or a long walk; spend the day there admiring its beauty. Be respectful of the local and religious customs please. Enjoy this peacefully.

Must see, amazing statue of Buddha. The statue of Buddha is more than 5 ton in weight and the place is really divine. You can even find monks around the temple. It is advisable to go early so that you will not have problems.
peaceful. very peaceful place. Clicking photo is allowed here.So get a good one after getting in from the front door. Sit near the northern door inside the temple to get the cool breeze.
Beautiful temple. most see in Bangkok. This temple is very beautiful and you must see this is you visit Bangkok. We really enjoyed walking around and see all the little details of the temple.

Wow, a five ton golden Buddha. This is one gigantic buddha. It is a 5 ton golden buddha discovered under stucco in 1955. It is located convenient to China Town. You are allowed to take photos. Crowds can be a problem, go early. It was interested to see the many monks walking around. Go to the 2nd and 3rd floor for very interesting exhibits on the making of the buddha, and the Chinatown Heritage Center.
Excellent. The 5.5 ton gold Buddha is worth visiting, the place is realy devine, you can do some shoppling around the temple as well.

Must visit. It is located end of Chinatown. The entrance fee is about 5 USD. You are free to take photos inside and get there early because it gets crowded not only by tourists but also Buddhist monks and worshippers. The 2nd floor of the building has exhibits on how the statue was made. The 3rd floor is home to the Chinatown Heritage center exhibits on the history of Bangkok's Chinatown and its residents.Please always remember to behave respectfully when visiting all the temples so as not to offend locals or people giving worship. Also dress appropriately: girls knees must be covered and your shoulders as well.
Nice and Beautiful temple in BKK. Beautiful temple, You will see a big golden Buddha statute here and could take a respect.There are a lot of attractive place around the temple.
Good place if you are interested not only in tourist highlights. In walking distance from Hua Lumpong railway station. Little charge to get in, tall Budda made of massive gold.

Gold discovered only 70 years before. The temple was built around 1300-1400 and was made of pure gold, but to hide it from the foreign invaders, they covered the gold from plaster. In 1954, the plaster started to come out and people realized that the full statue of Lord Buddha is made of gold. So, it has a very striking history. The place is full of Indians and Europeans.
Nice temple. the golden Buddha is nice temple, nice place to seeing , if you follow budda should to see and you can get the lucky on future

Another Buddha, but impressive . Since it was big and made of real gold I guess it was more impressive. The story behind it and how it was discovered was worth a read. As usual, must be dressed in appropriate clothing. There is a place you can hire sarongs right there where you pay to get in.Don't use the fortune telling machines out the side, they will gobble up your coins and not work. Definitely worth a look. Doesn't take long.
Beautiful temple. Beautiful temple, Big golden Buddha statue is kept here. Ambiance is very good, and not much crowd. Lot of monks stay in nearby hostels and practice meditation here.
love it I wil be back. this place should be visit by everyone that visit Thailand, it is amazing!!!!!!!Im looking forward to go back to this wonderful place.
Nice temple on the edge of China town,. Enjoyed this, but perhaps not worth a special trip or the ticket price compared to other temples. Go if you are nearby!

Put this one further down your list of priorities in Bangkok. The Temple of the Golden Buddha is without a doubt impressive, but it is squeezed in to a hard to find, congested corner of Chinatown. There are so many temples and Buddhas to see in this city, make this a quick stop on the way to somewhere else or give it a miss.

Revered place, close to city center.. The place is in the middle of the city, accessible by MRT (subway). Nice atmosphere with small museum of the chinatown people. The museum has some interactive spots. Fun to walk around. The buddha itself is so beautiful. You can meet all sorts of people here, from foreign tourists to the locals. Love the place. Been there twice already.
Don't bother with the exhibition. The Buddha and flowers are wonderful. Nice buildings surrounding. The exhibition was only the history of the Chinese in Thailand.

Very interesting.. Good place to explore and learn some of Thailands history. The Golden Buddha is an amazing site to see and photograph.Not to be missed visit and takes only an hour or two.Non-Thai visitors should be prepared to pay a small entrance fee but it is well worth the cost.The location is a short walk or taxi ride from hotels or the main train station which in turn is reachable by convenient MRT connection.
Golden Buddha. first temple we visited as part our tour we booked.was in awe at this gold statue..our guide also gave us detail as to the history of how the budda came about.very interesting

Pretty. It took my partner and i some time to find this place, as we were roaming around Chinatown. But once we managed to find it, it was a gorgeous place. The entrance fee is cheap, and quite insignificant, and once inside, it has very pretty drawings, engravings on the wall, and of course the golden buddha. Can get a bit crowded, but worth the wait/crowd

Fantastic Temple. It's very easy to get templed out in Bangkok, and after visiting the Golden Palace and Wat Pho we accidently stumbled upon this temple as we were leaving China Town. The temple is not nearly as busy as the others and also provides a nice view of the surrounding city. The statue itself is also quite a sight to behold, probably the most gold I will ever see at any one time in my life, beat that Vegas! Be sure to grab a free information pamphlet when you buy your tickets that gives a short explanation of the temple.

Superb . You can't believe how big this Buddha is and it's solid gold! As with all the temples in Bangkok this is very popular so start your tour early before it gets crowded and very hot....this is a must!
Incredibly shiny! . So shiny in fact that I had trouble getting an in focus picture. Many Thai people come here to worship and it can get a bit crowded in the shrine room. Nice for a quick visit!
Must see! . Very cheap entrance fee. It is a must see as it is 5.5 tons of gold! 4th floor so there are some steps you have to climb.
Golden Buddha a must see in Bangkok. One of the more interesting temples. amazing that this solid gold Buddha was hidden in plain sight before being discovered
must visit in Thaniland!. This is a great architectural work and you can mesmerize yourself in chanting Lord Buddha's name at this temple.
amazing. the biggest buddha statue of pure gold in thailand, it weights 5000 kg of pure gold !!! great temple
Very impressive!!!. Very impressive. Buddha Statue with 5.5 Tn of gold. Stairs to the temple gives a very beautiful look. Prayer here and you will surely feel calm. Too good place, not be missed.

A must for the spiritual. If you are a spiritual person the takings tour of the temples is a must. Calming relaxing, we need more emphasis in the world on just being a good person. The temples have rejuvenated me!
Good palce to visit in bangkok... Its a one of the kind of Buddha statue of 5500 KG Solid Gold which is having great history behind it.. Good environment and Great artwork,

Gold, Gold, Gold!. It is superb and a lot of gold every where. Very beautiful and worth the visit. Do not visit on week ends it is very very busy. You will not enjoy because too many crowds and you will be competing taking photographs all the time!

A beautiful temple with an incredibly stunning sculpture of Buddha.. As a temple, this is one of the more attractive. The stairs might turn some away who have mobility issues, but if you don't have a problem climbing, do it. The Buddha statue is worth the money for a ticket and the effort of the climb. The entrance cost is low so that isn't a deterrent. Because this site is clearly a must-see for all tourists and especially those of the Buddhist faith, the crowds, for some, will takeaway from being able to quietly appreciate the temple and statue. Take a deep breath and try not to get frustrated. If you are patient, you will get an excellent picture of the temple and/or statue. The views of the city from the perimeter terrace are quite good and fewer people are out there. Take advantage of this.

Combination of religion, culture, and education. The temple has developed to be more ready for tourists with a museum to tell the unique history of the Golden Buddha. There's an elevator to facilitate tourists as needed as well. In the same compound, there're two schools, one primary and the other secondary...the latter is where I used to work as a teacher. What the whole temple shows to all is part of the Thai roots for temples in the olden days to play a key role in education, and for students to be very close to Buddhism through a number of religious ceremonies and discussions with monks and novices residing in the temple. In addition, the temple shows the harmony of the Chinese and the Thais with its proximity to Chinatown.

Ok but wouldn't have been sad to miss. The Buddha was pretty cool, but not as impressive as I was thinking. The temple was also really small and pretty much just the room the statue was in. I would have preferred to check out a different temple instead, but still not terrible.Also be sure you are physically able to climb stairs as it is a few stories up. I didn't look for an elevator but it might be something you want to check if you are worried.
Fascinating........must visit. this temple is just so well built........its surroundings are also very beautiful..........go in the morning and pray here, you'll feel very calm.

Amazing. This was the last temple we visited in Bangkok and we did think about not bothering. I'm glad we did as the temple and the Golden Buddha are amazing. The detail of the temple is very intricate but most of the time we spent just looking at the amazing Golden Buddha.

Dont miss this. Its amazing you have to see it go by taxi with a meter you don't need to book a tour take water there is a lot to see pretty easy to get around not to many steps wear shoes you can take off easy when you enter temples

Tucked away, nice to see. Impressive Buddha, 5.5 Tn of gold. You may multiply it by $25 per 18 Kt gram of gold, but actually, it is invaluable...! When I visited, the place was packed with monks, a very nice sight together.
It was a good day. We spent few hours visiting this temple. We got a guide for an hour to explain us about the history of this temple. Very informative.

Beautiful!. Beautiful temple. You can feel the reverence the Thai have for this temple so dress properly, take your shoes off and pay attention to the no photograph signs. I did witness some idiot with a selfie stick being escorted from the palace grounds.
Gorgeous!. Beautiful small temple with lots of interesting history behind it. Definitely worth a visit especially with a guide so you can be well informed about the temple itself.
Golden Buddha - Temple visi must. Wat a view from bottom of the temple and once you go upstairs and visit the temple its amazing......
Nice Temple. Very well decorated and maintained. Real peace of mind once you enter the temple and they maintain the same.
Amazing Experience . Putting aside that there is five and a half tons of gold, the Golden Buddha is a must for tourists. The temple its self is something to see. I would recommend it to anyone.
Worth a visit. Good spot to visit, not that busy but we let some birds free which apparently is good for ridding the soul of bad luck. I hope that is true.

Beautiful . This place was amazing with rich history to it. The 5.5 ton solid gold Buddha was covered in plaster for 200 years and was rediscovered by chance. We where blessed by a monk here and we set birds free for luck.

5 tone golden Buddha. We came here with a cab from Grand Palace. It was early morning but already with lot tourists around. Many stairs to climb and there it was. Imposant to see. It stays hidden form centuries covered with plaster, and forgotten. As we heard there it was accidentally discovered when piece of plaster felt off, and the 5 tones was the reason why it was not moved and is at the present location. As for almost all Wat, bring coins with you to place them in praying/wish pots, this time you need to aim from a distance.
Good to see if in BKK. It's a nice temple to see. Been to quite a few in Thailand and this is up there with the nice ones. The price is fair so no worries there.

Majestic. The building and majestic solid gold Buddha are a sight to see. Photography is allowed. But it seemed disrespectful to photograph the Buddha while worshipers prayed, more so here, than in other temples. Buy tickets across the street. Climb the stairs, remove your shoes and go inside. The small gift shop sells a variety of “good luck” charms, an inexpensive souvenir.

It's Just a temple. It is a small temple not big as it looks , More near central mall. This is where the blast happened .
The most noticing thing is the evening , where we can see local Dance which is really beautiful
Incredible. The larges golden Buddha in the world only discover in 1955 before was cover in plaster for centuries 5.5 tons of solid gold

Lots of stairs to climb but the Buddha is truly gold!. Worth a look. Only 40 Baht. There is a friendly travel agent about a 100 feet from the bus parking entrance run by a nice couple. They can be trusted and they have some economy tours. They are J.N.S. Golden Buddha Travel phone 02-6391011
Nice. The Temple of the Golden Buddha is a nice site to see. There is a sense of peace inside that makes the walking through the crazy noisy Chinese area worth it.

A must whilst in Bangkok. Solid gold Buddah - so impressive - a lovely sight - definately worth a visit - we went with Buffalo tours and did a private tour which I would recommend - avoid the crowds and enjoy!

Bangkok Highlight. Wat Triamit, or better know as Temple of the Golden Buddha is one of the 'must see' stops on a Bangkok tour.Located in the Chinatown district, the centerpiece of the temple is a sitting Buddha image made from 5.5 tons of gold. The Statue is housed in a newly built building, and draws large numbers of local and international tourists daily. Plan to give yourself around an hour to walk, take fotos and enjoy.
must visit. beautiful and holy place. a real golden Buddha. it's maxing to see that very big Buddha made by real gold . I will recommend a must visit place.
Absolutely Breathtaking . Awesome temple that all visitors should see, the Golden Buddha is beautiful, loved learning the history from my wonderful tour guide, I highly recommend this place to visit.

Welcome to bangkok. This was the first temple we saw during our city tour of bangkok, It was a great attraction point having great history. 5.5 Ton gold Buddha is iconic. I liked this temple and the art.

Had a chance to meditate at Golden Temple. I visited Bangkok early November and was suggested to visit Golden Temple. I'm a meditation practitioner so I always has interest to visit temples.As I entered the main Temple, there's a giant golden Buddha statue that's made from 5 tons of gold. But one thing that amazed me was I was allowed to honor and meditate.just like Thai people Buddhist do their prayer there. So I took 15 mins meditation and felt grateful to have this moment.

Wonderful building complex. Although most of Thai temples have elaborate structures, I liked the building which is different from other temple others I visited. This has some history the tour guide explained and it is difficult to related it here.

Suggestive place. I think that if you are in Bangkok you can't avoid this place.
This is a luxurious pkace with a golden Budda. More then in other temples in this place there is a strong sense of prayer and reflection.
And Budda... Is... Enormous! And its history is incredibile!

Amazing place of worship. Temple was easily accessible by transport, private or public. The nearest Hualampong MRT or Rail stations are within walking distance. Expected to rub shoulders with tourists and locals visiting the place. Do take some pictures for memories, in particular, the few banana trees with super super long fruit bunches, just outside the temple. Something really different and unique.

Amazing temple. It's one of the amazing Buddha temple,
It's made of gold and a must see for tourists and locals, once you enter the temple on the fourth level, it's totally a different experience once you see the size of the idol made from gold

Temple of the Golden Buddha. This seated gold Buddha is the world's largest measuring 5 metres and weighing in at 5.5 tons. It is interesting that originally the statue was covered in plaster to prevent it from being stolen. It was only in the 1950's that it was discovered to be made of gold. This is a must see.

Incredible . All I can say is this temple is beautiful.
I suggest you go see it.
Be careful though as there are a fair few stairs for you to climb up to actually see the Budda.
The temple also offers you the ability to donate to local charities and you must take off your shoes, so I suggest wearing thongs.
Wat traimit. One of the oldest Buddha idol made of 5500 kg of old. It gives you a grand feeling . You can buy small gift items from shops situated in near entrance .

largest golden buddha in the world. my curiosity was aroused after learning this is the largest golden buddha in the world. hired a tuk tuk but he took us to a wrong temple. and then after googling realised the name of the temple is wat traimit. you need to climb a 100 steps to see the golden buddha but it is definitely a place one needs to visit both for the architecture and golden buddha as well as for the views.

Impressive statute. Worth a trip to look at the impressive Buddha statue made of gold. Do note that for ladies, sleeveless shirt and shorts are not allowed. Butt hey do provide scarf rental to cover up if required.

Brilliant!. Be weary of people that will approach you to tell you the temple is closed, it is not true! just go to the side gate and it will be open. Amazing place to visit with plenty to see and photograph. You will be asked to take your shoes off to enter the temple. A free water bottle is given to you.
One more wat to see, interesting. Very ornate, interesting, must see with a guide to understand what you are looking at, the why it exists and from when
True Golden Buddha temple. Wat Traimit is the golden buddha temple which is made of some 5.5 tons of gold which was hidden for many years.. its amazing work of architecture.

Worth a visit. Certainly worth a visit. We visited as part of a private tour, and that was great, as we wouldn't have known the do's & don'ts of temple etiquette without our guide. Be careful to pay attention to the signs.
fantastic and peaceful environment. very beautiful temple. good murals on the staircase. golden pointed roof. the temple gives a small information book.

Impressive. Seeing the golden Buddha was my only redeeming feature to going to china town. It costs 40baht to just go see the Buddha, or 140baht to go see the exhibitions as well as the Buddha, we saw the exhibitions as well, and we think it was worth it. You have to take off your shoes and cover your shoulders, and ladies, when seeing the Buddha you may be told to cover your legs too (20baht to hire a wrap to cover your legs).Worth while trip if you're in the China town area (river stop 5).
Nice temple. Temple of the Golden Buddha is nice temple , great place to visit and if you follow the Buddha goes this place to get a lucky on future . highly recommended

Genuinely impressive. The solid golden Buddha is beautiful and impressively large.Equally impressive is the way in which it is housed.A must see if you come to China town in Bangkok.I came from Hua Lampong MRT station and walked.

Magnificent . 5+ tonne solid gold statue. Entrance THB 40. Just small shrine. Great architecture. Have another temple where you can actually pray and offer small package of food etc to temple. There will be one monk who offer blessing and tie white treads around wrist which is a common custom among Hindus and Buddhists around the world. You can donate at many donation boxes placed in varies part of the temple.

Watch out for the photographers hanging around . The Temple was ok to visit , always busy I believe. For my family and I it was just a place to tick we been to , but with the tour operators it was worth it as we visited other places at the same time.
Great. There's no one single temple in Thailand that is not beautiful, have a look here, inside is really lighting of colors, you can go on top and the view is fantastic.

Tempel des Goldenen Buddha (Wat Traimit). October 2015 . In Bangkok are hundreds of Temples , and this one is worth to see . Plenty of Tourist visiting this Temple . It is not far away from Chinatown , after this Temple , you can visit Chinatown .

A must visit.. An awesome temple with an unimaginably lovely statue of Lord Buddha in pure gold. The sanity of the temple needs to be experienced to express. A must visit for any tourist visiting Bangkok.

Golden Buddha centre of worship. The Golden Buddha is a wonder to behold. It is a centre of worship for the Thai people. Visitors are welcome, but remember you are in a religious site and behave appropriately..

Golden Buddha. if you are interested in Historic and temples then it is worth it otherwise it can be skipped. A golden statue of Buddha almost 5.5Tons in solid gold. if your time bound or more interested in shopping then you can skip it

Large Buddha statue made of 83% pure gold. It is free admission so long as you do not plan to go up the stairs into the temple. You are allowed to take photos in front of the temple from the ground level for free if you so choose. If you do decide to visit the inside of the temple, it will cost you 40 bahts. Dirt cheap. WOMEN-- please wear a shirt and capri/pants/long skirt if you plan to go up into the actual temple. You cannot show shoulders or exposed thigh/legs. Otherwise, they will ask you to rent a coverup for 30 bahts. Also, you're not allowed to wear shoes inside the temple, so keep that in mind as well.
True Thai experience. Temple of the Golden Buddha is a spetacular place to visit especially the main temple which is rather impressive Well worth a visit, I'm sure you won't be disappointed.

Great to see. Its massive! remember to wear pants and a guy and ladies need to dress appropriately to get in.shoes must be take off so where socks.hard to get a picture a its so big.again like most attractions in bangkok problem with pickpockets so take a rucksack like i did

Golden Buddha Temple-a must see in Bangkok. An absolutely beautiful temple but be prepared- Lots of stairs in and around this temple! There is an elevator and signs are clear it is for handicap and elderly only. No shoes allowed in the temple so you can leave them in the shoe rack or place in a shoe bag and carry with you (I recommend). The locals pay nothing to visit and and their is a small donation for visitors. No parking and crowded so plan your time to allow the visit to the museum and displays (also air conditioned).

Awesome and Fascinating - a real Thai experience. Temple of the Golden Buddha is a wonderful place to visit and the main temple inside is rather exceptional. Well worth a visit, you'll not be disappointed.
Amazing. We missed this temple on our previous visits to Bangkok and only stumbled across it on our way to Chinatown. It is well worth a visit the Golden Buddha is 5.5 tonnes of solid gold.
One time visit if you are around that area. The big buddha is made of solid gold. It is a good visit if you are around the area. The temple interiors are beautiful

Good but very busy . The history of this monument is almost unbeliveable and that alone made it the most interesting temple i visited. However it is extremely busy all day which may but some people off.
If you visit only one Wat in Bangkok though this is the one

Another temple to see but with a Buddha made of gold. Very interesting temple near Chinatown and the buddha is made entirely of gold. A must see if you are into temples. Lots of history to keep you interested.

A Strong Spiritual experience.... Temple location and external presentation was dismal relative to the many other temple sights. Exceptional experience to observe the reverence of the people to the Buddha. Fortunately water and beverage available at this site.
GOLD Buddha. This is a must visit place, the only Golden Buddha that weighs tons of Gold! I dont think you can find any place in the world that a Buddha will be made of this much gold!

Another beautiful temple. We took a Temple Tour and this was one of the temples in the itinerary.
Very beautiful and must visit for Buddha lovers.

A little bit seedy looking but still very interesting....... I just love temples and although this particular temple is a little seedy looking, it does have a interesting story to tell.It is located at the southern end of Chinatown just across from the Hua Lamphong train station. Chinatown is such a fascinating place to explore. A truly amazing experience of unexpected contradictions and eye-opening sights. Don't rush through this area.....there is so much to experience.

Visited with local guide discovered on Internet. We visited the temple with a local guide found on the internet who took us on a 5 hour tour of China town and India town for £6 each. Culminating in a visit to the golden Buddha. The ornate architecture and fresco paintings are richly ornate. Visitors should bear in mind this is still a place of worship as opposed to a tourist site.
Nice tourist attraction !!!. can't call it a must visit , if you are up and around , give it a visit !! quite touristy !! otherwise well maintained and clean !
Nice temple. A nice place to visit while in Bangkok. Across the street entertainment in the evening on the corner in Chinatown. Well worth seeing!

Golden Buddha. We were blown away with the Buddha in the ground level temple, but don't miss the climb floor by floor of all the historical scenes of Bangkok in the early years,until you reach the top of the big temple, The Golden Buddha and it's history are awesome and beautiful
Awesome, Mind-blowing. You got to see this to believe it. How do I even begin to describe this. Inside and out. Not one square centimeter not lovingly attended to.

Interesting. A lot of work went into this structure and it is interesting to consider this work being done without the modern machinery. Definitely skilled tradesmen! As most structures that are deemed temples in Thailand, they have variances, yet serve a common purpose to house an icon and provide a place for image worship. The location is kept clean and it draws many to see the Golden Buddah.

Good for a short visit. This temple holds the famous golden Buddha. It is made of gold and weighs 5.5 tons. Even if you're not a Buddhist it makes for a nice visit and you can take pictures of this famous Buddha image. Downstairs, is a museum about the Chinese Thais and a gift shop. If you're visiting Chinatown, it is very close by.

Very expensive, "foreigners" pay 500 baht. We went in the afternoon on a weekday, very expensive to get in (500 baht per person) thought it was quite offensive that they have a Thai queue and a "foreigner" one - the locals get in for a fraction of what the tourists pay. From the sheer amount of money Thailand makes from tourism you think they could maintain these places without charging us though the nose. It is beautiful but if your on a budget give it a miss

loved it... The Temple is small with lot of steps to climb, its crowded and the area where it is situated is not very scenic or beautiful. once u enter the temple building u see a huge statue of Lord Buddha (made up of gold) sitting right in front of you, beautiful experience very peaceful.
Great attraction!. Amazing golden Buddha temple -- another must see wat for first time visitor to Bangkok...it's part of the Bangkok tourist circuit and will be included on any tour of Bangkok.

Underwhelmed. My friend and I rushed to get to this temple before it closed for the day. We got there with about 30 minutes to spare. First we had to find the ticket booth, which took a few minutes because of poor signage. Then we quickly climbed to the top level to see the Buddha and main shrine. The building itself is gorgeous, as was the main attraction (the Buddha). There was a crush of tourists (from India, I think) inside who were all taking selfies and group photos with the Buddha. It was hard to get a good look without people blocking our view. We then took a quick stroll around the upper perimeter, which was blissfully people-free by comparison. The view was great. At that point, the temple was beginning to close. A rather grumpy looking attendant started rushing everyone out. I kind of brushed it off, but my friend was absolutely livid at his brisk behavior. Unfortunately, I think it rather ruined the experience for her.That was something that we noticed in Bangkok- the temples and palaces are amazing, but the staff sometimes came across as rude or indifferent. I wasn't sure if that was because of the language gap, cultural differences, or a product of the unrelenting heat.

Solid Gold Treasure. The temple shows off this magnificent Buddha of solid gold perfectly. The color and luster of the medal are compelling. The Buddha is spectacularly casted, highlighting exquisite features. A favorite of tourists and locals alike.
Lovely. Did this as part of the grand palace tour beautiful buildings well maintained in their natural glory.
so nice temple. This temple so beautyful, you need to see, it also funny to take the little ferry over to the temple

Biggest golden Buddha in the world!. Bangkok has so many things to see and do, but a visit to see this golden Buddha should be a must.As the biggest golden Buddha in the world it is quite awesome to see in its little palace.There are lots of steps to get up to it but if no issues with walking then it's well worth it.There are lots of smaller things to see in the grounds too, so give it a go.
Spiritual time. Temple is very good. Gives a soothing feeling in the presence of Buddha. Spuvenirs are unique. Guide not required

Quick visit as a part of a tour. Good to know and see and visit, but probably visiting once is enough for me.Since I need to write more.. Many souvenir vendors taking visitors' photos to be converted to pin or fridge magnet and the visitors were kinda forced to buy afterwards (did not happen to me as they only offered me once and did not come back when I refused, but happened to my European travel mates), and it was not so comfortable as who knows what they were going to do with the unsold ones..As in the title, the visit was part of a join tour that seemed to be handled by multiple companies - I booked through one travel agency, but the driver picking me up was wearing another agency's jacket, and then I got transferred to another van to meet the other people in the group. Nonetheless, our guide Arunee (hope I got the spelling correct) was very friendly and informative! Would be happy to find out which travel agency she was from.

Temple made with Marbles. A Beautiful temple, its walls done with white marbles. Very clean and neat place. Those who cannot climb the steps can use the lift. A golden Buddha statue in sitting position is there. You must dress properly if you want to go inside the since it is a religious place.

A quick visit is all that's needed. This is a nice, easy to view, temple. Found near the Bangkok centre hotel you can walk here easily. Area felt safe. The Buddha is impressive but you have to dodge others with their selfy sticks. The temple complex is compact so makes for a nice short evening activity. Reasonably priced.
Very Impressive. A must see, this huge gold Buddha is quite impressive. Do as part of a tour as there is not much else there.

Golden temple. This is a must see when you visit Bangkok nearly everyone goes at least once.you must have your legs and shoulders covered but they sell trousers just outside.it is very hot with very little shade take a water bottle as there are places inside where you can refil with drinking water . a wonder to behold it's. Beautiful.
gold and gold. as a part of BKK visit, we arrived and not much to stay this place. all will be attracted by gold and the King's photo has been set in the middle of entrance. nice place.

Amazing. You won't believe the sheer size of this buddha. Neither will you be able to get your head around the fact is worth around £125 million. Didn't get a chance to do the exhibition but it was worth it for just the buddha alone.
Temple of the Golden Buddha. Temple of the Golden Buddha is a must visit option, in city tour by the travellers its free so go ..........

Impressive Chinese Buddah temple. It is a Chinese Buddha temple in bangkok, situated of cours in the Chines quarter. The status is the most impressive you could ever see, being made from 5 tones of gold.
The temple itself is less sophisticated than a Tahi one, still it is worth visiting if only to compare the two Buddhist currents.
Beautiful. This temple is beautiful with gigantic golden Buddha, lovely quiet and peaceful. Loved all the beatiful pieces in the class cases.

Nice. Worth seeing but after that not much more to say. Required to write more. Will say that site has more than the one Buddha. However it is difficult to get around with any type of handicap due to multiple steps.
Golden Buddha Temple. The Golden Buddha Temple . It's a must have to look in Bangkok . Very nice Temple . And not far from the City .

More of the same. Nice but more of the same even it is gold one.
In a long tour you see a lot of budhas so it becimes a part ofc a total tour to Bangkok.
Beautiful!. This spot is an unquestionable requirement visit,for women the body ought to be completely covered,the material like dupatta is likewise accessible for rent in the sanctuary premisies.
Amazing beauty. I have never seen that much solid gold in my life. Well worth the trip to view such a beautiful temple and solid gold Buddha.

“Beautiful place Good Temple”. I visited during Pattaya and Bangkok Visit. It is good temple where you get to see very huge idol of Lord Buddha. Feel very sacred. The Buddha itself is inspiring -- I think we read that it is the most valuable religious icon in existence, according to the Guinness Book of World Records.The exhibits on the second and third floors were also worthwhile -- one floor was dedicated to the history behind the Golden Buddha, and the other floor was dedicated to the impact of the Chinese settling in Thailand. The floor related to Chinese settlement in particular has attractive displays.Be sure to wear appropriate attire. Peaceful, uncrowded spot on a Sunday afternoon. Closest public transport is the MRT station Hua Lamphong -- very reasonable walk from this station!

Nice Temple. Nice temple having number of bells at its backside. Ringing all of them, was great fun !!It is really hot in Bangkok, so better to plan your visit in evening, to enjoy as you need to walk barefoot, so during day time, it is very difficult

Nice Calm place . The place is very calm and one can come and relax here.
Although it's very hot here in November apart from this the golden Buddha appears beautiful.
One time visit place.

Impressive temple . The biggest solid gold Buddha in the world apparently. Attractive temple (as most are), nice to take in the scenery from the slightly elevated position. Paid 40 baht each to get in, with 20 baht for long skirt rental for the ladies.

Go in the morning, but do not miss. Our tour guide took us here before 8 am and this is the best time to see this wonderful site. Do not miss if possible, but try to go in the AM before it gets hot and crowded.Most of the temples in Bangkok are easily seen within 30-40 minutes so you can see several sites in a morning. However, if you wait until the afternoon it will be hot and very crowded.

Worth a visit. This is one of the temples I was looking forward to visiting since arriving in July, and I'm glad I finally did! The approach to the Golden Buddha itself was impressive, climbing the many steps to the top of the temple. The surrounding view is worth a look.The Buddha itself is inspiring -- I think we read that it is the most valuable religious icon in existence, according to the Guinness Book of World Records.The exhibits on the second and third floors were also worthwhile -- one floor was dedicated to the history behind the Golden Buddha, and the other floor was dedicated to the impact of the Chinese settling in Thailand. The floor related to Chinese settlement in particular has attractive displays.Be sure to wear appropriate attire. Peaceful, uncrowded spot on a Sunday afternoon. Closest public transport is the MRT station Hua Lamphong -- very reasonable walk from this station!
Very impressive. Amazing amount of gold. Flowing lines, compared to stiff European temples. A great photo op both inside and out.

Beautiful place. The statue is all solid gold. The sheer sight of the statue takes your breath away. They allow you to take pictures and you have people taking pictures all over the place. That in a way disturbs the calm and peace of the place. Its well worth a visit.
Nice Place must visit. the Temple of the Golden Buddha is a must visit when in Bangkok, the atmosphere is very lively and is best visited in groups along with a local guide.
Very peaceful place. This place is a must visit,for ladies the body should be fully covered,the cloth like dupatta is also available for rent in the temple premisies
Nice temple. Another must visit temple of Bangkok. The wntry ticket is 40 B for temple and 140 including exhibition which closes early.
Good Temple. I visited during Pattaya and Bangkok Visit. It is good temple where you get to see very huge idol of Lord Buddha. Feel very sacred.

Golden Buddha . Located right in the center of the city, Wat Traimit, is a beautiful temple! Like all buddhist temples, Wat Traimit is very peaceful and serene!Golden Buddha statue is unique and has lot of gold! We visited as a family with elderly people in the group. For those elderly people who would find it difficult to climb the stairs..there is a lift which will take you to the temple!
Bring Your Best Camera!. I absolutely loved visiting this Wat! This place is quite majestic, hence bring your best camera. I got to see some locals praying and paying their respects to Buddha.
Magic. As with all the Wats in Thailand this one was pristine and our guide explained all about this HUGE solid gold Buddha
Very Peaceful afternoon. My wife loves GOLD. It was a must see to see 5 TONS of Gold! We spent about thirty minutes and enjoyed the free time!

Cover shoulders and knees.. This was the first temple we visited in our stay in Bangkok. Very clean and tourist friendly. Very busy and not a large space to accommodate everyone. Entrance was around 40 baht each to just the temple. We went unprepared and ended up paying out for some elephant trousers and tourist t shirt for my girlfriend which luckily they sold on site. (Probably a bit more than usual) Worth the visit overall
Small place, Lord Buddha idol is nice. Go to this place only if you have free day, very small place. Not much crowded. Total time is about 15 mins.
Impressive . I have to say the 5.5 ton gold Buddha was pretty impressive. It was the first temple we went to in Thailand and I have to say it was a wow moment.

Golden. If you like to see over 5 ton of solid gold nows your chance. Interesting story goes with this how they covered in concrete to hide it in 1 of the 44 wars Thailand and Burma have had conflict in Must see.

A visit with a silver lining. A visit with a silver lining or a golden one I guess. Visiting this place will take you to Chinatown which has so much to offer besides this Wat. I was moderately impressed with this Temple. Yes the Golden Buddha is impressive but there is not too much more to this temple in my humble opinion. Well worth the visit if you are in the hood but the temple by no means a destination by itself
Real Gold Experience. Came here with a tourist guide. Really interesting to witness the Golden Buddha in solid gold. The only temple in Bangkok where I can feel the present of supernatural power.

The big Beautiful golden Buddha.. The best way to go Wat Traimit is the subway ( MRT). Get down at Hua Lmpong Station. Form the Hua Lumpong station to the temple about 8 minutes walk.The most beautiful golden Buddha is on the top floor. The down floor is museum shows the history of the big golden Buddha and living of the local people around there.China town is not far from there.That's area is the old town .Many thing is interested.Hope you enjoy.

Smaller but still nice. Located next to china town, is a smaller temple when compared to the others but still very nice. It was much empty then the main temples so very nice and easy to visit. You can take the boat and then a taxi as it is close to the pier. Avoid tuk tuks as they always wants to scam you.
Another Temple must see. Temples in bangkokg like this Golden buddha emple never failed to amaze me. It just love the details
Amazing Art. It is amazing temple. I have seen lots of ancient temples in India, the filling is same but the experience is different and amazing.

Timeless. One of the main a must stops on tourist map of Bangkok. The place is impressive and timeless. Overcrowded with the tourist. Interesting combination of Thai, Chinese, Burmese, Cambodian style architecture. As any Buddhist temple require shoes removal prior entering inside. Have some change to make donations (not mandatory) but for your own soul.

worth to see.. this is just one of the beautiful temples in bangkok. no entrance fee and best to see during the night. its just 15-30mins away from the busy road of khao san via tuktuk for 50-80baht i think.
Impressive. Colors, magic, history and a giant buddah of solid gold. Don't take pictures inside the temple or you can be scolding.
worth seeing but not worth going to see. another famous sight to tick off when you visit Bangkok, not one of the most famous or one of the most popular but worth seeing all the same

A must see if you want a true buddhist experience. This was one temple and statue we really wanted to see on our only full day in Bangkok and it didn't disappoint. To see the statue if truly a calming experience.
Beautiful But Not My Favorite. There are so many great temples in Thailand, I would wait to see this one. See other stuff first and then come back to the Golden Buddha.

lovely. you need a good tour agency to take you in a nice car with air conditioner to all this temples and enjoy the shiny golden temples around the city
please mark down this as a helpful opinion , since it is a free contribution to the website thanks
