Beautiful architecture, history and spirituality. Mind your clothes and your behavior in regard to their beliefs and enjoy the temple and the Golden Buddha.

Mix with a visit to Chinatown. Whilst the sight of the golden budda is fascinating and a sight to see, it is a bit of a 5 minute job unless you want to pray at the same time. The decorations around the room are also interesting and intricate, but unlike many of the other Wats there isn't really anything else here, so if you are going, visit Chinatown at the same time. There are so many different donation boxes you could spend a fortune putting money in each one. Knees and shoulders need to be covered for entry.
a wonderful Experience. This temple is a little quieter than others, and a little off the beaten track. It has an interesting back story that I think is also worth the visit.

Beautiful Architecture. Located close to China Town area. Easily accessible. It has beautiful architecture. It gives awesome view of the surroundings. Located very close to Bankok River. One of the very famous temples which should not be missed if you are in Bankok.

Lost in translation in Bangkok. For a temple with a 5.5 tons of solid gold statue of Buddha, the security was not that tight. The temple was just beside a busy street/major road in Bangkok. You can stay at the temple for as long as you want. Take photos as many as you want. Offer prayers if you are apt to it.
Beautiful. This is why you go to Thailand and Bangkok - a must see while there. Not expensive but what for tuk-tuk rip off artists - be aware.

Awesome temple with great view. We did not plan to go there, but more or less stumbled upon it. We walked around in china town late at night and suddenly my Dad spotted the top and we decided to have a look.And gosh, I was not disappointed!Usually you have to pay an entrance fee but it being late I had not to. I could not enter the inside on the lower floors, but still had access to the main temple. Up there you can see a beautiful Buddha and the view over Bangkok is stunning.
Ok. Again nice grounds , but other then seeing the temple there is not much to see , plan for 1 hour atmost.
Nice Temple. The Temple of golden buddha was so good ,Amazing Buddha statue made of gold. It was a great experience of visiting golden Buddha's temple.
5 tons of Gold. Gotta see a 5 ton golden Buddah. The site is really amazing. The Buddha is very shiny, and is beautifully crafted. Must not be missed

On the pricier side for the temple, but worth seeing. Very interesting temple with a beautiful golden Buddha inside.It is a little small for the price, but worth seeing. Would recommend seeing this first, then the Grand Palace in the same day as they're pretty close. Just a short Tuk Tuk ride between them, and you won't need much time here.

Such a great temple. I went to this place on my last week in thailand the tuk tuk driver told my family about it and we said why not so we went and we loved it they tell you all about the thai culture and their ways the statues are amazing and the view from the temple and wow breathtaking. Thank you :)
Golden Buddha. Wow! Golden Buddha! Can't belive that. What a wonderful statue and made of solid gold. biggest in the world

Nice place to visit. Though it was raining hard when we went to this place, it was a very nice place visit wherein you can see a solid gold Buddha and notice the intricate designs of the temple. Be aware that there is a dress code before you can enter in this place.

5.5 tons of gold in front of you... so impressive.. To me, this was the best Buddha temple in Bangkok. dress code is required, so crowded, but if you decide to visit one Buddha temple, this is the one. Enjoy.
Worth visiting!. This is 1 of the 2 temples we visited while in Bangkok. The tour was quick and we were impressed with what we saw. It's definitely worth visiting.

More than just the Buddha. This is amazing to see this solid gold Buddha and the temple it is in. If you come here with a tour guide, be sure they don't race you in and out, spend some time here. Most people miss the museum underneath the Buddha and that's a shame. They have good wax works and scenes of what it was like hundreds of years ago. It takes you through the history of Bangkok and more so, how the Chinese came to be there. If you like history and culture, do yourself a favor and take time out to visit this at the same time. With China town at your feet, you may as well make a day of it.

All Gold EVERYTHING!. Feast your eyes on all the gold and intricacies your eyes can hold.This and the reclining buddha (wat pho) were my favorite.A lot to see and you can have a conversation with the monks. They had an exhibit that you can take a guided tour of as well. 40 baht (about 1 dollar) to get in.
Golden Buddah. Quite an amazing temple and complex, definitely worth a visit, good view from the top, hawkers there selling nice little bits and pieces
One to see. An amazing temple, it really needs to be seen and experienced if your are stopping by in Bangkok, such detailed workmanship throughout the building.
Golden Buddha. We visited a few of the temples and enjoyed them all but this Buddha was one of my favourites. Take a guided tour and then at least you will know the story behind it all.

Golden Buddha. Been to the place as a quick stop on my way to Flower Market and Chinatown, It was an easy climb upstairs to the Golden Buddha, yet I didn't see the museum. A good thing is that they have 2 separate tickets for either the Golden Buddha, or the museum. Overall it's worth seeing.

With Buddhas Aplenty in Thailand, Not a Must See. We went a bit out if our way to visit this temple. It took longer to get their than to see it. Unless you are a Buddhist temple connoisseur, I'd skip it.

Once you've seen one....... the temples nice, the story of the golden buddha is nice, but after going to three temples, a supposedly jewellery museum - that spends more time trying to sell you jewellery than actually telling you how its made then taken to a tailor museum - who just went straight in for the sale!! it kind of tarnishes the day you've had before.....
AMAZING. Went to Temple of the Golden Buddha as part of a holiday on Orient Express from Bangkok to Chiang Mia. Very interesting and well worth a visit.

Impressive statue and architecture. The temple is certainly impressive - the main thing holding the review down is the location, with nice buildings on one side and heavily trafficked street (with sewer odour) on the other.This being Bangkok however, this is usual. In order to get the full experience you should have a guide with you, there's little that puts the statue into a context.
So beautiful. So beautiful. Do not forget to check out the roof. The views are good as well. But remember to come early
Great temple in the city centre. To climb the steps and enter in the temple to see another amazing Buddha was breath taking - the Buddha's that are in Bangkok are all larger than life

Well worth a visit!. Visited this temple while visiting Chinatown in Bangkok. This temple is well worth going too. You can buy tickets to see the Golden Buddha on the fourth floor only (40 baht) or tickets to go to the exhibition they have on the second and third floors as well as the Golden Buddha (140 baht). We bought combined ticket and it was worth it. The exhibition shows the history of Chinese in Thailand and the transport of the Golden Buddha from Northern Thailand to its current location. Definitely worth a visit if in the area.

Kbow the history. this is magnificent especially if you know the history and the fact that it is 5.5 ton of gold... in another temple there was a monk who would bless the people and even though we didn't know what to do and we are not Buddhist and we didn't give the money, he was still very friendly and blessed us and took a picture with us... we had so many good experiences with the monks... truly peaceful people and really good with tourists...

Channel your peace and tranquility. While I was there, the temple was quite busy, but it was nice to see the Golden Buddha and get a blessing from a Buddhist monk. In my previous trip to BKK, I hadn't visited the temple, but it was a nice way to spend an hour or so. If you go through a travel agency, they may want to have you check out a tailor or jewelry shop after visiting the temple.

Time spent better elsewhere. If you are really into Buddha temples, then it may be worth your time, but there wasn't really anything special about it except that it a temple that is rather tall. This was our last temple of the day and it was off the beaten path. So, it didn't have much of an impression on us. If you go here, be sure to check out China town which was a cool street worth a walk through. Temple of the Golden Buddha was right at the end of the street.

Another temple with a Buddha?!. Had never heard of this temple prior to coming to Thailand, it was only that we ended up here after booking a tour to Wat Pho at BKK airport and this was also included in the trip! Very impressive Buddha, made of pure gold, which looks impressive but makes it hard to get good photos as the lights inside make it very shiny! Just a word of warning theres a man at the bottom who takes pictures of people as they're having their pictures taken by someone else and then when you leave, he finds you and presents you with a fridge magnet with your face on! Only 400 baht, but it made me creeped out thinking that someone had done that without my knowledge or consent

buddha image that holds the world record. made entirely of solid gold at the weight of 5.5 tons, this centuries old buddha image of wat traimit, bangkok, is no doubt the largest and heaviest buddha image in the world. the museum on the second floor of the same building worths a visit. it tells you a history of chinese migration to thailand. the public toilet here is surprisingly clean. note:

Can visit once. If you have visited the other temples of Bangkok esp Wat Pho,Emerald Buddha and Wat Arun etc with no planned visit to China town area I would not recommend all the effort and time to see this temple.

Good bit of mandatory sight seeing. We only had a short time in Bangers so we just did a few touristy things, this was excellent - good value, decent quality of information and things to see and experience. Worth a visit!

A giant Buddha made of solid gold!. The size of the Golden Buddha is really overwhelming, especially when you remember that is all made of solid gold!! Also, there are some beautiful statues outside this temple!

Next to China town, crowded with Chinese and Vietnamese tourist. Real gold made Buddha which back to hundreds year ago during war of Thai and neighbor country. Take umbrella with you and buy ticket if you are foreigner.

Largest Golden Buddha in the world. We visited on a glorious sunny day. The sight of all the gold is literally blinding! The Golden Buddha inside is huge, and crazy to think it's solid gold. Worth the visit.

Special place for all religions. I have visited this temple 2 times. I have diferent emotions, for every visit, First time 25 years ago, I was suprised with beauty, but this year in May, I felt how peacfill, and special place is it.

love it. must see in bangkok , you have to see it is it wonderfull.
Do not listen to people telling you that a temple is closed

Modern touch. This temple has a modern touch compared to the others I have visited. Nontheless, it will still appeal to any visitor. Location-wise, it can be accessed thru Hua Lamphong station in the MRT line. After which, walk to China Town and feed your hungry tummy. Take at most 30mins in this temple. Also worth mentioning is the clean toilet right beside the temples near the exit towards China town which you can use free of charge.

Temple of Golden Buddha- Must see. Wat traimit is a really beautiful temple and a must visit attraction in bangkok. The temple has a giant buddha made of gold. There are numerous steps to access the main shrine. But an elevator is available for the elderly and the handicapped.
Another Bangkok beauty. All I can say is this statue has a fascinating story and to see that much poor gold is awesome. Take your camera. Another Bangkok beauty.
Brilliant Gold. Very impressive and a little more to look at than the reclining job .Buildings and conditions really good .Happily no beggars or unfortunates lurking around the entrance
When in Chinatown. A must visit if you are around the Chinatown area, with easy access via taxi and also river cruise. Place is well maintained. The Golden Buddha is just beautiful! :)

beautiful temple. This is one of the must see temples in Bangkok. Easy to get to and an experience to enjoy. The taxi can easily find this place and nearby are a few other things to enjoy. It will take an hour or so to explore this temple

My visit to the Golden Buddha in Bangkok.. Make sure when you go to Bangkok, you visit the Golden Buddha. This Buddha is just amazing. It is made out of 6000 kilos of 24k gold. It stands around 25 feet high and about 15 feet wide. The estimated worth of the Golden Buddha is over 10 billion dollars. But don't even think about touching that Buddha. The Thai's are extremely serious about disrespecting Buddha. They will put you in jail for just touching this Buddha. But If you enjoy seeing one of a kind things that are no where else in this world, make sure you stop by and see the Golden Buddha. Seeing the Golden Buddha is worth the price of a plane ticket to Thailand. People just don't understand that there is much more to Thailand than just the bar girls. If that is what you are only looking for, then you are missing out on culture that you will never see again anywhere in the world. Also go see the Reclining Buddha. That Buddha has to be at least 100 feet long and about 10 feet wide. Its truly amazing the things you see in Thailand.
Amazing. Got very wet from a tropical down pour, but the temple was beautiful and worthwhile doing, The area is beautiful and the temple is truly amazing

The Golden Buddha. Being in the heart of Bangkok and part of the Royal Palace it is very acessible. If you like temples this is the place to visit. There ar num,eropus temples located in the grounds but they are all very well maintained and attractive. It is a very popular tourist attraction but don't be phased by the military presence, aftwer all we have soldiers outside Buckinmgham palace and windsor castle don't we. All in all a worthwhlie visit
Nice place.... Marble temple inside golden Buddha. Nice to visit. But individual traveler difficult to get a taxi after visit, unless you have a private car. Overall a very nice place top see.
another temple!. Another beautiful temple,containing a large solid gold Buddha. I am sorry but after a while you do rather get "templed. Out". Great but not really different.

Don't make a special journey. This temple was behind my hotel so I didn't need to go out of my way to visit. If you are in the area I would pop by but I wouldn't go out of my way? The sitting Buddha is beautiful!

Nothing Great...except too much Gold.. Apart from Solid Gold statue which weighs in tonnes & calmness within temple, nothing so great about this. Please ensure your attire is proper. For ladies, you need to cover your bare shoulders or you can get one on rent 20 THB outside temple.

Another Buddha temple in Bangkok.. Very impressive all gold Buddha. Nothing else inside the Temple besides the Buddha. Women have to wear long pants or long skirts and sleeved shirts shoes must be removed before entering.
Beautiful Golden Buddha. Very beautiful temple with largest solid gold Buddha in the world. We were also lucky enough to have a blessing by the monk sitting outside
Golden Buddha. A visit to Golden Buddha temple is must during visit to Bangkok, Statue is made of 5 ton solid gold. Temple has a peaceful atmosphere.

Stunning. Stunning...stunning...stunning. What used to be housed in a small single storey cramped little chapel has now. Een lifted to dizzying heights....literally. Wat Traimit - Temple of the Golden Buddha. Located at the end of Chinatown's Yaowarat Road, near Hualampong Railway Station, Wat Traimit houses the world's largest massive gold seated Buddha measuring nearly five metres in height and weighing five and a half tons. In the past, artisans crafted the Buddhas in gold and disguised them from invading armies by a covering of stucco and plaster.

Searching for Gold. The driver who shipped us from the airport to our hotel was such a knowledgeable and interesting man, and he made the Golden Buddha at Wat Traimit sound like it was a must-see. Well, I simply don't think it was ... when we eventually saw it. We decided - rather boldly - to walk there from Jim Thompson House, given it is only 2.5km. It was a cloudy, cool day. The walk took us through one of the more appalling neighbourhoods of Bangkok. You can always tell the true soul of a city when you see it this way, and Bangkok revealed itself to be a steaming, fuming, dump of rubbish, tin and scraps.As we drew near to the area of this temple, we noticed some very poor signage pointing us in the wrong direction for the temple itself. We asked a few people and were continuously told it was "behind that building". It eventually was, but you would never know it if you were on foot and even to drive there it's fairly well hidden.There was thankfully no crowd on arrival, but in true Bangkok style - something we have experienced everywhere - there was scant direction for tickets, few people on hand to help, and a general malaise and lack of enthusiasm that the whole experience is rendered rather mundane and laborious. It became one of things we "had" to do not "wanted" to do. The people of Bangkok should be proud of such a display and be singing it from the rooftops, much like other famous places of worship around the world. The Buddha is not as large as I thought it would be, and is - I'm sorry to say - just another shiny gold Buddha. I fully appreciate its history and value, but it took more time for my girlfriend to don a wrap around her knees and for us to remove our shoes than it did to actually see the Buddha from all sides. As we left, we negotiated unsuccessfully with three tuk tuk drivers to take us to the hotel. They were rude, arrogant and insisted on going via a "sponsor" for a cheaper fair. I had been warned about this. You'd think in a so-called tourist city they'd have a better approach. Sad, really. We took the next pink taxi that came along and asked politely for the meter, as you do, and paid THB60, forty less than the cheapest of the tuk tuk crooks.

Wat Traimit – The Temple of the Golden Buddha. This temple houses one of the Largest Buddha statues in gold in the world. About 5 meters high and nearly 5.5 tons.. Nice story about this Buddha . It had beens hidden by monks under a thick layer of plaster to protect this treasure from potential invaders in case of conflict. .The Buddha at Wat Traimit was discovered by accident when accidentally dropped as it was being moved, revealing, under a casing of plaster, a beautiful solid gold Sukhothai style Buddha. . Pieces of the plaster are still Kept on display. The Golden Buddha was taken to the Chotanaram Wat in Bangkok. In the 1930's the picture finally ended up in the Wat Traimit, still covered in plaster. Was erected in 1955 to house viharn the image. When the Golden Buddha was moved to the new building using a crane, a cable broke and the picture fell to the ground and into the mud. The workmen are said to-have run off fearing bad luck.The next day, when a monk returned to the temple he found the picture still in the mud, with plaster coating Reviews some of the broken revealing the gold, thus revealing the true identity and value of the picture.Outside of the Golden Buddha, this temple in Chinatown is very interesting for its religious fervor, the Chinese neighborhood from praying Buddha favors for their business......Came here after walking out of National Stadium (40mn) ...Fantastic statue ..A must

Some logistics hints for this magnificent place. A massive-golden Buddha, worth US$ 250,000,000.00 just in sheer gold, that survived the times by being plaster-covered would already be worth seeing. But this is an extremely beautiful image of the Buddha - and also a spiritually rewarding one. It is housed in a modern, quite beautiful temple. Here are some logistics hints for your visit, based on what I noticed to be problems in the most recent reviews (if you scroll down't you'll find the same hints many times over I'm sure :-)):1. Take the boat, not the BTS or MRT, as there are no stops close by. Take an orange-flag riverboat and get off at stop #5, Ratchawongse. This costs you 14 or 15 Baht from wherever, i.e. 40 cents. 2. From the pier, walk up the street until you hit the main road (4-lane traffic); then turn right and follow the latter until you see the temple, unmistakable with its golden spire, on left. Most of this street is covered, i.e. you don't need a parasol (but why don't you have one as a Bangkok tourist? :-)) There are several nice shops and street vendors on the way, most with a Chinese theme; also the top TCM pharmacies are here (such as the famous Tongrentan's branch). As you cannot walk very fast on these sidewalks, to get from the pier to the temple may take you about 20 minutes.3. Alternatively, get a tuk-tuk at the pier; the highest tourist rip-off price is 30 Baht, i.e. less than a dollar (if the driver approaches you, 20 or less can easily be done), and three can sit in most tuk-tuks comfily.4. At the Wat, go through the gate, get a ticket for 40 Baht (unless you're Thai) at the ticket booth (or 140 incl. the exhibition if you're interested - I liked them, but I had a lot of time), and then head to the pagoda, and up you go.5. As has been mentioned here, this is quite a climb - if this seems unappealing to you for health or age reasons or whatever, especially if it's hot and sunny, ask the guards for directions to the elevator - there is a nice one and you can save yourself all the hassle. (Same for the way down.)6. HAVE SOCKS - as in all Buddhist temples, you need to take your shoes off on all three levels if you want to enter. During the day, the white marble becomes really hot, and the rubber mats which are meant to insulate a bit seem even hotter to me. :-) The distance between the shoe-leaving area and the inside is too great to be comfy. Thus, socks are de rigueur for this visit.7. The Golden Buddha is, as I said, amazing, impressive, and spiritually powerful - but the shrine itself has become a tourist place, so that some devotion has become very difficult, because of the not-really-reverent masses with selfie sticks and so on. If you are a good Buddhist already, you will not mind, but if you are still imperfect and impatient (as I am), I would advise not even to try here but to go downstairs and head for the hall just to your straight left (say 10 o'clock) once you are all the way down. This sanctuary houses another version of the Golden Buddha (not from gold, but never mind), and this is much more quiet, subdued, and there will be also an officiating monk who will bless you and give you a wristband (small donation expected); if you revere and respect the Buddha, you can do that even if you are not a "card-carrying" Buddhist. Just watch the others a bit if you're new to this and then go. On the way back, if you walk a bit rather than taking a tuk-tuk all the way back to Ratchawongse Pier, there are some nice Chinese-style street food carts especially in the side streets directly from the main street, as well as some nice massage places; half an hour of foot massage hereabouts is 100-120 Baht and it is nice to get one after the visit. If you did the Buddhist devotion and want to eat something, stay vegetarian.Enjoy the Wat Traimit, it is a great place!

Golden budha, then dinner (Sunset views). Massive place, you can spend hours, so we ran out of time and went for an early dinner on the river. It overlooked the main temples on the other side. What a beautiful sunset with the temp,ex in the background. Great place for pics.
Jaw-Dropping!. 5,500 kg of pure gold and 4m high! This splendid 13th century artefact is unmissable! I didn't know so much gold existed!

Golden Buddha still sparkles. Another of the stunning temples worth visiting in Bangkok, even if heavily touristed. There will be crowds worshiping, which I've always found wonderful - a testament to an active faith. It is impossible not to take a good photo. Enjoy.

A very different temple, Not to be missed in Bangkok. This place has the real large buddha set on a third floor temple. There are many different shaped buddhas in the courtyard also which made the place and setting quite iconic. The place proudly exclaims that this is the largest golden buddha image in the world. It is huge. The temple where it sits has other statues also, even the window coverings are carved and brilliant.This place can be seen in under an hour, another place not to be missed as you tour through Bangkok.
Peaceful. Small temple But peaceful & pleasant. The place is well maintained & tourists can get a glimpse of Buddhist life
a must visit. wow wow wow.if in Bangkok you must visit here for the culture experience but be warned you must not wear shorts or skimpy tops.

Visit Wat Traimit. Indeed the largest solid Gold Buddha image in the world. Now in a new temple. I visited Wat Traimit in the early 1990s and again now in the newly build temple. Nice even a small museum around the temple. worth the trip there. Nearby attractions such as china town and the Main Train Station should be included in the tour.

Good experience. Had a nice afternoon stop here. Low price and semi crowded. The Buddha is beautiful. Be sure to remember to take off your shoes when stepping inside. Souvenir shop is overpriced as expected.

Have a visit. Happened to have found this temple by accident. Loved the architecture of the temple. It's location can be quite far but if you happened to be in China Town, it can be reachable by foot.

Golden Buddha. This was the first stop on our half day tour. The golden Buddha is in a beautiful temple and is truly a sight to behold. I can only recommend going to see this, but suggest wearing slip on shoes as you need to remove them before entering.

Great visit. Nice temple. Check out their golden buddha. Go early to avoid the crowd and the heat. It's not a big temple, so plan about 30-60 minutes. it's ideal to visit this temple while you do a city tour or so.

It is big and gold!. We went as part of a tour to see other things because if making your own way here you wouldn't need to set aside long. It is big and impressive but only need 15 mins.Need to take your shoes off before entering and make sure you are covered up.
Come...sit...relax.. Great place to sit and relax at the top of this temple under the gold statue. Right in the middle of BKK and chinatown...

Stunning. Quite incredible to think this Budda is solid gold, really amazing history behind his discovery.
Book a tour guide so you learn all the facts. Make sure you have your shoulders and knees covered up.

A big golden Buddha to see. Very nice temple situated in a quiet area. If you pray you can buy these golden leafs sold at the entrance to offer to Buddha and just stick them on the many smaller statues.
Huge Buddha. Huge buddha. Near to the MRT station. Very grand, worth stopping for a while before going to either chinatown or the train station

golden buddha. must see this place in side the city alittle bit crowded, but it is worthed to see wonderful place ,handpianted walls and windows with golden buddha excellent , If you want to buy emerald buddha or buddha statue becareful as per the new laws you cannot take certain type of buddha out from Thailand and they are selling only in the temples

A cheap, convenient to get to the city. This is a A cheap, convenient to get to the city. I love this train. I would recommend flying domestically out of sub airport (sp) because of this train. It is time consuming and expensive to get to Don Mueng airport.
Nice to see, not so very special. It is just nice to see, not so very special but if you are at the central railway station it is only max 500 meter walk.

Interesting half hour. Didn't realise until talking with our tour guide that the Buddha is actually solid gold rather than gold leaf! It's an impressive building from the outside and on the day we visited there was a person selling wishes! You purchased some yellow pressed candle wax which you dropped into a pot of liquid wax then took a ladle and poured a ladle full into a candle mould which must have stood around 5 feet tall, so much so there was a step to use as most of the population are short. The temple itself is quite a sight, and its something to be stood next to a few hundred thousand pounds worth of gold! We were fortunate enough that on the day we visited school children were there bringing offerings to the Buddist Monks, so there was a parade, dancing and people in costume, really added to the day.

Must do - made of pure 5,5 tons of gold three meters high. Not that easy to find unless you use a taxi. I used the Chao Phraya ferry to Si Phraya Pier no 3. From the pier I asked for directions and walked through China Town to the Wat Tramit, about 30 min. Well worth a visit. It is awesome. I used a tuk-tuk to get back to the ferry. The driver took me on a scary detour but I was not happy and he understood that I did not like his detour.
Close.... We arrive during a cerimony so the temple was closed. The place is near chinatown so I can only advice to remember to visit also that district.
Beautiful. The grounds are serene and beautiful but unfortunately the main building was closed when I was there, so check the times.

Fantastic . Good value for money- only 40 baht to see the Buddha.
I paid 20 baht for a Sarong to cover my legs too. So if you do forget you can still go!
The Buddha was fantastic and really worth going. It was amazing to see.
I'd highly recommend.
Also Nice To Visit. Also worth the visit. The Temple is beautiful from outside. The grounds is much smaller so you don't need a lot of time to see it. It's 5.5 Kgs of solid gold.
Impressive Buddha. Just a small temple and located a bit out of the way, but it was very impressive to view. Able to take photos which provides you with some pretty dazzling images.

No 1 must see. The grand palace is already for many years a top attraction in Bangkok. It is a must see thing when you visit Bangkok, The only thing that's a bit negative is the price and to many tourists , 500 Baht entrance fee is quite expensive for an attraction in Thailand . I been there 15 years ago and that time it was 100 Baht entrance fee.
A must to see.. Fantastic temple to see. Had an amaizing tour here organised by Viator. The most amazing Buddah to see.

Beautiful. Very pretty! If you need to borrow a scarf to cover up they charge you 120 baht, but refund you 100baht when you return it. This golden buddha is very beautiful and you'll likely see monks walking around the premises.
Impressive gold budda. This was the first stop on a tour of temples, very impressive solid gold budda and was able to see and get pretty close up, could take pictures

Impressive and worth experiencing. The day I visited this temple it was overcast sky and drizzling. The temple is located in china town. I will not repeat the story related to the temple as its quite common.The temple is quite impressive with the sheer size of gold statute. Not only that even the interiors of temple are marvelous. In comparison to other famous temples of Bangkok premises of this temple are quite small. The temple sits high on pedestal.There is another small temple right in front of this one where, monk passes on blessings. It also has smaller golden statute.The premises are quite neat and clean. Since this is not simply a tourist site rather temple is actively visited by locals, do keep in mind the restrictions and compliance applicable to religious temples, like appropriate clothing and removal of footwear. There is a 100 Baht ticket charged for visiting this temple, it looks like this one is applicable to the tourist and not the locals who come here for worship.

Amazing !!. Temple of the Golden Buddha houses one of the most prized relics in Bangkok, one of the largest sitting solid gold Buddha in the world. Located at the end of Chinatown's Yaowarat Road, near Hualampong Railway Station and admission price for the Golden Buddha: 40 Baht. Please, be careful to wear proper :)Really amazing !

Very interesting place. This is a very beautiful place, lots of history here. The golden Buddha was very interesting, but the exhibit which went with it was excellent. Described how the Buddha was made, moved on rolling timber.

Impressive. We had an excellent guide who introduced us to the Buddhist religion and told us the tumultuous story of this beautiful statue.She explained us in details how the offerings to Buddha are made .The statue is the biggest Buddha statue in the world: 5,5 tons.It was made in the 13-14th century and plastered in the 16th century to avoid to be stolen by Burmese invaders.By chance in 1955 the plaster broke uncovering this impressive statue: it is made of 9 pieces and the key to assemble and dissemble it was discovered at its base.From the temple Wat Traimit begins Chinatown in Bangkok and we explored it on foot.Very interesting experience.

Hotel recommended tour.. Part of an overall tour including the palace and the Golden Buddha. Very colourful and intricate tiling and mosaics and very impressed by the reverence shown by the locals. To think the this 5.5 tonnes of solid gold was hidden from invaders by encasing it in concrete.
In Love!. Thank You Thailand For Giving Such An Amazing Memories With Great Genuineness And Friendly Nature..Hope To See You Very Soon!
The story more interesting than the actual Buddha. After a while the Wats blend into one - nothing really memorable about this. Possibly tour operators should include a little variety in their tours.
a place for praying. I love this place because I respect every religion in the world . that was gorgeous and in one word it was AWESOME .

Solid Gold Buddha. This is the world's largest solid gold Buddha image weighing at five and a half tons and standing 15 foot tall. The museum on-site tells the story of the golden Buddha. A visit here can be combined with a tour of Chinatown. As with other temples, ensure proper attire.
A must visit. We liked the temple with its monk style interior! The Buddha idol is just breath taking! Put it on ur definitely visit list
Must see in Bangkok :-). The most impressive and magnificent giant Buddha what I have seen. It is located close to the Chinatown, again a good reason to see the golden statue :-)
Very well maintained and a heritage place. Largest Golden Buddha in world, it weighs 5.5 Tons and still a valuable treasure of Thailand and for followers of Buddhism, one must visit
Impressive and quiet. Quiet temple comparative to the biggest and most touristy ones, so worth seeing in this sense alone. Also undoubtedly impressive giant Buddha.

Wat Traimit & Chinatown. By this stage of my visit to Bangkok I had visited rather a lot of Temples and seen some amazing Buddha images (Wat Pho for example) ... this was pretty spectacular and, tied in with a visit to Chinatown, made it a fab day out with some amazing food in Chinatown ...

Nice and awesome but a bit sexist.... Wow great story around this statue and nice place. Little bit sexist attitude from the workers toward my partner for wearing shorts in the temple... as I was also wearing shorts but they just asked her to leave. Bloody morons actually if you think about it as what you wear does not show respect towards the buddha nature but your inner reality and heart alignment... but thats religion for you...Really nice place though and quite close to china town as well which we loved.
200 million USD Buddha. Want to see a gold Buddha worth about 200 million usd, then go....about the complex nothing much else to see.

World's only Golden Buddha. Wat Traimit has undergone massive renovations and the Golden Buddha is now at the top level. Certainly befitting its status as the Buddha and also allowing visitors a view of Chinatown. It now includes a museum which tells the story of how the Golden Buddha was commissioned and how it was discovered. At the street level, is a restaurant which serves vegetarian meals. Please remember no sleeveless, shorts allowed - you may pay THB20 to borrow a scarf. As in all religious sites, please be respectful of the temple and the worshippers.

Absolutely Amazing!!!. At 12,000 pounds of solid 18K gold, the Golden Buddha is brilliant. The Temple itself is outstanding in the Thai tradition. Explore the grounds, take it all in, as it is breath taking. At 40 THB, it is very inexpensive.

The Golden Buddha. The place was surrounded with many street vendors which was a little disturbing.The facility include was great and the status of the golden Buddha was magnificent. There are several other places aroudn the grounds and every one of those had a unique feature. We even lost our way within the premises. Really do recommend to visit this place irrespective of the religion you belongs to. But the as it is common in the whole Bangkok, tuk tuk drivers are a pain in here as well.

Excellent experience in convenient location. The Temple of the Golden Buddha is a small but interesting temple in the middle of Bangkok. It is not the best temple to visit, but beautiful and its location next to Chinatown makes a great combination tour.Dress appropriately, no shorts/short shirts. Also don't forget to visit the Chinese museum located just below the temple.

Beautiful!. Having never been to Thailand before, I loved seeing all of the Buddhist temples. This one was just as beautiful as others! Always be aware that you have to have your shoulders covered, and wear something longer than your knees.
Fabulous place with so much to see.. Very busy with tourists, but queues moved quickly. We had a private guide and I am not sure this was better than a good written quide.

The OK place to Visit. This is the famous temple to visit, no doubt about it. But they renovate the whole area so the old charm has gone.
There are many temples in Bangkok that worth visit more than this one. For example, Wat Pho, Temple of the Dawn, Temple of the Emerald buddha, Wat ..... and the list goes on ....

great temple. This is one of the top temples to see in Bangkok. It is beautiful and very well maintained. It is a popular tourist attraction and can get crowded. Men are not allowed to wear shorts and if you are wearing them, you can either buy or rent pants outside of the temple. Women cannot show any part of their exposed shoulders.

Another great temple in Bangkok!. It was hot, humid, and the end of a long day for my wife and me. But when we got inside this temple did not disappoint. I judge my experience here that even though I was tired and felt gross, those feelings disappeared as we enjoyed what was inside. There are also some cool streets to explore right by the temple as well.

A popular tourist attraction . I first visited this place thirty three years ago and then visited it again.This is a popular tourist destination in Bangkok and the statue of the golden Buddha is the main attraction for the tourists and the Buddhists.Dr.Javed Rasheed
Pretty astounding. Worth seeing as in all the major temples very reverent and monumental. Be aware that women have to cover their shoulders and no shorts.
good but still other temple are better. nice temple but i dont understand why they have kept Entry fee as i think there is no point paying as its a normal temple. but yes the statue is big.

A golden Buddha. It was a lovely temple of golden Buddha with many monks and devotees praying their and the best thing I found a vendor selling yummy coconut ice cream she gave us 5 mini scoops for just 30 bahts must try if you get a chance to have the ice cream any where in Bangkok

Magnificent Buddha. Another very powerful and magnificent temple. Very peaceful and tranquil inside. Please note that there is a lift instead of the stairs if you have kids or are unable to climb the stairs.

Wow! That much gold is impressive. Just a few minutes' walk from the Hua Lamphong MRT station, this is well worth a visit. I skipped the exhibition because I was short on time. The golden Buddha is impressive, and this is a real center of prayer, with many monks and faithful praying all around. Before you go, look up the back story on how this golden Buddha was "discovered" in the 1950s by accident. Makes the trip even more amazing.
An excellent Temple to visit.. We visit the Temple with golden Buddha also a holy place for Buddhist .is in the china town .Temple and the statue are so nice for somebody to vit them
Nice. Nice and beautiful temple.. lot of small things to shop around temple.. Must visit for first timers..
Impressive Buddha. I've seen the golden buddha before, but went there with my friends. The buddha itself is impressive, and the small exhibition that showed how they made it was really cool.

A Good Insight into The Buddist Relidgeon. The site is composed of many buildings and it is clean and one unique feature is free spring water with paid entrance The feet of the Budda is now under repair so a total view is not available at this time. The feet are inlaid with many jewels and ceramic tiles. We also saw skilled craftsman restoring some of the Budda's in some worship sites as the touching and oils from hands had damaged the base areas. The area is well lighted and easy for anyone to take pictures

Beautiful MasterPiece Temple!!!!Love it!!!!!!!!. 300 Tonnes of Gold - This is what the Buddha Idol is made of. Beautiful place to visit in Bangkok. People - Please make sure you dress decently as they dont allow people inside with Tank Tops/Sleeveless Dress and This might put you in embarrassment while entering the temple.

Very impressive and great story behind it. The Buddha had been hidden many years ago by covering it with cement. Everyone had forgotten it had been done. Lucky for the Buddha or someone would probably melted it down during WWII when Thailand was over ran. When they thought they were bring an ancient concrete Buddha to Bangkok it fell and enough cement chipped off to see the gold. It is on the 4th floor, but my guide knew where the elevator was located for us. If you need help this can make what seems hard or maybe impossible easy.

magnificient.......... there is not enough words to describe the visit to the temple. The statue of the Golden Buddha in a resting position runs from one of the temple to the other. There is nothing second to this statue except the statue of Lord Vishnu in the Padmanabha Swamy Temple in Trivandrum, India . Rumor has it , that it is made of Solid Gold.

Golden Buddha weighing tons of solid gold. This unique solid gold Buddha and its beautiful Temple are not to be missed while in Bangkok. Worth millions this Buddha practically safe because it weighs tons and is virtually impossible to carry.
Very interesting. Interesting to see a Buddha made of 5 tons of gold! Also, the temple is extremely detailed. Fascinating!

Pleasant. This temple is very famous as Golden Buddha Temple surrounded by Residential and School and we can see lot of visitors from the different parts of the world and coming up to this temple it's an interesting story it was discovered by an accident when it was accidentally dropped as it was being moved,revealing,under a casing of plaster,a beautiful solid gold Sukhothai Buddha.Pieces of the plaster are still kept on display.Entry fee for this is 30 THB Per person

Amazing, Must See!. This place will blow you away. It's located not too far from the centre so it's not hard to get to although I would suggest taking a metered taxi. And its not far from China town so you can kill two stones in one day.
Nice temple. This place is nice to visit, but bear in mind that it can be really crowded. Also try to wear socks as the tiles to walk on are pretty hot.

Visit to Golden Buddha Temple. This was the first Buddha Temple we visited among the three Buddha Temples included in the half day temple visit package. The Grandeur of the Temple precincts was simply amazing and one cannot but stand awestruck in front of the Golden Buddha. I prayed & prayed a lot.

An amazing place of Buddhist culture. A great and impressive place to visit and to gain better understanding of the values and history of Buddhist religion and culture. The architecture is astonishing if you look in to the details and how they were created. Very often the place is a bit too crowded and I recommend to visit it early in the morning when the monks are around doing their thing.

Peace in my Mind. A place where you have to climb a little, however when you reach and see Buddha, you will feel inner peace. Must go for all Travelers. Also Do not forget to take the holy water and ask a wish to be fulfill by putting a coin in the big bowl kept outside.

Another amazing Buddha. The climb to the top of the stairs on a very hot day was definitely worth it once we viewed the Golden Buddha. Take the time to appreciate the awesomeness of the Buddha and peace of the space.

Probably the best temple in Bangkok. The Wat Traimit is probably the best of the many temples in Bangkok. The golden Buddha is absolutely stunning but the exhibition covering the Chinese community in Bangkok and the history of its settlement is simply fantastic. Furthermore, given the temple is a stone throw away from Chinatown, it's worth checking out the area as well.
Visit . Amazing place and great cameras are allowed. The individual magnet photos are unique even though unexpected, good quality and a reasonable price. Definitely a must see whilst touring Bangkok.
Nice Temple. It was nice enough, impressive but hard to see the whole thing or take a full photo due to tents in the way.
Must see attraction!. Went with my family. We really liked the place,even with all the tourists overflowing the place, it was still worth seeing.

Visiting Wat Trai Mitr. I had visited Wat Trai Mitr last two weeks ago. Museum is situated floor ground was interesting how chinese refugee was immigrate to Thailand and make a life in China Town (Yaowarach). Upstair you can take a look at the biggest golden buddha. Be careful to wear proper (not short sleeves/short pants). Was well worth visit.
A fantastic place to visit.. It was an awesome trip to see the Golden Buda. Great views from the top. Fantastic pictures. The attention to detail in the carvings must have taken years.

A sight well worth seeing but assaulted by a member of staff. This place was Thailand through and through. Spectacular looking building and the golden buddha was stunning. Sadly I'd been misinformed about the tour (thanks to our tour operator) which I'd thought was a sightseeing tour and it turned out to be a temple tour - the guide didn't mention when he picked us up so I was inappropriately dressed... not a major problem as they do have 1950s housewife nylon over-dresses to put on (how fetching) but the woman distributing them actually SLAPPED MY LEGS. I really mean it. I'm aware that communication is difficult with a language barrier but seriously, in any language surely assault of a customer is a no-no..? If it had been UK, the response would have probably cost the woman her job but this is Thailand and I guess there are different rules - therefore I refrained from the urge to retaliate.
Don't Need a Tour Guide, Just Go See It!. The golden Buddha is pretty spectacular and I highly recommend stopping by to see it but you can definitely view this on your own. Temple attire it required.
Another wonder. This is another display of the grandure of the Buddhas.Again makes you wonder how it got there.Very nice site. Peaceful
interesting but not the best. interesting but I found other ones better, if you see it frst you wiill enjoy it more, if not you will say "another one"; close to Chinatown
Peace all around you.. Beautifully crafted Buddha. Please do cover yourself in coats or shawls. You are not allowed to enter any temple with short and sleeveless clothes.

nice temple in the middle of the city. This was our first temple which we have visited with our guide.I have not thought that it would feel so different to a church or mosc.. but in buddhism everything is bright and "happy" and all you do is for luck and for getting a wish fulfilled. They bring flowers.. clothes for the monks.. and give it as a sacrifice to the buddha.This buddha was once in stone and as they tried to move it, it fell down and broke open.. inside was the pure gold buddha. Really amazing.

Wat Traimit. A couple of blocks from our hotel, Shanghai Mansion. The golden buddha was very interesting, but the exhibit which went with it was excellent. Described how the Buddha was made, moved on rolling timber. There was also a very well documented history of the Chinese in Thailand.

wow gold!!!!. This is a must see for any traveller, and when you climb up to the temple nothing prepares you for what is inside.The sheer size and amount of gold will blow you away,photos are allowed,be prepared to be amazed!!!!!!!!

Golden Culture. A temple in the middle of town. Well worth a visit but do it yourself and don't book a tour.There are quite a number of stairs so it may not be that suitable for the elderly or disabled.

Family Getaway. This is a very beautiful place, lots of history here.They ask you to remove your shoes before going inside the place, They do offer a slipper for you to where, if your size is there. Most sizes are small to medium. You may want to carry a change in a backpack that is your size. I didn't want to leave my shoes outside in the bins, so I carried them.
Incredible. Another must see when in Bangkok, visiting here and looking around really allows someone to take in and appreciate the devotedness of the local people to their religion. Not to be missed.
Beautiful Temple. Wonderful place to see with a large Buddha. Lots of shops and eating places around it and obviously an important place for the Thai people.

golden buddha its huge :O !!. it is located at quite crowded location but the structure and architecture of the temple is beautiful and it gave us chance to learn about Thai Buddhist culture and its brief history !!

Beautiful. After a night on the town in Bangkok is was nice to have a relaxing day hanging around the temples. For a cheap price and a quick stop and a tour agency for some free gas, a tuk tuk driver will take you around to most of the temples.

Nothing special. Yes, there is a 5-tons-big- Buddha, and that's all. Located in China town, the temple looks like a tourist trap with many tour groups coming from Vietnam, China and Korea. After visit the main temple with Golden Buddha, tourists are leaded to many shops surrounding.The temple closes quite soon, so be aware the open hours. If you're looking for beautiful temples in Bangkok, there are many, but not this ones. Wat Pho or Wat Arun are ways better.
The temple has a statue of 5 ton solid Gold. The temple is worth visiting it has a ancient statue of Lord Buddha of solid gold of 5 ton.This is the only place were you can see 5 ton gold.
visual delight. This temple is well known for its 3-metre tall, 5.5 tons solid gold Buddha image which is simply breath taking.The Buddhha's idol is very captivating worth a vist
Fabulous!. You could walk around the Buddha and see all sides of it. Pictures were allowed and I took a few. Breath taking!

The Golden Buddha. A must see in Thailand. Nice about going on a tour is that you get to hear of its history as well....more than 5tons of 18K solid gold initially covered with concrete to protect from the war. Do not get worried about the steps - there's an option to use an elevator if it is too much for you. Nearby shops are also accessible if you get too thirsty with the heat - some nice souvenir shops as well. They are not so strict in this temple as they would allow you to take photos. However, do not use shorts, flip flops ore sleeveless. Rentals of robe is at 20baht.

Gold, gold, gold.. This is one of the three major Buddha statues and probably part of your itinerary for Bangkok. It's quite impressive and the building itself is beautiful with it's winding white steps.

Guided tour. Amazing statue/temple which I struggled to believe was 5.5 tonnes of solid gold. Difficult to have a spiritual experience because it was so busy with tourists but if you are close by its worth a look.
When on a tour with godson. Excellent visit. Great to see its an inspiration. Make sure you take something to cover your shoulders and knees.

World bigest buddha. Its mostly included by all travel agents in Half day temple tour. Must visit. Great to see the temple. Women & Girls kindly do not wear sleeveless or ready to pay rent of 40 bhat for 5 mins rental of small cloth to hide your sleves
Impressive. Beautifiul. Not much more to say. Make sure to pay your respects. Remove shoes. Women must cover legs and arms (they will loan you shawls).

Decent Wat. As far as wats go, this one was not one of my favorites, but, to be fair, it is by no means the worse one I have visited. As it is on the beaten path of Bangkok sights, it is easy to find and enjoy.

Good to visit. You can see golden Buddha in this temple. It is very good to visit and also to learn its history.
The architecture is awesome.

Big Golden Buddha. If you come from the BTS Station this place is easy to locate, just follow the signage placed along the street. Big Pure Gold Buddha. The place was not so crowded compared to other attractions during our visit. They also don't allow sleeveless inside. Lastly, they don't have an entrance fee.

If you're around, you must visit. After seeing 2-3 temples, someone like me is usually bored but this was one of the stops of our tour (an expensive tour but a nice one). The statue of Budha is made of pure gold and is giant. Don't wear hats/caps inside the temple. There are plenty of stairs but the sight is a nice one. On your return, a person might want to sell you badges with your picture on it (happened to us). Prayers keep on going while people are visiting the temple.As this place is in vicinity to many other attractions, spending 30 minutes here will be enough and then moving on to the other attractions.There's a fee, just so that you know, but a minimal one.
Nice. Not a very touristy area so very easy to walk around but maybe not the most touristy attraction I guess. Made for good viewing though.
24 carat trip. Very good and a nice place to visit in Bangkok, you don't need a guide, or use a tour, book a taxi and pay the very small amount on entry.

Amazing Golden Buddha. To be able to experience Thailand's version of a Chinatown and see the Golden Buddha, we stayed in a hotel walking distance to Wat Traimit.We went early in the morning as soon as they opened, there was a long line of people. Foreigners were asked to buy tickets, but the Thais were free to enter. We walked up the steps and then remove our shoes. It was hot but there was a plastic matting on the walkway so our feet were not scorched with the hot walk. Inside the temple, people were jostling to get a better position for a selfie! It was amazing how this huge golden buddha was hidden for a long time.

Golden buddha. Solid gold Buddha just outside Chinatown. Lots of touts outside selling everything imaginable. They'll even take a covert picture of you as you enter the temple and present you with a selection of photo gift novelties when you leave (key rings etc) true entrepreneurs !!!! Despite that it's a sight worth seeing

Wow!. Largest golden buddha ever!! Not too far up a walk but in the scorching heat it felt forever to get up to the top. Shoes need to be off and the ground felt like it was on fire but when we walked in, it was totally worth it! Huge golden buddha!

Beautiful!. Very beautiful temple and the Buddha is amazing. It was very crowded and hot, but worth the see. I recommend doing a tour so the tour guide can tell you all about the temple and the Buddha. The temple does require cover for females and no tank tops.

Interesting visit. Visited one day whilst staying in Bangkok. Took a tuk tuk here for 120 baht from not far from Khaosan Road. Make sure you are appropriately dressed when visiting - ie must cover shoulders and legs above the knee. The Buddha itself is impressive, being worth £28 million, however it does not take long to see everything here (if you only buy a ticket to the Buddha and not the museum) and we were only there for about 20 minutes , so if you can fit in a visit to this temple then it is definitely worth going to.

A Relic of a Golden Era. Made of pure gold, this massive Buddha impresses everyone that comes across it. It is one of the most beautiful things we have ever seen - the pride of Thai culture which is a reminder of their interesting history.

A must see!. When visiting Thailand, you might feel like if you've seen one temple or Buddha, you've seen them all but don't miss this Golden Buddha. Every temple you visit will have it's own unique qualities. Be sure to dress modestly - no shorts and shirt sleeves must cover the elbows.

Just when you thought you had seen everything.... The Golden Buddha is an extraordinary sculpture of the Buddha, in a large size with about 5 tons of solid gold...It was made in the 13th century but subsequently hidden inside another sculpture of Buddha, which hid it from view during a war. Afterwards the ones that knew the secret must have died during the conflict as it remained encased in the plaster figure till the 1950's when it was being moved and accidentally the outer sculpture cracked in a corner, revealing the golden Buddha within.It is beautifully carved and makes a huge impact on seeing it, somehow one realizes right away that it's just not another golden Buddha, but there is something strangely magnificent about this realization, the fact that the metal was used as if it were bronze or any other metal, and that the one who renounced throne and fortune for the salvation of mankind should be remembered in the most valuable of all materials.It is a miracle that this wonder of the world has survived. It is housed in a beautiful temple that is complimentary to it, but does not take away from the Golden Buddha being the center of attention.
Good place to visit. Beautiful Pagoda with gold Buddha.i felt very peaceful when came here. Easy to reach via MRT. Recommend.

A Must visit when in Bangkok.. This place is so wonderful. I went with a large group. It is difficult to explain its attraction as it is one of these places which you experience. It is magical and spiritual at the same time.

One of Bangkok's "must do" temples. Thailand is a wonderful place if stunning architecture is your thing (and even if it ISN'T your thing!). Visiting some of the incredible temples is a "must do". At many of the mid to upmarket hotels you can hire a limo and driver and you can have a day of incredible sights - the Temple of the Golden Buddha being one of the star attractions amid an incredible array of buildings.
Golden Buddha Temple is Beautiful. Worth a visit. It is a nice historic site to visit near chinatown. I believe in most temples there is a dress code for women so keep that in mind.

Impressive golden Buddha but crowded and noisy. You have to go to see the Buddha up close, but this is not a peaceful temple. Lots of people yelling and elbowing for position to take pictures.40 baht entry. You need to take off your shoes, but the ground is not hot and they have shoe racks.

Nice. The Temple of the Golden Buddha was a very historical and neat place. There is a dress code for females, so make sure you understand what you can and can't wear. I enjoyed my visit and took about 45 mins to see everything in the area. A nice stop in Bangkok

Bangkok Must See. On our adventure through Chinatown we stumbled upon Wat Traimit, home to The Golden Buddha, the world's largest solid gold statue with an unusual history. The Golden Buddha is truly a wonder - a pinnacle of human perfection and devotion.
Beautiful. The best place of Thailand to visit every tourist must & feel to proud ..... & to pray also with an awesome atmosphere

Beautiful, magnificient temple, a must visit to experience the Divine presence of Lord Buddha!. Beautiful, peaceful, magnanimous, opulent statues of the Lord. Worth a visit to imbibe the inner peace & outer beauty of the Holy place & its Divine Presence. One of the most beautiful temples of the Lord....a must visit!

A PERFECT PLACE FOR BUDDHA DEVOTEES. A Perfect place for Lord Buddha Devotees , A very Quiet & fine place to pray with your heart to Lord Buddha & fell the Blessing From your god , Every one who visited to Buddha temple i thinks may god gives them a lot of Blessing for complete their wishes in life.

A must visit place.. don't wear sleeveless and above knee pants/ clothes . This is a real good Buddha temple.. The Buddha statue is really pleasant... Outside the temple there is a wish pond kind of thing... u need to stand lil far from dat thing and throw coins in it... If ur coin goes in u need to make a wish and that will be fulfilled... close by is China town which can be seen from the temple... nr the staircase when u leave on right hand side u will c a monk sitting where u can go and request them to pray for their soul n donate something... Ull feel good when u do so
Must go. I have been to this temple a number of times as other travels with have not been to Thailand before and I consider this a must see

5,5 Tons of Gold!. You will see a statue made of gold, weighing 5.5 tons in this place, and a gold statue made from the toughest in the world. Interesting not only from the material, but the statue is expected to be made since the 13th century.
Culture. The Golden Temple has a lot of history and culture. It is good to get a guide so that he/she could explain more about the Buddhist culture.

One of a kind attraction in Bangkok. This is a temple which has a Buddha Statue made of 5.5 tons of Gold (as per our guide). The temple is quite and serene. It is very peaceful when you go inside. The whole ambiance kind of grips you in and makes you feel a part of it. The architecture is beautiful and its always kept very clean. One should go and chant for sometime and feel the quietness of this place within themselves.

A day amongst the greats. Part of a complex. Great architecture and of special interest for artists, art historians, architects and ceramic artistsand will be enjoyed by anybody who loves beaty, history as well as have an interest in religions.

Must see attraction!. Must see attraction! Tons of gold temple. Nice to spend time know the culture. Language is only difficult to communicate in Bangkok as many don't know English. Better go with tourist bus than individually.

Really beautiful. Went with about an hour left before closing. It was great. Hardly any people. Enjoyed the intricate details and how the place really sparkled as the sun was getting ready to set. Unable to see the feet of the Golden Buddha due to cleaning? However, it was incredible to see. Enjoyed the many, many other Buddhas on site. Before we went in, we had a banana crepe from a food stall across from the entrance that I would recommend if you are needing a sweet pick me up.
Must Visit. Was there with my family. We really liked the place,even with all the tourists overflowing the place, it was still worth seeing. Must see place in Bangkok

Beautiful. This is another "must-see" Temple in Bangkok. The Buddha image is very big and shines. I enjoyed my visit. The Temple is ordinary but the Buddha image is spectacular. You will enjoy it. It should be on your bucket list of things to see in Bangkok.

a humble experience. As a Christian, I experienced a humble feeling of such dedication, tranqulity and genuine people. THE cleanliness, awesomeness and the overall artwork, was amazing. Us westerns can learn so much from our little people friends.
Great place to watch. Dont miss this place when you visit Bankok....Its a very soothing place to visit. Enjoy the tamarind sweet from the near by shops...its a great experiance...

That's a lot of gold!. 5.5 Tonnes of pure gold. What else is there to say??? It doesn't take long to see it but the fact that you are staring up at the biggest lump of pure gold that you will ever see is quite amazing. The building is quite beautiful as well. for 40 Baht it's worth the trip.
Huge,glittering serene Buddha.. Quite serene,clean.Awesome detailed art,wish i had more time to explore.the insane heat bogs u down.wish they had aircoolers,and drinking water installed.

Jaw dropping. If you have the time this is a must in Bangkok,well worth a guide if your budget runs to it.Beware the taxi driver who wants to take you to a Tailor or Jewel place afterwards stick to your own itiinerary.
Golden Buddha. A very tranquil place, Golden Buddha spectacular but spoilt by the canvas erections in front of it. Still a must do.
Amazing. A place you definitely must see while in bangkok ,inspiring and beautiful it is also a spiritual experience: and has a beautiful panoramic view over bangkok from the top

Impressive buddah. It's a temple, the buddha is made out of massive gold, alot of tourists, alot of junk sold outside and that's about it. I liked it because it was a big buddha entirely made out of gold. But other than that... same same!

Hard to find but amazing once you're there! . Wat Traimit is located in China Town, and we found that our taxi driver was unsure about it's location (maybe because of the language barrier). We decided to catch a metered taxi to Bangkok train station and walk the rest of the way. Once we were there, we purchased our tickets (40 baht to see the Golden Buddha alone, or 140 baht for the Buddha and the museums). I would recommend taking the time, and spending the extra money to explore the museum. It is very informative, spotlessly clean, and full of pictures and statues. The Golden Buddha itself is wonderful. Almost 3 metres in length, and 4 in height, it is spectacular. It is important for tourists to be aware of people trying to convince you into their taxis or refusing to start the meter when you get in. We got in a taxi and he refused to use the meter, instead insisting that the journey would cost 300 baht. We got out and tried another taxi and the same journey with the meter running was only 87 baht. Like most temples, ladies are required to cover-up when entering. I slung a light shawl over my shoulders and elbows and this was accepted.
Worth the visit. Mind boggling to try and fathom how many tons of gold that gent is made of! Well worth the visit and a truly enjoyable experience.

Really pleasant place to visit, but I suggest you wear shoes like thongs/sandles.. A very beautiful temple with a very beautiful golden Buddha. If you are thinking of attending, I would recommend you wear shoes like thongs or sandles as you will be required to remove them in 3 separate locations. Also, be careful- there are some very shady people hanging around the backstreets of this area warning you to come with them because the area is 'unsafe'

Solid Gold. A very beautiful Buddha, and to think it weighs over 2 tons and is made of solid gold, it's almost unimaginable. It's a very stunning looking Buddha and you cant visit Bangkok without seeing this.

Must visit, specially for first-timers in Bangkok. The huge golden Buddha is truly a marvel worth seeing. It is also a spiritual experience: you may meditate inside the temple. But the best part of this visit for me (after walking around the area the whole day) is that just outside the temple, the best Thai massage place is ready to heal your aching body, most especially your feet.

Nothing short of amazing. This is a must see attraction! The artistry is truly awe inspiring and beautiful. Many people walk around and take a general look; but if you take your time and look in the corners, edges, and less noticeable areas; you will see some truly amazing talent and beautiful artwork. Two major suggestions: 1. Women and men are required to have no skin showing on their legs and this requires you to rent a wrap for women, and pajama like pants for men before going in. We paid for our wraps and stood in a very long line both in size and time; in order to enter the temple. While waiting in line to enter, my wife was pulled out of the line and a very terse language we didn't understand, was stopped from going in. As it turns out, her wrap was too small and she had a very small slit going down her leg where the two ends met. Because of that they were refusing her entry. He expected us to go all the way back (about 2 blocks away) to the beginning and get a larger wrap. The terseness and demanding tone of the guard in a foreign language and country was very unnerving. Long story short-with a minor adjustment, we passed inspection. What is truly interesting is that we felt had she put the wrap on with the opening in the back or to the opposite side where the guard was on; she would have passed. Also, we noted that there were others with the same issue, but because they were in the middle of the crowd of people instead of on the edge like my wife; they passed muster. Later while in the temple we were shocked to see a young girl with a very short skirt and no wrap. How she got through is beyond us. 2. We just happened to hit it at a timing when there was a special holiday in the country which brought out gobs of people. Suggestion, while planning any trip would be wise to first check if there are any holidays or celebrations scheduled/planned so you can avoid the mobs. You truly haven't experienced mobs of people until you travel to a country that has a high density rate!

Wow. So great to see this temple. The inside was so beautiful. A MUST see!! This was included with the tour i took with Thai Tour Guides. Outside the temple tons of people were making offerings which was great.

Your chance to see what 5 tons of gold looks like!. This is a very attractive temple in its own right, but the real attraction is the incredible sold gold Buddha that was once hidden from invaders with a crude plaster coating and then forgotten for decades, only to be re-discovered when the statue fell from a lift while being moved, cracking open the plaster. Not on the main tourism trails, but it should be! Beautiful temple and fascinating story!

Magnificent history and fascinating. Fantastic place to visit but yo independently ,we hate the tour guide thing and you are shuffled here and there on a time scale ,they get more money for each tour,economics right?Hm Bangkok is interesting but way over crowded ,and busy, life threatening on evening if you for or walks and pick pockets rife Go but be very careful,cautious and two ,three days enough

Lotta gold. Large sitting Golden Buddha, interesting to look at for a short time, maybe 5 mins. The story about how the Thai's found it is more interesting than the walk up of all the stairs. Their is a small admission fee but if you in the area it's ok to check out. Although the vendors around the stairs can get really pushy.

A must see!. Saw this temple as part of a temple tour, whilst I would not recommend the temple tour. you must see this temple, the temple is simply stunning. However this temple can become very busy and you will have to clb to flights of stairs to get to the temple. At the bottom of the temple there are lots of people trying to sell you souvenirs the temple is also located in china town

A temple worth visiting . The temple although not big but it is worth visiting with no admission fee to get in. The temple have a few step to get up there so those who have leg issue will probably have difficulty visiting the temple. For the ladies and gentlemen, like all temple, need to have proper attire to get in or you need to pay 20 baht to rent it. Proper attire as in to cover the shoulder and kneel cap. To get there, can take MRT to Hua Lamphong and walk about 10 minutes to get there. You can continue to stroll to the Chinatown about giving your visit. Recommended time for the visit is about 30-45 minutes
very nice temple. a big and nice place to take photos.. interesting history.. the temple is wonderful and beautiful but its sad that the temple has become a tourist attraction..

Fantastic. Is the largest Golden Buddha Image in the world. It was made of pure gold. Is about 12 feet in diameter and height of 15 feet. Is 700 years old. Is a valuable treasure of Thailand. Price value around 28.5 million pounds. The sanctity of golden Buddha Image bless you with good luck.
serene ...... very nice temple with very good statue we enjoyed a lot, one can also have fresh fruits in the premises for very low price.
Gold and beautiful. This is very special I guess if your in Asia this is a lovely choice of Buddha to see,there are a lot to choose but we enjoyed this one very much

Sadly Changed - but still Amazing. I first visited Wat Traimit on the 3rd December 1998 - easy to remember as it was my first visit to Thailand and it was my Birthday.Then this was a small temple, somewhat unknown and I felt special learning all about this amazing place. I fell in love with this great country because of places like this.I was there recently and sadly the temple has grown into a busy tourist attraction. This is not surprising as the temple is wonderful and the story fascinating.Well worth a trip if you in the area.

WOW. I had not visited this temple in 10 years and what a difference! The Buddha use to be a=in a very non descript housing but now it's in a beautiful setting in a beautiful building. It's is a must see.

Definitely worth the visit.... As other mentioned before, take socks with you or it's going to be HOT... I loved this temple very much since they also have an exhibit on the second floor. 140 baht all together... Not too bad;)

Very nice. The temple of golden buddha is the perfect place to visit and has a hectic free day in bangkok. The premises are very clean as well as the discipline is maintained properly. I feel relaxed and was at peace the whole time I was in temple and is easy to locate as well.

AMAZING! BUT TAKE SOCKS!. Do not miss this Temple.Be aware, though, that you'll need to take shoes off as usual, but at a point where the ground is BLAZING hot, so bare feet not HAPPY! Wear, or bring, socks to protect your feet for Temple visits
Beautiful place to see. The temple holds a solid 5.5 tons of pure gold buddah statue.There is not much to see more than that though, but a 20 minutes visit worth the time on the way to chinatown.

Do not miss. This is slightly south of the typical tourbus circuit of Bangkok. Take the time to see it, even if you must strike out on your own as I did. This is perhaps the most moving Buddhist temple I have visited in SE Asia.

Loved it ! . Beautiful temple in the city of Bangkok! I would definitely recommend for people to go check this temple out. It was the first one we went to and it was lovely! We were told It is home to the largest solid gold Buddha statue in the world! The only thing I would point out is for women to be mindful of what they wear to the temple. You will not be allowed to enter with your skin showing above the knee, also must be wearing longer sleeves. Even if you forget to wear more modest clothing they actually rent out scarves for you to cover up with and still be able to see the temple! Well worth the visit
great pleace to visit. it was great experience visiting golden buddha temple.we had chanting & prayer.few minutes meditation.guest visiting thailand must visit goldan buddha .

Go Early as it gets hot and busy. I have been to Wat Traimit on many occasions its one of those must see places for any traveller to Bangkok along with a few other must seesThe Wat can get really busy at certain times of the year and is sometimes over run by tour buses.. My recommendation would be to go early and avoid the madding crowds and also the intense Bangkok heat, take some water and a fan if possible
Too crowded. Its crowded. A lot of tour buses. I didn't really enjoy the place.I would suggest you to go other places. Which is more culture and peaceful.10 mins walk from MRT station.

Just okay, would recommend other temples over this one. It's a neat view at the top of the temple, but there isn't much going on in the area (maybe we just didn't find it, who knows). We walked over from the Hua Lamphong train station. The temple's tucked away in the neighborhood. The room with the Golden Buddha's room is very small and it was lackluster by comparison to Wat Pho or even the Jade Buddha.I only suggest going if you need to kill 30 minutes with another temple, you're nearby and don't mind spending 100 baht for a ticket.

Yep. It is Gold! ;). Simply magnificent in its grandeur, age and place in History. Take time here to reflect on a truly different culture in a different time. The Value and Respect inherent here will seep into you as you stroll. Medium exertion in getting around, but what an experience .

Wow. We visited this temple with our guide who informed us of the history of the loss and finding of the Golden Buddha. While there I discovered the worst JOB in the world. The day was approx 38Degrees and in the yard of the Temple there was approx 10 furnaces melting Gold. In the fiw minutes we were standing there I estimated the temp to be well above 50Degrees, yet the work men did not seem to notice.

My favourite temple in Bangkok. You may say the location is a little outside of the main tourist area in Central Bangkok but if you can get there then do go. This is by far my favourite temple as it houses an amazing huge temple with a breathtaking gold buddha inside. You can choose to buy a ticket for the golden buddha on it's own or add on a ticket for the exhibition on the floor below, I didn't do the exhibition so can't comment. Fantastic temple, would highly recommend.

Peacefully pleasant !!!. Absolutely Blissful Temple of the Golden Buddha , we visited this wonderful temple on 20.05.15 , 40baht entrance ticket for the temple on the 4th floor and 100bhat ticket for both museum and temple , museum located in the lower floors.With high and Handsome tower located close to China town and Little India.When we sit in silence after doing all the formalities, we will be absolutely peaceful and feeling relaxed.Must visit for all age groups when you are in Bangkok.Thanks a lot for everything...Loving you so much...Peacefully yours.S M Bega Raaj.Happy travelling...

Beautiful Golden Buddha!. Stunning Golden Buddha located at the the highest level of temple complex. Very serene and holy experience. Caution for visitors : dress code is that you should were full clothing, if you are wearing shorts you have to hire a cloth before entering the temple. Please take care to wear appropriate clothing.
Cute little temple. The temple is very small so you're done in just a few minutes. Walk over to Chinatown afterwards to extend your visit in the area.

5.5 ton gold Buddha. Ladies make sure to wear clothing that covers your legs and shoulders as you will not be able to enter the temple if they are exposed. You may rent shawls for a fee, but if you prefer not to pay - come prepared. Beautiful temple.
