Serenity. A must see really when you come to Bangkok it is part of the tourists itinery. Beautiful, serene place to come and contemplate life.

peace in the buzz. Nestled in to buzz of Bangkok this is a gorgeous gem of a temple. So many photo opportunities - the stair cases, flower displays inside etc. It was the first temple we had the pleasure of visiting and it did not disappoint. Definitely worth a visit. Its also not too crowded so take your time and look out over what every day Bangkok is up to from the balconies
Only Golden Buddha.. 10 mins walking distance from Hua Lamphong station. Nothing to watch more, Except The golden Buddha.
Dressing requirement. Do take note of proper dressing is required prior entering. These include no sleeveless and shorts. They made you rent a scalf or sarong if you need to enter the temple.
Gold n gold. Fully golden Buddha. very peaceful and quiet and awesome to see golden Buddha. very big and supereb design inside temple above ceiling.
Golden budha. Totally amazing , such a beautiful statue . very busy with worshipers and tourists but certainly worth the effort to be close to it .
oh la la. just cannot imagine the value of the statue and how they managed to craft it it is truly awesome to see

Beautiful temple. My boyfriend and I went to the temple on a hot day in April! It's not too far too walk from Hua Lampong subway station. We visited both the temple and the museum. The museum was pretty cool. We learned many things about Chinese - Thai community. It was a great way to cool off for a bit from the hot weather outside too. The golden Buddha was beautiful but it was really a bad idea to make people take off their shoes and walk on a very hot floor to go inside building. There should move the racks to somewhere closer to the entrance! Make sure you dress properly and buy tickets before you walking to the top if you want to go see the golden Buddha inside.
Good serene place. One of the main attractions of bangkok.The main temple is quite serene. There are several replicas of buddha in various poses on the side of the temple.
Blissfull. Superb place to feel enlightened. The buddha temple was extremely architectural . The monks offer us blessings. Appreciate the strict dress code enforced even on tourists

Check it out the largest Golden Buddha in the World!. No doubt, this place is absolutely worth to visit. I was stunned by the history of how people in the old days figured out the Golden Buddha by chance. The hidden secret was finally discovered.

Dont skip the museums on this one!. The Buddah image itself was my favorite Buddah image of the trip. It's not the biggest, but i did find it the most beautiful. The museum exhibits are excellent! Some of the others i could have done without, but the exhibits at Wat Traimit were fascinating.

Nice site. The Buddha is small compared to others. It is made of solid gold, 5 tons of it. You can take pictures and some worship. You need to take your shoes off to enter and women need to be somewhat covered with at least short sleeve shirts and knee length pants or skirts.

Very calming experience. Solid gold Buddha, serene surroundings. You can sit and pray, tourists come and go and nobody makes a noise, very calming.
Photos allowed, lovely experience.
The statue is on the 4th floor with steps to climb.
rare thing. 5500 KG golden Buddha , unbelievable . This was under a plaster , so was not stolen. It was identified as golden once broken while shifting.
So much gold. Never seen so much gold all together, impressive to think Thailand is so rich in gold. Entrance is convininent at 40 bht per head and it is worth the visit.

its pure gold. this Buddha is in a small building compared to other major sites. it was nice to just sit and let your mind wrap around all that gold that is just sitting there. There is a monk that is there and he will give you a blessing also. Be sure to buy one of the amulets that are there beside him.

Solid gold buddha. Photos are allowed at this site, and it is amazing to think how expensive this solid gold buddha is. There's not a lot more to see at this temple other than the buddha itself, and there's a good few stairs to climb.
Like many other places, don't forget to cover legs and shoulders.
Golden Buddha Moment. I was mesmerized by the sheer size and weight of such a huge piece of Gold on a buddha statue! A must see in Bangkok to believe it.

Spectacular!!. The Buddha image, which has 5000 kilograms of gold, is really impressive. I was in shock when I entered the temple as there are many details in gold and everything is beautiful. The entrance costs about 40 baths, and it is a mandatory ride. You can visit this and the Wat Pho temple in the same morning.

The Golden Buddha – formally Concrete Buddha. The story behind the Golden Buddha was very interesting, the gold was discovered in 1954, it was previously thought to be made of concrete. It weighs 5.5 tons and is magnificent to look at. It is a huge tourist attraction, try not to go in the middle of the day or you will burn the soles of your feet (your shoes must be removed and placed on a rack, a short walk from the entrance doors.
Amazing Golden Buddha. The huge ancient Buddha made in tonnes of pure gold is an amazing feast to the eyes....nothing else much to see...but you can a good view of the city from the height
Very good Golden Temple. Amazing crafted Golden temple , from outside and inside. Very peaceful to sit and pray...Do donate some amount as you please for the people who maintains them

Beware of Shoe Thieves!. The temple itself is average in comparison to other temples in Bangkok. Perhaps my opinion is a bit tainted by the incident of my wife having her shoes stolen at the smaller temple at the base of the grounds. Incredibly after a 2 minute visit inside, her shoes were stolen! My advice is to put your shoes in a plastic bag inside temples in Bangkok to avoid the potential of having the same happen to you.

Golden Buddha Rules. Less foreigners come here but I don't see why. It is beautiful and worth the cost of entry. Plus you get a nice view of the city. I liked walking around the Buddha noticing the reflection of the sunlight from different angles. The walk up to the temple is nice too and you will see several stone carvings that have incredible detail. I enjoyed the temple and the small crowd.

Golden Buddha. Excellent Huge Idol of Buddha done in pure Gold. Must visit for anyone visiting Bangkok. Only advise would be to go early in the morning as it gets very hotter during the day time. The temple shuts at 4pm in the evening. No sleeveless dress allowed inside the temple. So please dress appropriately or else carry a long scarf to cover yourself adequately.

The Temple of Golden Buddha. Going up the steps in Hot Sun was a pain, It was but a pleasant surprise that there was a lift provided only fir Senior Citizens. Disappointingly It did not but work as we wanted to go down back. 5.5 Tonne Golden Tall Image glittering in Hot Sun was amazing & a feast to eye,
Golden Buddha. The ancient structure is an amazing feast for your eyes. Made in pure gold it stands there as a glittering sun in front of your eyes

It is All About the Golden Buddha. This temple is all about the 5.5-tonne Golden Buddha that is gorgeous and awe-inspiring. The temple's architecture is also stunning, but the statue of Buddha is pure gold is electrifying. Amazing temple
Well worth a visit!. The golden Buddha is absolutely stunning. Not much else to see, but really worth the trip. Located at the Southern end of Chinatown

Look at all that gold. Thailand is devout Buddhist country.Temple of the Golden Buddha, it was interesting to see but hard to believe the Buddha statue is solid gold...amazing !
You enter the second section to see the golden Buddha you need to pay.
Divine. Beautiful statue of Lord Buddha...You cann't stop yourself from bowing down at this divine idol. See the monks residences and meet the Buddhist monk to take blessings.

Underwhelming. After seeing so many other temples and attractions in Bangkok, this wasn't the most impressive of them but still worth a visit. It started pouring rain just as I arrived at the temple so I didnt get the opportunity to admire the temple's exterior or walk up the front stairs. I'd forgotten my shawl that day and it was just my luck there was none to rent. A group of us were locked outside and I was soaking wet. When they opened the doors they harshly turned me away for not being covered up. I pleaded but had the door slammed shut in my face :( No one could help me! I'd already bought my ticket, made the mission there, and was soaking wet...I wasn't going to leave so easily! I managed to pull up my maxi skirt over my shoulders (don't ask how awkward that looked). I was allowed in and after all that i was disppointed to see its just a small room with a big gold buddha. I'd already seen a lot of impressive buddhas by now and while this one is solid gold, it still wasn't "wow". Go if you have time or like me you need to scratch your curiosity but don't hold high expectations.

Is it really Gold?. This is a must see with a tour guide. Get the whole story. Pretty amazing that the community would forego so much wealth in this manner. Equally amazing it has not been plundered. It is an introduction to how devout the country is. Additional note: Currency exchange around the corner has good exchange rates. Bring bills that are in good condition. Torn bills are rejected.
Amazing. The infinite details of intricate work are absolutely gorgeous. The walls, the statues, the monuments, and especially, for me, the traditional Thai murals inside the temples.
Beautiful. the peaceful atmosphere inside the temple is very soothing..A visit to this temple won't take more than 15 mins so one must visit this place.

Tranquilizing place. The temple is beautiful and dreamy set the typical idea of Thai temples. white marbles, tiles and gold decorations and carvings. need to get on steep flight of stairs then the main Sanctorum a huge Golden Buddha Statue with a very calming effect.Its in Bangkok So Don't miss

Awesome. Another must see in Bangkok. You climb up a steep slope of steps and when you enter the Sanctum Sanctorum the huge golden Buddha in a sitting position is awesome. Besides clicking photos take a little time to sit in front for a bit and just experience the calmness of the place. Don't forget to take the holy water bottles.

5.5 Tonne Golden Buddha. One of the most beautiful place in the Bangkok. The Golden Buddha is made of 5.5 Ton pure gold.
All the temple have beautiful carving. do not miss Golden Buddha on your trip.
Lovely. This visit was a part of our tour package. Feels so awesome being in the company of Lord Buddha. Even got ourselves a bottle of the holy water.

An amazing place. Our breath was taken away at the sheer size of this buddha. I couldn't believe how big it was - and that they had managed to put a building around it. Well worth a visit - definitely a must see whilst in Bangkok.

The Buddha was beautiful. I went alone to the Temple of the Golden Buddha. This is a very large Buddha and of course the place is crowded. Taking photos is a challenge due to the size and the crowds. This attraction is worth the visit the temple itself was stunning and the views from the top are priceless

Greatest among all. Imagine a statue of solid 5 tons of gold! Interesting history that the statue was covered with some kind of plaster and no body knew that its solid gold. During transportation to Bangkok, accidentally, a portion of the plaster broke, and shiny metal was there to surprise one and all. If you did not see this you certainly miss the greatest Buddha
Fantastic to see close up. Another must see in Bangkok, a solid gold Buddha, always ensure you dress appropriately, men long trousers, ladies shoulders covered
amazing temple. unique temple ive come across,very calm and peaceful inside the temple.went there and was delighted with the calmness inside the temple

Nice one. This is the first temple we visited in Bangkok because it is closer to the Chinatown we are accommodated. The edifice are well-maintained but we're not allowed to go to the top of the temple for viewing. The funny thing is, somebody (locals) took us a picture while we toured the temple and when we are about to leave the building, they offered to us a memorabilia with our picture laminated on it, and it is expensive, so we refused to buy it.

Massive Gold..... The golden Buddha was located at the end of Chinatown's Yaowarat Road, near Hualampong Railway Station.entrance fee: 100 baht for 4th floor viewing Wat Traimit or the golden Buddha house was the world's largest massive gold seated Buddha. Beautiful 3 Buddhas and a shining gold.

Must see!. After hearing about the golden buddha from a fiend I was intrigued. It really is impressive as is the story behind it. To be in the presence of this 700 year old solid gold buddha which was hidden for hundreds of years really is inspiring. I was left wanting to know more!

Beautiful. The last time I visited this temple was before the current upgrade. At the time it was more intimate. The new buildings and of course the Buddha statue are beautiful.
to my taste a little bit too much merchandising in the compound.

Good but there are better temples. This temple is definitely worth a visit if you have plenty of time in Bangkok but shouldn't be top of your list. The statue is big and all the more impressive because it is solid gold but to be honest because most of the Buddhas have gold covering or gold leaf on them it doesn't stand out as overly impressive.

Wow! Look at all that gold!. It was interesting to see. My husband was not able to walk up all the stairs so the tour guide took us up in an elevator. Hard to believe the Buddha statue is solid gold...amazing! It did not take long to visit. There were vendors selling souvenirs. Worth seeing as Bangkok is known for all the beautiful temples...this is one of them.
nice view at the top. Free temple. It's a nice walk to the top and a great view of the city when you get there. It's close to the grand palace etc. Would recommend it.

Attraction. This temple is situated in the Chinatown area. Take metro line to the end of lamphong and walk to the river and cross the bridge head on . Spent the evening at Chinatown after 7pm. Chinatown come to life with all side stall and food stall. You enter the second section to see the golden Buddha you need to pay entrance fee.
Geat statue. Statue of 5.5 Tons of gold. Ideal place to visit if you are a Buddhist. It has got an exhibition center and the ticket price for it is 100 Bhat. But less than that for the golden buddha.

This place seems to say not very interesting,. This place seems to say not very interesting, because there are several rooms, each king in the rock made temple and statues of Buddha were imported there. In each room a lot of statues. For everything will spend ten minutes at most, but to get to it for a long time. There's a temple, we are told Sri Lankans from the center of the rock dripping water, and so no one knows from where comes this water for me so it's just a bike for tourists. There's a lot of monkeys Well, a lot of people and they are not afraid. They're very wild and scary. Have to climb high on the mountain. The only tour is only a panoramic view of the surrounding area. Generally round in this place do not advise.

Only if you are in the area. If you get to visit the Wat Phra Kaew and Wat Pho first, this will not be as spectacular as them. However, if you are in Bangkok for a longer period of time, it should be included on your list.
Very good. The Buddha is crazy and it's even more if you think that it's made of gold, but if you have to choose, you rather go to Wat Po.
Not so good. You can skip it if you have time constraints. Not worth a visit.There are more attractions in Bangkok than this one.

Golden Buddha!. it was an amazing experience.
nice to know that there really are golden buddha's.
we only see it in the movies.
Must do!. So happy I got to see this whilst in Bangkok. It's not expensive and it's great to see such a well known site. Give it a go!!!!
Nice, but I have seen better. It really is gold so worth to see. But I have seen more awesome temples and Buddhas in other places.

Gold? Awesome!. This was our first stop on the temple tour of the Bangkok...and when you even think of the dimensions and the amount of gold this has to be awesome. A full gold image of Buddha. Three metres tall and more than five tons of gold.In the vicinity is China Town with an equal amount of gold, if not tons more, if you put together the hundreds of gold stores in the region.

Impressive !. Again as with many of the historical places one can visit in Bangkok you should really go with a guide the history and the stories behind the artifacts add such a lot of value to what you will experience from a visit, the story of how this statue survived the many wars in the country's history and the history of the city are so interesting.

A favourite attraction . This is one of my favourite places to visit in BangkokIt is not too crowded and the actual Buddha is in a stunning buildingThe actual Buddha is spectacular and well worth visitingNot to be missed if you visit Bangkok

peaceful. peaceful and at time of our visit very empty. so we had plenty of time for pictures and even to pay some respect. statue and the are a are somehow very calming. do not get taken to tailor's nearby by tuk-tuk drivers...go your own way, take an air-con taxi or even air-con bus.
Amazing Golden Buddha. Located near Chinatown after short 6 min walk from MRT station to amazing Temple,Climb the stairs and go inside to see shiny made from gold Buddha

Amazing. We visited Bangkok during new year so everywhere was spectacular. We really felt part of the celebrations , our tour guide Ti from Asia world was great we learned loads and got involved in the ceremonies - it was very special
When in China town don't miss this gem. Not only is the gold Buddha amazing - there is a wonderful museum under the temple. It tells the story of Bangkok's China town and it is well worth a visit.
Solid Gold. This temple is on the edge of Chinatown and is often overlooked. Smaller crowds but great architecture. The buddha inside is 7 tons of solid gold. Amazing.

Street food in the grounds. This is also one of my all time favourite places to visit. Loved the Golden Buddha temple but it was the whole experience within the grounds that I loved. We sat and had lunch which was divine and the locals loved to try out their English, especially if you praise their 'Mango sticky rice'

Very Commercialised. Not a lot to see and don't make the mistake on going on a tour, Thai people only care about making money of tourists, they'll allow you to see the temple for five minutes but spend hours taking you to different stores. If you go, go on a tuktuk or metered taxi because you'll have to pay the entrance fee regardless.

Temple and BKK Chinatown are fascinating. I thought the temple was beautiful, the story of finding the Buddha was fascinating, and also really enjoyed the museum inside the temple on the history of Bangkok's Chinese community. An afternoon at the temple/museum and then wondering/eating around yaorarat road is was really fun for me.
high temple. before you see the golden buddha you should step around a thousand steps to get to the top then you make your ceremoney from this temple you can see a panoramic bangkok.....
Wonderful. Huge golden Buddha weighing 5.5tonsof solid gold.It is amazing and a most unusual Buddhist temple.A definite must to see when in Bangkok.

Spectacular site. Remember to dress respectfully. Girls need to have shoulders covered, men in long trousers. Costs 40bht to get in. Shoes must be removed before entering. Be aware there are quite a few steps up to the temple. Opposite is a great little shop where for about 40bht you can get a variety of flavoured iced drinks. The coffee one is gorgeous as is the strawberry one. Made of frozen fruit. Try it out. Very refreshing. Can be got to by MRT and only a few hundred meter walk.

Shiny Budha. it a must visit place,, when I came here, I found them while they were doing pray, this place is very sacred, so we have to obey and respect the rule,, then the Big Budha that built by Gold is very interesting,, so shiny :D
Awesome!!. Nice place to be to understand and see the Buddhist style of worship...awesome Golden Idle of Buddha...

Beautiful Peaceful Place. Wat Traimit Temple consists of 3 floors. First main entrance and beautiful Museum on Thai-Chinese culture. Second floor and exhibition and history of the making of the Golden Buddah. Thirdly the Golden Buddah itself. A beautiful piece of Asian art/religion. 3.3 metres tall weight 5 tonnes.Very well presented and gave me an insight to things I didn't know. Very peaceful mixing with public and Buddist Monks. Recommended

Amazing Historical Site with Lovely Carvings. A huge solid gold buddha awaited us as we entered Wat Traimit. After having already seen around 7-8 golden buddhas one would think it gets monotonous but seeing this behemoth structure was awe inspiring. Apart from its size, the intricacy and careful attention to detail shown by the craftsmen both on the statue and across all the carvings in the temple is just breath taking.Photographers, take your macro lens and go....the place makes for some interesting close up shots. Surprisingly this place wasn't as crowded as the reclining buddha. Managed to thoroughly enjoy the place for a solid hour before moving on to the next stop.While people come here to see the statue (obviously), I'd visit here specifically to see the carvings on the temples.
Great. After seeing many Buddha figures covered in gold then seeing the Golden Buddha one has to stop and realize they are looking at a Buddha made of solid gold.
Temple near Chinatown. Its an average temple, but the gold will shine your day. Its not a big place but you can calm down before yo go to Chinatown.

Amazing Sight To See!. Thailand is full of buddhas in all kinds of shapes, colours and sizes but nothing compares to this 15'9" 5.5 ton solid gold buddha. It's definitely breathtaking and also the largest Golden Buddha Image in the world. It was also interesting to learn that the buddha was completely covered in plaster to conceal it from enemy invasion and wasn't discovered to be solid gold until 1955 when the plaster broke during preparations to move the buddha. I also thought it was neat that they had a piece of the plaster that covered the buddha on display inside the temple. Must see while in Bangkok! Remember to wear appropriate clothing. A little crowded.
Spectacular detail . What a beautiful temple with the attention to detail clear to all. This is a special place to visit and a must do on your list for Bangkok.
History and magnificent. Wow. The largest solid gold Buddha. This is also included as part of the city and temples tour. It is the most amazing sights you will ever see in Bangkok.
Impressive. This Buddha is made of solid gold and estimated to be worth £40m. The temple has a calm aura and is well worth a visit. You have to leave your shoes outside and cover your shoulders.

Simply unbelievable. Fascinating that this 5.5ton solid gold Buddha is not on every tourist's must see list. It is located just off the edge of Chinatown, so a combined visit makes sense. We were fortunate that it was not too crowded. Take your time. Revel in watching and appreciating the worshippers, for it is still an active temple. Then marvel at the sight before you. You will likely never see so much gold in one piece before you again.
Awesome. Very beautiful place to visit if you enjoy temples. My husband and I enjoyed it but my son who is 15 didn't . It is a very lovely and spiritual place to visit.

A Solid Gold Buddha - Amazing!. If there is one thing you'll see a lot of in Thailand, it's statues of Buddha. They are everywhere and I mean everywhere. The Golden Buddha is pretty amazing. It's made of solid gold and weighs almost five tons. It's worth in gold is over fourteen million dollars and it's historical value is worth probably even more.Like all temples in Thailand and elsewhere, shoes must be taken off before you go in. Because there was such a crush of people, I came up with the idea to take off my shoes, but take them with me in my satchel. My idea worked perfectly. After we were finished with this part of the tour, I went outside and promptly put on my shoes, while many of my cohorts were trying to figure out where their shoes were.There are certain areas of Thailand that attracts a lot of tourists, and this is one of them. It was crowded and it was difficult to get good photographs with so many people milling about. Also, the temple was in the middle of a minor reboot so there was scaffolding on one side of the temple, which through off the overall ambiance of the place. Construction will do that.It does not take too long to see the Buddha and the outlying temple areas. A typical person could see everything in two or three hours and that's taking their time.

Read the history - its amazing. This was our last temple on our tour and we were dragging our heels on the climb up. But it was so worthwhile making it up there. The Buddha has a mesmeric face and is quite unlike the emerald and the reclining buddha representations.

just beautiful. This temple wasn't on our list of things to see but our tour guide squeezed it in. It was just beautiful. Despite the heat and the crowds it was a wonderfully peaceful shrine. Just remember to cover up before you enter.The story behind the Buddah is also fascinating - imagine seeing that beautiful gold peeking out from under rough plaster!!Worth a visit.

Amazing history and beautiful temple. This temple is not very large like Wat Pho but it is the world's largest solid gold Buddha statue (5 tonne's) so it is a must visit place in Bangkok. The statue is also 700 years old so it has an interesting history. The temple itself is beautiful like most Thai temples. The golden roof highlights the golden statue.
One Of The Highlights. This is one of the highlights of Bangkok. The view from the temple is nice. The architecture is beautiful.

Imagine the horror of dropping a Buddha. Then rethink your situation as you realise that you have broken a simple plaster cast that covers a 700 year old, 3metre tall, solid gold Buddha. This is the story of Wat Traimit where an amazing Sukhothai style Buddha was discovered hidden under plaster when the statue was dropped when being moved. Apparently, the gold image was covered with plaster to conceal it from the invading Burmese and it was rediscovered accidentally about 45 years ago. Pieces of the plaster coating have been kept and can still be seen on display. Interestingly the Buddha is made up of 9 component parts and the purity of the gold varies from about 40 to 99%.In 2010, a new building called “Phra Maha Mondop” was officially opened and the Golden Buddha was moved here. On the first floor the Yaowarat Chinatown Heritage Centre tells the history of Chinese immigrants to Thailand and their culture. The Temple is located to the west of Bangkok’s main railway station Hua Lampong Station on the East end of Yaowarat Road. It is open from 09:00 - 17:00 each day and although it is free to visit the Buddha, there is a modest 10 BHT fee to visit the museum.I recommend combining a visit to the Temple with a walk around the neighbouring Chinatown. It is amazing and the food is incredible.
beautiful temple. Large buddhist temple are always interesting for what they mean. They are always in activity, well maintained, and have beautiful decors.

Bring extra socks. Best tip. Bring socks that you can toss in a bag or whatever, after taking your shoes off for going inside the temple. Lots of people walking around everywhere. They do let you take photos inside this one, but they worry about the shoes. It is more crowded outside. Inside, small, goes quick.
Solid Gold giant Buddha!. Solid Gold giant Buddha! This beautiful temple is very impressive in its architecture and a must visit!

Another good temple. We visited the exhibition at the ground and first floor before visiting the temple. We learnt how the Buddha statues are made in detail. it was a very good account and I recommend to anyone visiting this temple. Then we went up to the 4th floor to visit the Golden Buddha, very impressive structure.

A CALM AND SERENE PLACE. The temple is located in the heart of the city.It is a place where you can go and relax.The golden buddhha is a magnificent site to see.P.S.Don't buy ticket and waste your 40 bahts no one checks for it.

Shining little stop. My husband and me had planned on spending a whole day sightseeing the China town area and this temple was a very nice spot to visit. I don't consider it a 'must see', but if you're close I think it's worth visiting.They offer robes for people that have shorts or visible shoulders, so no problem there. I lived the place and the pictures came out wonderful. :)

great!. What a site and well worth the trip to visit and what a lovely atmosphere and if you like temples, pagodoa, buddhas and arcitecture you will love it... plenty of drinks on site so no need to wory
Nice temple in heart of Bangkok. An interesting temple with large solid gold Buddha. A bit of a walk up if it's really hot (and it was).
Just an ok place.. If you're in China Town, just step on a visit. It's pretty nice. But would recommend to see other nice temples around as well.

Stunningly beautiful. I would recommend this as one of the first temples to see as by the end of the temple tour you can get Buddha'd out and their individual beauty can be diminished. This Buddha is stunning...5.5 tonnes of solid gold with a magnificent history surrounding it - leave it to you to find out!

Worth a visit, for more than the Big gold Buddha.. The Buddha in itself is worth a visit (forigners pay a small fee, personally I don't approve of that, I'd rather donate)But the temple itself holds more than the statue. We met an older monk some years ago that we visit every time. He will never have time to meet all visitors, but my point is. If you visit, explore the temple grounds and you might find more interesting things other than the massive statue? Either way, worth a visit. Great veiws around sunset from the top balcony and many angles to get some great photos. Only downside to this place is the massive crowds of somewhat unruly tourists at times.

Golden Bhddha. This statue is located in very ordinary place and in a very down to earth temple and yet it is made of solid gold. My guide explained all about this temple. This place is worth visiting.
Wow. 5 kilos of solid gold unbelievable, it was incredible,very hot day though.Lots of people it was hard to to take pictures, very worthy of a visit if in Bangkok

Tranquility. As a Buddhist I enjoyed visiting this temple very much. Felt relaxed and experienced tranquility from the very moment I stepped in to the temple premises. There are venders trying to sell things to you but they are all good souvenirs worth buying! There is a minimum charge for foreigners understandably. There is also a nice souvenir shop where you can buy relics of Buddha at a fair price.
Biggest Gold Statue in the World . Very potentially one of the most unique 73 visit in Bangkok, as it is the biggest gold statue on the planet – estimated worth of $250 million

Amazing image of Buddha. No wonder this image of Buddha has made it into the Guiness Book of Worl Records. Simply amazing. The story in relation to how it was built and erected was also very interesting. Well worth the visit
Exceeded our expectations. Nothing to dislike! The Golden Buddha at 3 metres high and weighing five and a half tons,it is the world's largest solid gold statue and well worth a visit.
magnificent art work. thmade of statue made of single piece of 18 karat gold is in itself a sheer beauty. the temple place is peaceful, well maintained

My Favorite temple. The buda is beautiful. 88% Gold. The temple is opened on 4 sides so air is circulating through the room alongside with daylight. As in all the temple there's holy water and you can make donations for different charities.
Off the Beaten Path. Would have missed this wonderful shrine, but for our intrepid tuk-tuk driver. Very much enjoyed our peaceful visit here before the serene statue.

Lovely to see but not a lot there. Situated in China town, impressive Buddha . Not a lot else in complex , watch out for scammers. Toilets ok but Eastern variety.. One to tick off to see. Not a lot else to see in surrounding neighbourhood

It's all about size. You will see many images of Buddha in Thailand, some Thai, some Myanmar, some Indian, etc. But there will be none you will confuse with this one for it's 5.5 tons of metal. We were there when the images were draped in Gold cloth but that changes with the month and occasion.

Worth a Short Visit. The special attraction at this temple is the "Reclining Buddha" which is amazing in size and sparkling in "gold" . We were taken aback at the size of the Buddha which allows for good impressive photo shots. The rest of the temple area is magnificent as far as workmanship and color. It is the one of the largest Buddha temple areas we have ever seen. Sometime when you travel a lot you can overdose on temples, cathedrals and castles but we were glad we visited the "reclining Buddha".

its got a buddha statue made of gold (allegedly). Its worth spending half an hour to visit as part of trip around Chinatown would be my suggestion.To what extent the statue is actually solid gold given that the place is completely unguarded is arguable but it’s a nice story for the visitors

BODY n SOUL both need it... This temple is in the middle of a crowded place and that is what makes it so interesting. Budda is a way of life with the Thai people and it is heart warming to see this. I strongly recommend it to the non Buddhist and atheists too. After feasting on so much mouth watering Thai food your body will bless you for the climb upto heaven!! Once on the top the golden buddha's shimmering glow will calm you. It's nice and windy up there and open from three sides. At the bottom ther are cows. Hawkers sell exotic guava and other fruits from glass carts full of ice. This is a must treat for your senses as you won't find such fruit in other countries.
Marvellous!. Divine experience. A taxi is the best way to reach the place if you are visiting during the summer. Otherwise you can walk from the nearest bus stop or boat station.
All that glitters is gold. Very spiritual for Buddhist. The Golden Buddha is 100% 9ct gold. No shoes in temple, but shoes are safe despite may people bussing around
Fabulous. Busy but not too bad considering the winter tour season. Plan on spending an hour to fully enjoy the grounds.
Quite beautiful. A must in the city. Go to the 4th floor, watch the buddah and feel the vib. Watch praying if possible. See around the dynamics of the place. Then walk through the china town.
Not Too much to watch but if in Bangkok must Visit!!. There's not too much to see here Only a Sitting buddha Sclupture inside the temple, Not a gr8 view also from up there. Ok visit there.....
All gold. Very nice Buddha in 3.5 ton of gold. Close to chains town and lots of nice street food around of it. I was surprised that there was only one guard.

City Surprise. We walked though busy streets and there suddenly was a temple!
I saw so many Buddhas on this trip but this was the first one where I got a back view. Did you know...we were told in Sri Lanka....that it is an offence to turn your back on a statue of Buddha?
Wonderful place. I enjoy a lot visinting Golden statue of buddha, my wife love such religious places so she admire me for show her this amazing place

Popular temple with interesting museum. The temple was very crowded and it was difficult to see the Buddha statue.
I enjoyed the museum on the lower floors which had interesting displays and did not seem so popular with the tour bus crowd.

Not visually impressive, but history is interesting. Not very impressive visually, but the history is impressive. The buddha statue was covered in plaster and forgotten until it was moved, dropped, and the plaster cracked. Now we know it as the world's largest pure gold statue. Ignore all of the "helpful" locals around - scams abound in this part of town.
Vey beautiful. In my opinion is one of the most impressive ones, and the decoration around it makes you feel you are in a full room made of gold.
Majestic. It is a bit crowded. But the temple was nice. We had to take off our show. It I was hot there but they gave free drinking water

Pure Gold - need to see this. The Buddha is made of pure gold. Our guide if I remember right tells me it is made out of 550 kg of gold. It is magnificent and a must see. The best thing is there is no security or anything at all in this temple. The Buddha is placed on a high platform and you can really see it up close.

A little Tresaure. We would not have found it if we had not had our guide who took us to China town which this Wat is just on the outside of the areaUnassuming Wat but even so beautiful ( Get there early before all the coach loads of tourists)After visiting look around China town the smells the food the hussle and bussle

Excellent Place. If you are looking at the Buddhist way of life here you will get to understand a lot of history its growth and how it influenced the way of living in Thailand and all the surrounding countries.

A must see experience. We were on a teak boat trip and stopped at this Temple. We walked from our boat to the temple which was not very far. What an experience. We walked round and our guide gave us a wonderful insight into Buddhism. The temple itself was huge and as we walked upstairs it was mostly made of marble so was cool. We saw the golden Buddha which was made of solid gold and weighed approximately 1000kg. We had a fantastic day out.

its the real thing!. One look and you realise just what solid gold looks like as compared with all other representations. Interesting story as to how it was discovered and fewer tourists than other venues added bonuses.

Enchanting.. In Bangkok, this is the one of the places crowded with tourists. Before you go there, take note to wear proper clothes - pants and shirt with sleeves as a sign of respect for culture, place and religion. There's a lot of spot to take photos but there are spot there that is prohibited to take photos.. But the highlight was seeing the image of the golden buddha. I advice you to pay respect like bowing. worth while to go there to understand more the Thai culture and beliefs,

Magnificent. The Golden Buddha temple is magnificent and is located near the China Town. The statue is amazing and is made of gold. It is huge and weighs nearly 5.5 tons. The temple is on the second floor. On the first floor is the china town where you need to pay 100Bht to go inside. Do not forget to look at the beautiful painting on the wall.
Fantastic grounds. I have been to a few temples in BKK and found this one to be less surrounded by street vendors trying to sell you everything. This is truly a beautiful temple.

Magnificent golden statue. The color of the golden buddha is truly amazing. And it is very economical and one of the most economical temples to visit in Bangkok. It is really worth it if you love temples.

You need a wide angle lens to get it all in .. Wat Tramit is not far from china town , so you can combine the two places . We only paid to go to the fourth floor . It has a amazing Golden Budda , a photographers dream . You get a amazing view from the top another not to be missed Wat .

A very small Temple, take u 15 min to get it done with. We arrived there by hiring a tuk tuk driver all day,he took us there! He asked us to purchase tickets to go up there, once we paid for the tickets, nobody was collecting it, lots of people just walked up there, what's the point buying tickets? tuk tuk drivers or taxi drivers bringing tourist there are probably getting a kick back. Also, I don't know much about Thai religion but why a Thai Buddha temple, they installed some big fancy western style crystal chandelier in there? Totally not matching and not authentic. Outside the Temple building have nothing, so you can't even walk around the temple or the street.

Nice Place To Visit. Its really nice place to visit first time travellers. But you say your travel agent that he provide a guide to understand basic culture of Bangkok and the temple. Because without guide you feel its like a temple.
Fantastic. Love it and lots of walking and really crowded. need good walking shoes and water and dont forget wearing hat and sunglasses!

Its ok. In fairness I probally am not being fair on this review by the time we visited this I felt all templed out I would advise rather than visit all the temples in one day split it up over a two day period into half days and this will benefit you more.

Must visit if you are in Bangkok. The temple is situated in busy area of city near china town. As soon as you enter in you feel the energy of pure peace and strength of meditation. The gold idol of Buddha is just too good and the story behind it is worth telling again and again. If you happen to visit Bangkok then this place is a must visit.

Famous temple in near Bangkok Chinatown - Golden Buddha. One of the popular temple in Bangkok and the temple can be crowded in a very busy day. The admission fee for the temple is 40 THB for the Golden Buddha and 100 THB for the museum below it. I suggest that you only buy the ticket for the Golden Buddha at the 4th level of the temple for 40 THB which is the highlight of this place specially if you're in a hurry. You can have pictures inside the temple but you have to remove your shoes as you enter.

Beautiful and wonderful views of BAngkok from the top. Visited on my own. A huge Buddhist complex that was being used by the locals.only 20 baht to enter. The walkway up to the temple is mainly stairs so not suitable for those with walking issues. Lots of things to see on the way up. You are encouraged to see all of the temple . lots of tourists and locals visited when I was there but it did not seem crowded. Helpful staff and beautiful Buddhist shrines to see. A very calming place in busy Bangkok. The views from the top of the BAngkok skyline is worth the trip even if you are not spiritual. I really enjoyed my time there

All the cultural temples in Bangkok are brilliant. ... and this is also one of them. A truly amazing experience. A must see when you are in Bangkok. Even though you will be amazed at the size and beauty of the Golden Buddha, please remember to take note of the fantastic paintings on the walls of the temple.

Solid Gold. The story of the statue itself is well worth telling. It is made of solid gold but was hidden under plaster for about 700 years. It was being transported from one temple to another in the 1950s when it was dropped, the plaster cracked and revealed this amazing statue underneath. I believe it weighs around 5.5 tons and is the largest solid gold buddha in existence. The temple housing it was built in 2010 and also includes the Bangkok Chinatown Heritage Centre and a history of the Golden Buddha.
Gold and more gold.. Probably like nothing you will ever see again. This is solid god and the story of it being made is fascinating.
Worth checking out. I really liked this Wat. The solid gold Buddha is really a site to see. Building is also beautiful with hand painted wall décor.

Read the history of the Golden Buddha.... A golden Buddha weighing 1.5 tons (of pure gold!) which has been concealed into plaster for 700 years, and during its transportation, in 1955, has been dropped to the ground, revealing its existence. An amazing piece of art, in an exquisite Temple.

Beautiful. Grand temple with four stories and two giant golden Buddhas -- one is solid gold! (40B to see it, 100B for the entire exhibition). Great detail over nearly all surfaces. Bit touristic with many little trinket stalls on the concourse, but still can interact with monks, receive their blessings, etc.

Nice temple, but in a challenging location. Well kept temple with impressive medium sized golden buddha. The exhibit is worth seeing and is conveniently air conditioned. However, you should take a taxi for at least the last stretch of the trip to the temple. While it should be only a 15 minute walk from the MRT station, there is roadwork and bad traffic that make it difficult to safely get there.
Beautiful. This Temple is impressive and the state is beautiful, but it was the least impressive of the various places we did visit, which is why I don't score it higher.Well worth a visit.

Tranquil and great views. You can get to this temple by longtail canal boat (not the main river) it is the way the locals commute to work and cost 20baht. The temple is set on various floors so not good for those with mobility problems as the stairs are steep. The view from the top is incredible and the reclining buddha stunning.
A nice big Buddah worth seeing . When went there it happened to be a ceremony with a lot of noise and people, but the place is worth seeing for 20 minutes of your time. Nice temple too
Golden Buddha. A hot spot for foreign tourist as well as locals who visit the temple with lot of devotion and faith. We enjoyed are visit to the temple.

Splendor of the past. Well worth visiting because of its history and all the golden Buddhas, the biggest one 5.5 tons and almost ten feet. Don't forget to look up to the colorful ceiling and admire it's detailed work. Unless you like to walk barefoot bring socks. No shoes are allowed in the temple

Go see the Golden Buddha. No trip to Bangkok is worth it without a visit to this temple. It is full of gorgeous golden Buddhas and every room has amazing art work depicting battles and gods.
Go with an open mind and you may feel spiritual. Otherwise, you'll end up stabbing one of the 5 million tourists.

A little more peaceful than some of the others. Visited February 2013. Another buddha temple, this time containing a gold buddha. A little less busy than the many other temples.
Like most of the other major temples in Bangkok, worth a look if you're in the area but not one of the seven wonders.
Visited February 2013.

What a treat - a real gold Buddha. Initially traveling about Bangkok visiting temples you get the wrong idea that all the statues were made of gold and you begin to wonder about the incredible wealth on display. Eventually, you pay attention to the guide's presentation and then understand what gold leaf is and it all begins to make sense. Well if you want a real treat, you must visit Wat Traimit for a view of a really impressive gold Buddha. There are lots of steps to negotiate but the hike is well worth it. You have to be mindful of the people praying in front of the Buddha and do not stand in front of them. You can get great photos from either side of the Buddha. The Buddha was originally encased in plaster and in 1955, after dropping the Buddha it was discovered that some parts were made of solid gold and others sections 40% gold. It was a delight to visit the temple. There were plenty of Tutus outside so you can get to your next temple easily. Visiting Wat Traimit is a must see.

a silent worship place. We went there as one of my friends wanted to see the golden Buddha. It's on the forth floor of the temple with a room full of people praying to Buddha and monks enchanting the prayers. it was a nice place to sit and relax.
Must to visit. We two persons visited Golden Buddha in July. This is must to see site for all who are in Bangkok. It is really impressive site. Highly recommend to visit this beautiful place for all!

Very Impressive. Interesting history of this Buddha image. Well worth the visit. The temple itself is interesting to see. The Buddha is huge measuring 12 feet 5 inches in diameter and has a height of 12 feet 9 inches from the base to the crown and it weighs approximately 5.5 tons with the price value of 28.5 million pounds and is over 700 years old. This is a valuable treasure of Thailand and of Buddhism.

Absolutely mesmerising !! . After visiting all the other Buddha temples, we were thinking of giving this a miss but luckily we did not.This temple has a huge Buddha idol made of real gold, weighing 5.5 tonnes, worlds largest solid gold statue.

Very Impressive, with a Great Story. We were glad we decided to see the Golden Buddha. This spectacular and impressive artifact is made even more interesting with the incredible story behind it! Well worth the visit.After viewing the Golden Buddha, try taking a walk through nearby Chinatown.

Put this into your itinerary. The story alone will fascinate you. This statue was once covered and hidden, only to be revealed that it was made of gold by accident. The place was very small, quiet, and not a tourist trap in my opinion. In fact when I was there I saw locals visiting to pray or meditate. We were one of the few tourists there at that time (it was early). Other Buddha statues and temples are more crowded and "touristy". You are not supposed to put your back to the statue so you have to walk out by stepping back. Not supposed to take picture with the statue as your background. PLEASE RESPECT THIS.

You Gotta Go. Can't count how many images of the Buddha I saw during a month-long visit to Indochina. This one made me cry. Yes, it's 5-½ tons of solid gold, was covered in plaster, had to be moved from another location. All of which is impressive. But, there's something very moving about this particular Buddha image. Definitely worth as visit.

Serene and nice. We had been to a lot of temples and seen many statues the same day before visiting this one. It was impressive with a calm and serene atmosphere around it. The temple wasn't as crowded as some others so you could actually meditate a little here.

Read the history!!. We decided to have a look before knowing much about this Buddha, but once we did 10 minutes of reading we KNEW we had to stop by. Unknown origin?!Worlds largest solid gold statue?!?!Covered in Stucco 'at some point' and only revealed to be made of gold after it was dropped in the 1950's?!?!?!Come. On!!!!Very cool and not nearly as crowded as Wat Pho or The Grand Palace. Also- if you walk, be warned that it is not terribly easy to find. If you are going to Chinatown already, there is no reason to skip this (unless you hate Buddha's).
Amazing. No trip to Thailand would be complete without checking out this amazing venue and it was right on our doorstep

great. we visited last day and we all agree this looks great!If you are here is a must to go there and visit.Make sure you have covered well otherwise the will ask you to take a rug in you before entering especially for ladies:)
Golden Buddha. If you have never seen gold in large quantities, this is it. Five and a half tons of it. It is impressive. Lot of people go there for prayers.
MUST GO!. The Golden Buddha placed in this temple is really big and beutifull but this is not a place you will stay for a long time (20-30 minutes visti maybe).

Beautiful Buddha!!. The Temple and Buddha are one of the amazing things people should see. It is amazing to see such passion in the people when talking and touring around this and other temples. It also is strange to see such immense wealth trapped in a buddha form, when there is such poverty in the city it is in. I understand the historical and cultural significance of this Buddha, and how important it is to them.It is a must see!

Very nice buddha and setting. It was our first afternoon in Bangkok. My husband paid for our tickets to the complex and was short-changed! There was a line behind us so we just let it go. It was the first of many times people attempted to short-change us or tried to avoid giving change back--especially by the taxi drivers-- but at a temple? That ticket seller is going to have some bad karma!!! The temple was quite nice and the buddha was beautiful. It was a little confusing getting around so you may have to ask for directions.

Wow. The golden Buddha was my favorite 5.5 tons of pure golden beauty. Our ticket only allowed us to see that particular temple. But there are two others. Ladies must cover shoulders and knees and no shoes in any temple. Get a good pedicure before hand.

the most impressive Budha. The temple and the statue were built in 13-th century.Budha statue is built by around 5 tones of gold and has 3 m height. It's impressive, especially as compared to the simplicity of the rest of the temple.

One of my favourites in Asia. this is on the top of my list for a favourite temple in Asia. It has such a great story. It weighs 5 tons and is solid gold. However, the gold was not discovered until 1955. It had been plastered over to ensure it wasn't stolen. Check it out but go in the morning when there are less people. You need to remove your shoes when going in all temples so wear something easy.

An Amazing Sculpture.. Like most temples in Thailand this temple too is very beautiful. Words cannot express the beauty of the Golden Buddha Statue. You have to see it to really appreciate it. Well worth a visit even if you are not a Buddhist.Be Appropriately dressed as a mark of respect to Buddhism.Also be conscious of confident tricksters & pickpockets although this is a temple. As most times the place can be very crowded.

Don't forget to visit the museum. The museum shows you how the Buddah was concealed in plaster and when it was being lifted to the pedestal the rope broke and the Buddah fell hard . At that moment the plaster fell off revealing the Golden Buddah..They alaso found that it could be disassembled into 9 pieces with a key.It's nearly 10 feet tall and weighs 5.5 tonnes and is 18 carat gold. The body of the statue is 40% pure, the volume from chin to forehead is 80% pure and the hair and topknot weighing 45kgs are 99% pure gold.The Buddah is an amazing site - don't forget to visit the museum for an insight to the history.
A lot of bling. Nice temple located in the eastern part of Chinatown and rather easy to find. Amazing Buddha that is solid gold and weighing in at 5.5 tons. Awesome and definitely worth a look.

One of the best Temples!. Visited the temple during a walk of Chinatown. Spent about an hour at the site since they have a great exhibit below that provides some great information about the Chinese migration and impact on Bangkok over the last few centuries, so this isn't just a typical temple to do a quick touch & go. The displays along with video provided a great historical context. It then went into how the Golden Buddha was concealed...then rediscovered as it was being moved. The minimal cost to visit this site is well worth it. And to get pictures of the actual Buddha were amazing. Well worth the time should you happen to be in the local area. Loved every minute...and got some great pictures.

Nice Temple. Vet nice temple yes it is really Temple of the Golden Buddha (Wat Traimit) . Marvlous god bhuddha statue was their in. I really like it to visit their. A must visit palce in bangkok thailand.

Great tale of the Golen Buddha and the best single Wat. Now he has moved to his new home,the 5.5 tonne Golden Buddha is the most expensive solid gold object in the world.Take a taxi and get here for 9.00 as it is a small place and avoid the crowds.Make sure to take a photo from the back as well as the front as the Buddha is fantastic.Chinatown is here so it is worth a drink or street food stop.
Cool visit to do with a walk in Chinatown. Be ready to queue and share space with people visiting, praying.. Strongly recommend to go there early morning in order to avoid crowds.
Positive. On the visit to see the golden bhudda you can easily run out of superlative's to describe just how beautiful it is when you consider when it was made.
Amazing Place. A good place to visit, the 'Gold' (plated) Buddha was paid for by the Chinese, all in all a very interesting and peaceful place - even in the rain!

Amazing... 5 and a half tonne Golden Buddha. The Temple of the Golden Buddha features a 'huge' Golden Buddha, just as its name suggests. The architecture and atmosphere are amazing. In addition, the fee to enter is hardly anything. There is also a museum at the Temple of the Golden Buddha.I highly recommend visiting the Temple of the Golden Buddha, which is located near to the main railway station.
A site worth seeing. This Wat and the Grand Palace are essential places to visit in Bangkok - the guides, both personal and written were very good.

A Must See in Thailand. A Solid Gold Buddha. Tickets and and English guide are provided. Photos are permitted. Shoes must be removed to visit inside the Temple. Dress code not strictly enforced like the grand palace. Sturdy slip on shoes recommended. Well worth a hour or so of your time.
Good. you need to know the history behind this Wat. The ticket counter will hand over a small leaflet in English with some facts about this Wat. Good place to visit if in Bangkok
Interesting Temple. Biggest golden Buddha in the world - quite interesting to see. Watch out for a couple of shaky handrails going up the steps - don't rely on them to hold onto!

Interesting to see. The 32 meters high image of Buddha is located in Wat Intharawihan, a small temple close to Dusit. At the beginning I thought it was fully made of gold but later I found out it was made of bricks and stucco and finally the golden finish had been applied. There is a supporting structure behind the statue with stairs which can be used to climb up and take a look from over His shoulder. At the time when we visited going up the stairs was not allowed.Spare some time for the temple itself as well. It's interesting.

Beautiful views at the tower!. We went to Yaowarat on Chinese New Year 2015. We took the underground train (MRT) to the main train station (Hua Lamphong). We walked to Yaowarat in 20 minutes. We visited Wat Traimit at 5 PM. The weather was nice. The Golden Buddha was beautiful. The views at the top was excellent. The bathrooms were clean and free. We had a dinner at a Chinese restaurant in Yaowarat.

Incredible !. The entire complex is spectacular !When you take off your shoes and enter and see the golden buddha, you will be transported to to a spiritual realm. This artifact is incredible and a must see !

Over run, be prepared for a long hot walk.. One of the most fantastic building in the world. It is totally over run with thousands of Chinese Toirists in Crocodiles, following a yelling guide. I have limited mobility and need crutches. Once inside a one way system, very long for me and in constant danger of being knocked over by seemingly blind Chinese. However it is a must see once site.

Beautiful. It's amazing to see a hundreds of years old statue made of gold.. still shining.. and Buddha is as always is calm.. can spend some time to pause and add calm to life.. the temple has too many commercial shops close by (I would love to have more space around it for peacefulness and less noise)

Must Visit. This one of the to do things in Bangkok. Gorgeous.
5.5 tons, the largest gold statue in the world and one of the amazing temple of Bangkok. Do not miss out.

Not a must. Quite touristic. New building and IMO not worth visiting unless you have plenty of time in Bangkok. The ticket cover just climbing to the floor where the Golden Buddha is. For the exipition you must pay separate.
Big Buddha. A very tall Golden Buddha not far from KSR. Impressive size and nice displays around the courtyard. They do except donations. Worth a look.

Great visit at the Golden Buddha. A recommendable place for all tourist the visit Bangkok.
Don't miss it.
Personally I go already different times with customers. And all are enthusiastic.

In awe. This was one of my favourite wats we visited in Bangkok. I think we sat for about 40 minutes in front of this golden Buddha just in complete awe of it. It was only 40 baht to get in and it was worth it 100%! Make sure you get out to this one.

Yet more Temples!. We visited as part of a walk around Chinatown and the surrounding area, well worth a visit just to gaze at the solid gold Buddha! You only need an hour to visit and take photos, don't forget when visiting any Temple in Bangkok to dress appropriately.
So beautiful. The golden buddha is so shirring and charm. The monks keep it very well. The MRT or BTS could not reach the temple, you need to hire a taxi or tuktuk to go there.

Beautiful White Temple in Chinatown Area. Clean, beautiful temple near Hua Lamphong railway station in the Chinatown area... Make sure to have the banana pancakes sold by a Burmese young man near the gate of the temple :)

Amazing Buddha but everything else rather average. As temples go in South East Asia this ranks as one of the average ones but you have to visit it to the the impressive Golden Buddha. On purchasing my ticket I was offered the choice of 40 baht to see just the Golden Buddha or the 140 baht ticket which included the exhibitions. I plumped for the latter. I thought the exhibition on the 3rd floor explaining the origins of the Buddha image and how the Golden Buddha was made was very small and I did not take long going round as was slightly disappointed. Next floor down was the Chinatown Heritage Exhibition which was a lot larger and for me a lot more interesting with a large model layout of Bangkok in the past. The best part by a long way was the Golden Buddha gleaming in the mid afternoon light with monks in orange robes sat down in prayer in front. That was well worth the 40 baht but I am afraid 100 baht was too expensive for what there was to see in the exhibitions. It is easy to find from Hua Lamphong Station as there is a signed walkway near to the western exit.

This Buddha is pure gold - literally. This was the first temple I visited in Bangkok and it is a little bit away from the centre of this vast city. When I was there large numbers of Buddhist monks were there paying their respects. Although tourists obviously come here it is quieter than the other temples and the visitor is able to spend more time taking in the architecture and the reverence of the place. The Buddha is made of pure gold and weighs about 5.5 tonnes. He is amazing!

5.5 Tons of Gold and Devotion show faith in Thailand. Bangkok offers food, culture, art and The Temple of The Golden Buddha. There is an awe that comes over you as you stand below the Buddha, glimmering and shining and the amount of people that come to worship in The Temple is staggering. Upon walking up the stairs to the Temple a flock of vendors and photographers start flashing their cameras and it makes you feel like a celebrity. Upon exiting the Temple a barrage of souvenirs of the Temple with your picture on it become an irresistible purchase and we have a refrigerator covered with artifacts to prove it. The fast paced city is offset by the serene feeling of God's beauty in the gentle nature of the people and the meaning of life as a world wide travel blogger takes shape once again in a continuous metamorphosis.
Huge buddha. I think this is the one that's inside, and it's amazing and huge. Lot's of local Thai's doing there daily worship.

Excellent Monument. A magnificent monument and has a great view of the complex around it. The temple still has certain areas under construction/renovation, so it can be a bit disappointing for photographers looking for that best shot!

Great Temple with Golden Buddha. Was walking around Chinatown when we chanced upon this temple. It was a magnificent temple with a big Golden Buddha inside. Near to the Hua Lamphong MRT station. Should not miss this temple if you are at Chinatown.

Place to visit within city tour. This is the Golden Buddha Temple which you can see while doing city tour... You can go by BTS or MRT trains also to see it. tuk tuk auto rickshaw is available.. There was a old bell at the right side of main upper entrance . I liked it . Blease go by wearing full sleeve shirt and full pant. Mainly your leg shouldn't be seen. U will get wrappers also to buy if you go on shorts.

Amazing small temple with a golden Buddha. This was the first temple we visited in Bangkok and we were very impressed although it is quite small compared to other temples in the city.You can combine your visit to this temple with a tour in Chinatown. It is located close to Hua Lamphong Rail Station. It is unbelievable to know that this statue of Buddha was made of solid gold, weighing 5.5 tons!? And furthermore, the fact, it is golden, was revealed accidentally as it was originally covered by stucco and plaster!?There is also a community museum (Saphanthawong Museum), located in the same building, exhibiting facts about the life of the first Chinese immigrants in Bangkok. It is interesting and costs only 10 baht.Just remember to be properly dressed for a temple when you go to Wat Traimit. Normally there are cloths which you can borrow and cover yourself if you are not wearing proper clothes.

Good stopping point. We had wandered through Chinatown on our way to see the Golden Buddha. It was worth the walk. Visiting the museum under the temple gave an insight in to how Chinatown happened and some of the history of the area.

Amazing sight!. A beautiful temple with the golden Buddha, and another temple across where my partner and I got blessed by a Buddhist monk. Only down for me was that I didn't know about the covering shoulders and knees rule and I had a woman run up to me talking another language and pulling my dress down!
Hidden temple. I just happened upon this temple when walking around. Small fee to enter. There were two buildings with golden buddhas

amazing. As the largest golden buddha statue in the world, I was a originally little under whelmed when I saw this, as it is only about 3m (10ft) tall. However it is SOLID gold and weighs around 5.5 tons !!Very beautiful statue and building surroundings, as well as other displays about it's history and how it's glory was hidden beneath a coat of plaster of over 200 years!
Nice to see. This was a little treat near our hotel. I don't know that I would travel across town, but it was very close to us. Nice to see.

Located in a busy area, within close proximity of Chinatown.. We visited as part of a City Tour organised by our Tour Operator & to be honest we wouldn't have visited otherwise, probably with it not being as well known as some of the others. Saying that we're glad we did.The Temple is located in a bustling area, within close proximity to Chinatown. There are many steps leading up to the entrance which could make it difficult for those less mobile. We were there early afternoon & it was hot, especially walking up, however it was cool once inside.The area inside is not terribly large as the imposing Golden Buddha takes up a lot of the space & at the time that we visited, there was also some scaffolding in place behind the Buddha. We didn't stay long as we were on the tour, however I don't really think you'd want to spend as much time here as at one of the other Temples. If we hadn't been on a tour, we would have paid a visit to nearby Chinatown.

Amazing Sculpture.. A beautiful & enormous statue of The Buddha made in gold. Its just amazing & so very beautiful. A must see in Thailand.Also be aware of Pickpockets & conmen although its a temple. Specially when its crowded or even otherwise.Be appropriately dressed as a mark of respect to Buddhism.Well worth a visit.

Awe inspiring Golden Buddha at Wat Traimit. Thrilled to see that the Golden Buddha has now been relocated into a purpose build Wat. For us, this is one of the must see places in Bangkok easy to combine with a trip to Chinatown.
It is for real!. We're talking solid gold worth billions of USD. You just have to go see the Golden Buddha or your trip to Bangkok has been a waste of time.

Good experience and Golden Buddha is amazing!. Situated within a stone's throw from Hua Lamphong MRT station and the very first sight to visit on the way to Chinatown. THe entrance fee of 40 baht per pax allows you to view the Golden Buddha up close and personal. We bought the monk's robe and flower garland for 100 baht to pay our offerings to the budhha. There's some sort of a ritual chant that is available for believers to take from the altar and chant to it but unfortunately all in Thai. No footwear inside the temple however and ladies need to wear knee length skirt/trousers else you will need to rent a robe to go in. For guys no headwear allowed inside the temple. We ventured to the adjacent temple which houses another buddha and was fortunate enough to receive a string bracelet from a monk who were doing some offerings to visitors inside. So advisable to also explore the other temple, its free anyways. Good for spending some time before lunch and heading down to Chinatown.

Convenient..... To say that this temple is well placed is an understatement. In order to get from the Hua Lamphong train/MRT station to Chinatown (Sampeng Lane), you have to go right by this temple and it really is a must. The temple itself is quite small, but the Buddha statue is spectacular. Please be respectful of those praying and just take a seat (feet AWAY from the statue) to contemplate how serene it is. Next door there is a museum, though I have never been....

good trip. we did this as part of a day tour. very interesting, there were lots of steps and it was very busy and hot. People trying to sell souvenirs outside was a pain but did not cause a problem.worth a visit.

Sukhothai Traimit. Must visit in Bangkok. A spiritual heritage of Kingdom of Thailand. The golden buddha idol is considered national treasure of Thailand. 5.5 tons is the weight of the idol !!! Visit to the museum is also a worth .

Peaceful. Beutifully maintained temple.
We found it very much Peaceful. We visited with MMT representative. She had good knowledge
Beautiful. There are so many Wats to choose from its difficult but this one is so worth a visit. Remember to show respect tho'
A good place to visit. another must see temple in Bangkok. we manage to visit this and the grand palace as well as the reclining Buddha.

Wow.... Golden Buddha - is the world's largest solid gold statue, with a weight of 5.5 tons (5,500 kilograms). It is located in the temple of Wat Traimit. Amazing Statue and a peaceful place to spend some quite time.

Beautiful. If you don't think 5.5 tons of 18k gold can have a beautiful shine, then maybe the spirit of Buddha that comes from such a huge temple will seem beautiful. Either way, this is a good place to visit if you want to see exceptional local heritage and an unusual spiritual site in the middle of thriving Bangkok. Admission is 40 Baht. This doesn't include the mid-level Exhibition area, but only the upper level shrine. There are very limited grounds to walk, very limited. It is in the middle of busy streets. Also note that there are numerous stairs to climb if you want to see the Buddha. This takes less than an hour to visit, but -- depending on where your hotel is located and time of day -- traffic to the Temple may take longer than an hour. (Remember to wear sandals or other easy-to-remove shoes if you have them. Temples are great for barefoot monks.) Try it.

All that glitters is indeed gold. Wat Traimit is definitely in the Top 5 of "must sees" in Bangkok. The temple building itself is a stunner, with its dramatically soaring golden spire atop gleaming white marble. You will never forget the first time you lay eyes upon the Golden Buddha ... His glittering golden sublime serenity will simply take your breath away. A true highlight of any visit to Bangkok!Standing quietly at the back to watch the Thai people pay reverential homage to the Golden Buddha adds to the overall magical atmosphere.Very easy to get to ... just take Bangkok MRT Metro to Hua Lamphong Station and have your bearings and a good map for the easy 5 min walk to Wat Traimit.

If you're in Chinatown you can see this temple. It's in Chinatown so if you're there hop in and see the golden Buddha it's a small temple that can be seen in 20-30 min tops, there's a little souvenir shop on the site.

That's a lot of gold. Impressive statue made of solid gold. Not as busy as other temples and the dress code is not as restrictive, we all entered with shorts and t-shirts on. Doesn't take much time to look around the temple area.
Must see. The Temple of the Golden Buddha (Wat Traimit) is a must see temple in Bangkok. Located in the city near Chinatown, it houses a huge golden statue of Buddha. Worth visiting.
Amazing. The biggest piece of solid gold that you will ever see in your life. A beautiful artistic creation with an astounding history.

Stunning Buddha in Gold. One of the must visit touristy places of BKK, the temple houses a beautiful Gold Buddha. If you are looking at doing the touristy things, a visit to this temple is a must.
For women, wear something that covers' your shoulders and full pants, or else you'll have to pay 20 bhat extra for the sarongs.

Impressive!. Though it isn't as famous as the other temples, the golden buddha statue is quite impressive. The temple itself eludes a very calming feeling and is worth visiting.
Quite close to Chinatown which is also quite famous.

Fascinating. This was my favourite of all the temples we visited in Bangkok. It has an interesting history which our well informed guide was able to tell us all about - the Buddha was 800 years old but ahd not always been on that site, it was moved around several times and had to be taken to pieces to be moved.

Enormous golden statue leaves you breathless. We were first shown the temple during a night walk around Chinatown, and came back to take pictures of the golden Buddha statue. I was not prepared for the enormity of it, it is utterly amazing, better than the grand palace or emerald Buddha statue.

Average Attraction. Miss this only if you are short on time and cant decide whether it is the Reclining Buddha or the Golden. We were short on time and yet decided to check this temple out. I found it quite commercial and lacked the spirituality and splendour of the Temple of the Reclining Buddha. The Gold Statue is no doubt a sight but sadly it is also the only sight worth seeing. Would rate it average.

Gold splendour. A very different temple to visit in Bangkok.The temple itself looks like a white mountain with lots of steps but is well worth a visit to see the Golden Buddha marvel. An interesting story about its discovery so allow time for visiting the exhibition. There was some refurbishment taking place when we visited (Jan 2015) so had to walk around scaffolding in some places. Bring some socks because stones on the top of the temple can be very hot to walk on! This temple is within a short walking distance to the China Town, if exploring town on foot.

Just didn't do much for us. This was the first Wat that my family and I visited in Bangkok. We just didn't get much out of the experience. We recently went to Wat Pho and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. It is truly amazing and has so much more to see. Unless, you have a deep desire to see the largest solid gold Buddha, we recommend you spend your time at a different Wat.

Do not miss Golden Buddha. Just beautiful and read about the history of this statue to better understand what you are looking at. Near Chinatown so you can walk over for a great lunch or shop. Very impressive Wat.
Lovely temple. One of the nicest temples in bkk ,it's a must see ,have been there a couple of times ,must go temple

Temple. Visited this temple of Buddha in Bangkok abut two years back. It was a marvelous piece of work and the feeling you get in there is remarkable. Although our religion may be different but you get a special feeling when visit a temple of Buddha. Bangkok is full of Buddha temples. The most famous being the reclining Buddha, where Buddha is in the lying position and about 65 feet long with gold.

The Golden Buddha. Being a major attraction it can be very busy here but even so it is more than worth the visit. The Buddha is an unforgettable sight, transport to and from the site can be difficult as there is no major Skytrain station for some distance but Bangkok taxis are by and large good value for money

one of the things to visit when in Bangkok. This one also blew me away. Pure Gold Buddha in one of the very nice temple in the city of Bangkok. it has so much tourists but this sight is very nice to see and cheap entrance.
Good Place. The 45 Ft budha statue is good to see. The place is very peace full and easily accessible. this place is worth to make a visit atleast once in every trip.
Gold!. Good temple. It was amazing to see such a big Buddha in pure gold! Even though the temple was crowded when we were there, we still get to have a good look around.
Great history. Not just for touristsbut a key site for locals. Murals tell the story of Thai massage techniques handed down over centuries.

Calmness to the mind. I thing Wat Traimit was my favourite. The temple is beautiful and even though we were there on a public holiday and there were hundreds of locals who also flooded in to pay their respects, make offerings and pray, seeing this beautiful Buddha actually restored some calmness to my mind after a busy day sightseeing in Bangkok.
Nice but nothing special. With all the Buddas temple to watch this is not the most "uau". It is huge, but we take around 15 min on the temple.

Insane!!. Being able to see the worlds largest seated solid gold Buddha. Measuring nearly five metres in height and weighing five and half tons was incredible. It was nice being able to see the monks in prayer too.

Must Visit. A short walk from Main Railway Station. 40 Baht entrance fee but no one to check if you have indeed bought the tickets. A good complex. Watch other temple too in the same complex. A very cheerful fat monk at the entrace of the temple lights up your visit.

That's a lot of gold!. A pretty neat temple in the middle of town...after our visit we stopped by the flower market that supplies much of asia and around the world. It was really neat to see....Golden Buddha was neat to see, hear about the history and learn about. The crowds were just huge...every day...
Lovely surprise. I stumbled across this temple when looking for the train station and I am so glad I did. The golden buddha inside is beautiful and I would say is a must see

Must visit temple. Hi i have been to the golden temple but unfortunately that was Friday and the due to Buddha day it was close during afternoon. so we could not able to visit the temple from inside. but we took a Tuk tuk and visited near by locations. in my next visit i will ensure to visit this Golden Buddha temple.

beautiful, nice exhibition of the chinese heritage. I found this temple less tourist-y, more devout buddhist go there.
I felt there was more peace and temple-like serenity, even though there were tourists here.
Really Breath Taking. Worth a visit if your in the city, there is an entrance fee.Golden Buddha statue was worth seeing!!!
Nice temple. Nicely built temple, had to walk few steps and the ambiance was good. Golden Buddha statue was worth seeing
Beautiful.. It's a marvellous Buddha to see and I appreciated learning the history of it. Worth a visit if your in the city, there is an entrance fee.
