This monument should be visited. I recommend everyone to visit also Wat Traimit, which is located in Chinatown. It contains a golden buddha inside, which is gorgeous and made of pure gold! Another important point to me were charming colours - white &yellow(gold) - of the monument.
Very beautiful. It is located in Chinatown. Walk for 10 minutes from the nearest metro station to reach this temple. The Golden Buddha is beautiful and marvellous.

Scale and size is amazing.. Spent around two hours in here, and that included being blessed by a resident monk for longevity, happiness and prosperity.The buddah is like nothing else you'll ever see, and it is something you really have to experience in person to appreciate.If you're in Bangkok, this really is a must see monument.

Golden Buddha. This solid gold buddha was moved(covered in plaster) from the old temple in Ayuhaya and not thought to be too important. But when the plaster was removed (after the crane dropped it) it turned out to be solid gold. The temple is not as impressive as some others in Bangkok but looking at that much gold is impressive. The temple room is not very large and not too impressive but if you have time it is located in China town and china town itself is good to see.
Culture. Interesting Temple if you want a liesurely stroll and some culture all in one. Close to one on the river taxi stations so can hop off look round and jump back on.

very funny and unique. a nice building devoted to this giant buddha with one floor for a video, a floor with the history museum and a floor for the sculpure itself, furthermore it is cheap and the girls that take care of the museum are very gentle

Impressive. This one of BKK's nicest temples, located near China Town. The statue is somewhat mysterious and I have the impression it doesn't show its full capacity because it is located in a rather small temple room. Any way, you shouldn't miss this.
A real cultural experience. It shows you how many people are wanting eternal answers to get by in this life, hoping what they worship,will be real

Gorgeous. A giant buddha statue of 3.5 tons of gold !!! Thats what this temple offers which leaves u awestruck...although situated in the middle of the city, the temple and premises are neat and clean...for shoppers, traditional Thai umbrellas are a must try

Homage to the Golden Buddha. We visited Wat Traimit that houses the world's largest golden seated Buddha measuring nearly five meters in height and weighing more than five tons. Its amazing to see so many worshipers both locals and foreigners giving homage to the Golden Buddha. We noted that lotus flowers and incense are reasonably sold by vendors nearby. Although we are not Buddhist, my daughter bought some lotus flowers and lighted incense following the example of our tour guide. The Golden Buddha is a must see for visitors while in Bangkok.

Interesting place. I have never seen five and a half tons of pure gold before. Worth the visit just to see it. Lots of steps, must remove your shoes, and, like most every place else in Bangkok...crowded!!!

An absolute must see despite the crowds. This temple is a must see for any visitor and with relatively easy access despite my being dependent on a walking stick, it was worth the effort. Yes there are large crowds at times but the 24 tons of gold that makes up this statue is amazing. My daughter and I went with a personal guide and it's entertainment alone just watching the large crowds pushing through to see the attraction. Great place to see this statue and great place to watch people.
Awesome. During my last visit, some how i had missed out on this temple. This time it was in our itinerary. Worth a visit.

A quiet place for contemplation. We went there on a Sunday morning and were surprised to find ourselves almost alone. The Buddha is solid gold and whilst not huge, we were told it weighs about 5 tonnes. The temple is simple and small but unless you particularly want to see this, there are far more spectacular temples to visit before you start to think "not another temple".
A special treat in Bangkok!. Another must see while in Bangkok. The jewels with all their color and craftsmanship can only truly be appreciated in person.
ALOT OF GOLD!!!!. 24 tons of solid gold is an amazing sight. There were alot of Thai people visiting. Take off your shoes before you go inside this temple. Great place to people watch.
a must see in Thailand. make sure you go in the mid to late morning... the afternoon's can be very very hot and humid... nothing like it in the world.

gold gold gold. it's a very good temple to see in a short time , you just get amazed from this huge 5.5 tons of pure gold statue of budda, something you'll never see anywhere else in the world, just amazing to see all this gold in front of you and as usual in all Thai temples you are asked to take off your shoes before you get into the temple.

Golden surprise. This was the first temple we visited today and we were amazed to see the Golden Buddha on full display - on the 3rd level. Our experience was somewhat spoilt by pesty photographers angling to sell photo reminders of our visit.

went late....but. went there late, couldn't go up to pray to the buddha.but the temple ground is nice too.main temple is open from 8am to 5pm...as per what our guide told us, the buddha was made many yrs ago and hidden by layer of cement till an accident which broke the cement and that's how the buddha was discovered...

new building !. Wat Traimit or the temple of the Golden buddha is on the fridges of Chinatown.You can get to it by metro to the Hua LamphongTrain station then walk it or a short trip by taxi.The original building was small but the new one is massive compared to the old one.Must see if you are going to Bangkok or staying in traffic congested Chinatown

Second Must SEE. This is also a must see in Bangkok. The culture of budhismus u will see it here. Many gold (not to buy) only for your taken pics. But the history of Thailand is here. Use a taxi to go here.
visit to wat traimit. beautiful and stunning architecture in gold. a climb of about 60 steps. found it less crowded. money exchange available near the location.

Golden site. This is another place you should visit. There's a big solig gold statue of Buddha inside a beautiful temple. The day I went, the weather collaborated and created an especial aura above the roof of it. It was a magic moment.

Very touristy not much to see really. This temple is okay because gold buddha is nice to see but it's really just a big tourist sight and not as great as wat pho or the other big ones. It's okay if you're in Chinatown area anyway for a stop but otherwise not worth going out of the way for. Expect to see busloads of tourists and no monks.

Worth a lot. This statue weighs over 5 and half ton of pure gold. Work out the value of that !!Must be seen as it also has a very interesting history going back to the Thai - Burma wars of the 1,100's. ask someone to tell you or look it up on Google

Interesting background info, amazing statue. The golden Buddha sits on the top floor of a newly built temple-like structure that also houses the Chinatown heritage Centre. Interesting history of the Chinese influx and integration into Thailand over the last couple of hundred years. The Buddha himself is quite astonishing, made of gold and glistening. Cosy for both visits 140 Baht per person
Impressive. I think what strikes me the most about this one is that any people could keep a secret like that. Definitely worthy of a temple
Big and gold. The statue is spectacular. the temple it is housed in is average. Unfortunately, the literature provided is pretty scanty.
worth a look. this is a very interesting site , the grandue of the place takes your breth away, take slip on shoes.
Nice to visit. Clean and not so crowded. It was nice to see another Buddha.The temple architecture was also interesting.

Marvels of Bangkok, Thailand. Visitors to Bangkok must not miss visiting this temple of the golden Buddha.. It is located in the China Town. The statue has a unique history of over 700 years, and is revered by the local Thai people. The giant statue of the Buddha is in solid gold, 12.5 ft in diameter and 15.9 ft high, in the Mara conquering style. The whole temple complex is fascinating, and the architecture is quite stunning. Please take a guide along to better understand this fascinating place and its history. As it is a sacred place of worship, respectable clothing is required to be worn, covering arms and legs. Could spend about an hour touring the complex.
Great work of Art. It's marvelous.We were told it's 5.5 tons of solid gold! A must see place & move out. Nothing else so may good to visit on the way but nota full day visit.

Big bust. This is the spot locals who are diverting you to the shopping areas send you to first. When we told the tuk tuk driver that we wouldn't be going to the next stop he wanted (shopping), he left. Told us if we went, he would get free gas. It's big, granted. But there are vendor tents smack up against it, which makes you think this isn't the most sacred of spots. No one cared if shorts were worn. Cant get a full-length picture. Perhaps all that glitters is not gold.We got a laugh out of being wamboozzled.
Would be better if uncouth tourists knew how to behave. A fantastic temple that has been well preserved. Visit spoiled by those uncouth snap happy tourists who don't know how to behave in church.

Impressive. A gigantic statue of Buddha covered with gold. Really unique, even though quite outside of the main tourist tour. Be careful of the tok-tok that offer to take you there for very chip price. They will take you for a long detour in mediocre shopping sites! Better go with a taxi-meter

A temple you have to visit when you are in China Town. As a Buddhist country, Thailand has so many wat (temple). It is like in Myanmar which I also visited in September 2012. So, when you come to both countries, you will see so many temples and Buddha statue with various positions and sizes. Regarding this Golden Buddha, you can visit it in the Bangkok's Chinatown Samphanthawong. Don't make a mostake with another Chinatown in Yommarat. which also has a temple. The golden Buddha in Samphanthawong is claimed to have the largest gold material composition comparing to other statues in other temples around Thailand.

beautiful. Easy to find, any tuk tuk driver can take you. Peaceful place, only one temple to ho into and a huge golden Buddha which needs to be seen to believe. An east visit for those who want to see a temple but don't want to see a million temples.
Peaceful. Beautiful sight. Photographer friendly, pictures can be taken inside the temple and inside the museum as well.

All that glitters here really is GOLD. 5.5 tons of solid gold! Wow its something to see. But then again thats all there is to this, so dont have too many expectations just expect to see a big rock solid Buddha made out of pure gold. Of course the Wat is pretty too

Well kept, good museum. This wasn't my favourite temple in Bangkok although it does also house the museum about the history of china town in Bangkok. It is clean and well kept like all the temples we visited but for me there wasn't enough information in English about what we were looking at and it's significance.
Do visit. Good place to visit.If you are so inclined peaceful time can be spent there.Can get there with any transport

Nice to see.... Was nice to see, good explanations about history and believe. Entry to the museum was definitely worth it, outside you are being bothered by many vendors that are quite aggressive in selling you their stuff. Most of it is even crap like, buttons with a stolen shot of yourself and most of the shots look horrible.

Golden Buddha. Interesting to see. Lovely architecture. A handy location and not too crowded. Worth a visit. Take a Tuk Tuk to get around. 40 Bart a bargain but they will bring you past shops to buy stuff - can't blame them as if they get you into 3 shops they get 6 L petrol for free. Good luck to them!

Stunning. Absoulutely stunning
And i bet it's worth sfew bob as it is made from solid Gold
well worth the trip to see this statue.
definately one to see. you will be amazed at all the temples, just dont get caught by the Tuk Tuk drivers saying it is closed and offering you a trip, usually to their familys business

Real and biggest golden Buddha. New temple building finish few years ago and golden buddha located on top floor with nice painting wall.
The floor in the middle has showed history of area and temple.

Pure Solid Gold!. This temple was stunning, the Buddha here is made of pure gold. You are free to take pictures inside the temple but be respectful if people are praying etc. quite small compared to some of the others but still worth visiting. Watch out for the guy outside selling badges of the temple.....he takes a pic of you on the way in and super imposes it onto a background of the temple and tries to sell it to you on the way out. He starts by asking for 300baht, I couldn't resist but managed to talk him down to 100baht.
Must see. We visited a few Buddha whilst we were in Bangkok and we thought that this was the most impressive, it takes your breath away, wonderful.
Truly beautiful. Plan to spend at least an hour to walk around and people watch, don't miss this attraction. charge those camera batteries, you will be a true shutter bug.

magnificent !. Pure golden Buddha Statue is one of the best in the World..Do not miss...Do not worry whether you are Buddhism or not...They welcome you all...Location is not good because the road is narrow, big bus hardly pass through otherwise It great place to experience and worship.

Worth a Visit. The China Heritage Exhibition is quite interesting. I believe there is an entry fee for foreign visitors. You can easily get a taxi from near Hualamphong Station or even walk, depending on the temperature.
WOW. 5 1/2 tons of solid gold, discovered when the ceramic coating chipped. What a discovery, need I say more?
Go and see this temple. Very good and nice maintaining place, golden Buddha very impressive. One of he things must visit in Bangkok.

Wow!. I can't say anything about this place..
The Golden Buddha is GREAT! It's wonderful..
You must visit there if you wanna travel to Thailand

Average. Not that interesting place,
All you see is Bhuda golden statue
Nothing else to see over there
It ll take you some time to reach this place for it s open during the day and there s always a traffic jam
Pretty. Wat Traimit is well kept and quite pretty but maybe lacks a bit of a "WOW factor". Nonetheless, if you like temples you will be pleased to visit Wat Traimit.
This is a Beautiful Temple. This is one of my favourite Temples in Bangkok, I always visit it as part of my 9 Temple ritual, on birthdays and special ocassions.
Beautiful!. In this temple we received blessings from the Monk with holy water. it was a wonderful experience to live
ok. If you are in the area, go have a look, otherwise don't need to make special arrangement to visit The Temple of the Golden Buddha as it is not as special as some other temples in Bangkok.

Wonderful. It takes your breath away. Very well maintained. Tourists are expected to remove their footwear and wear appropriate clothing (no shorts or short skirts). Devotees and others are equally respectful and the whole vicinity is clean and well organized. Parking is limited but that is to be expected.

Only saw the golden Buddha (not the exhibition). 40 baths per person for the Buddha visit only, 100 for Buddha + exhibition.
I really liked the walls decoration inside, the temple is in a very good condition with beautifully decorated doors and windows with a big golden Buddha in the middle of the room. You also have a nice view on Bangkok.
Golden Buddha. This was ok but once you have seen one Buddha I feel that is enough nice experience thou. Tut tut driver waited for us cost 40 baht to go and look

an historical temple. the golden buddha temple is a classic example of the thai architecture. and has story in its background. but its quite small when compared to wat pho or the grand palace. take a look if u have the time and patience.
Chinatown Highlight. This is a lovely, well cared for temple in Chinatown and has a great story attached to it. The buddha is something to see before you really get into your Chinatown stroll.
Nice temple. A nice temple with a statue of Buddha made of gold. The looks of the temple is a typical example of age-pld thai architecture.
ok. after a few temple visits, got over my fascination of temples...so it wasn't a special visit for me.

Not the best temple in Bangkok. Nothing wrong with it really but it is not as good as Grand Palace or Wat Pho. I think you are staying in Bangkok for long time and really into temples you should go, otherwise this is one you can miss out. It is ok but not great.

Uninspiring. A reasonable pretty building but nothing particularly stands out compared to all the other temples in Thailand. Also, it feels over commercialised / over-touristy, not just because of the presence of tourists but more because it seems to be set up for the tourists, not the worshippers.

Nice Buddha & temple, with interesting small exhibition. It's a nice-enough temple, with an impressive Buddha, but the mini museum & exhibition will fill you in on the historical significance of the statue.
Also, it's interesting to learn how these types of statues were made in previous eras.
Also a great place to start your exploration of Chinatown, but get there early to avoid the crowds.
Majestic temple. sadly we were given only 20 minutes to explore this place. Golden Buddha statue looks majestic and so is the art work around it.

Peacefully and a nice temple.. It's a very beautiful temple. Silent, calm, peaceful and looks nice as well. The Buddha is made out of solid gold... A lot of gold as its a huge statue. Definitely worth the trip.

keep low in your priority list. There is nothing wrong in this place.... but if you are not a faithful ( than other considerations will apply) this is just another thick in the box of your list of "obligatory" BKK temples... if you need to choose, this is probably the one to skip
A nice and beautiful temple.. Architectures have done a great job to make it look so beautiful, and attractive. Silent and very calm place to sit and have a word with God in peace.

Nice to see. We visited here via Tuk Tuk, was good to see. The Golden Buddha was huge and definitely worth a look. The surroundings were interesting, especially the "burial" wall.
Big hint would be not to use the toilets here unless you absolutely have to. They don't smell the best, so would suggest holding on if you are able!
one more tempale. their is many many tempal like this so pl asked some tour opretor which r the best other wise ur. toure time will over but tempal will not over

Beautiful if from a distance.. Unfortunately the temple was Closed to visitors when we visited as it was the day before the Queens birthday and they were having a ceremony inside. We were able to look thought he doorway and it looked amazing.

Nice Buddha, watch your shoes. Visited during Chinese new year. Although the temple itself is not that impressive, the Buddha is one of the few bigger gold ones. I recommend to take a bag for your shoes: mine got stolen. Luckly enough a monk offered me his flip flops.
Nice, but. A nice temple, but if you are coming from the Grand palace and the temples there, it is a bit disppointing. Observe the closing itme of 5:00 p.m.

Golden Buddha. Got to see it to believe it. Try and imagine 5,500 kgs. ( Yes I repeat five thousand and five hundred kilos ) of solid gold! WOW! Yes , it is made from 5,500 kgs of gold. It was previously in the previous capital of Thailand and covered in cement so that the enemies would not take it away. When it was being shifted, the crane, broke and the monks saw the gold inside. The broken piece of cement/plaster of paris is kept next to the statue.

golden buddha. As per the guide this statue of buddha is made from 93% of gold.outside you have a mueseumAlso you can get blessings from the buddhist monks.You can see 7 buddha for a week starting (Sun-Sat)
Massive pure gold statue!!!. The largest pure gold statue of Buddha in the world. The history is fascinating. A true national treasure open for all to see.
waste of time. I found this excursion very boring, 'nothing remarkable about this trip and I would recommend passing on it and instead do something more active.

Nice attraction, ventral location. The temple it self is relatively new, but the history of the Bhudda inside is interesting. The temple complex is nice, clean and seems well organized. It is a place well worth visiting. Before entering the temple shoes must be placed on a rack, as no shoes are allowed inside the temple. Pictures can be taken inside.

beautiful. it is so good to see the respect that the thai people give to their heritage, the monks, their history & their King. the amount of money that all the temples have inside them with gold & precious jewels & nobody robs them just proves that maybe all of us need to rethink

One of the great landmarks to see in Bangkok.. This is a landmark well worth seeing. The is a life sized statue that is made of solid gold. When I was there it was very busy and while I enjoyed the visit and did not feel the need to be there very long, this is parlty due to it being a smaller temple, but also I just found some other locations held my interest longer. So I think a quick visit will suffice and the saved time is well served at other locations that you should visit in Bangkok.
So impressive!. Such a huge buddha. So impressive. What a pity these attractions are so massively attended. You're nearly 50% of the time worrying about the people around you.
Wat Traimit. this has a buddha that weighs 5.5kg of gold. we were allowed to photo this buddha also. had other small temples around also.

Nice place to start your day. Close to the MTR station. A good place to start your day early. Make sure to get there before 5pm. A small temple compared to the others this is a quick stop. But very spectacular temple and the golden statue of the Buddha is very good.
Fantastic!. Well organised, beautifully maintained and definitely worth a visit. Remember to take a bag to put your shoes in while you walk round.

Fantastic. what can you say that hasnt been said already, fantastic,done all the prayer in the Temple and the buddest monks are so obliging, its unreal the buddha is brilliant, and so calming we are ages 62/66 yrs of age and found it so calming (must be getting old)

Great Pictures !!. You will walk up several steps so come with comfy shoes. Once on top, you will take off your shoes and leave them on rack. Keep in mind there is a possibility of your shoes missing once you are out of the temple. Keep them inside your purse or backpack. Also, the crowd arrives around 8:30 am or so. It then becomes difficulty to take good pictures without tourist in the backgournd.

One of the magic temples of Bangkok. When in Bangkok, you cannot skip visiting the Golden Buddha Temple. It is not as impressive as the major ones (The Emerald or the Reclining Buddha Temples), but is has a strong tradition and also attracts crowds of tourists from all over the world. Wake up early and enjoy the Golden Buddha blessings.
Awesome place. A beautiful place to take pics and to get awed with the architectural wonder in BKK. Located quite convenient in BKK.

A PLACE TO VISIT WHILE SIGHTSEEING. AS other people have said it is a climb to the top I did find it hard,But my daughter and son in law
had no problem,I would say as your visiting temples you should see this one BUT you need to be fit to climb the steps as there is no other way up

Just Another Temple!. Se have visited so many temples in Thailand they are all starting to look the same. If you like temples etc then do go visit but after walking around for 10 mins it's a bit boring. We wouldn't visit again because we are all templed out but it's worth a visit as not many people will get another chance to visit Bangkok. You only live once.

Not much to see except for the Golden Buddha. This temple is in the middle of the city, you climb up some stairs and enter a chamber with the golden Buddha. Yes it looks amazing but there isn't much to see apart from the Buddha.

A must-visit temple in the heart off BKK.... First time here I was blown away by the scale of the place - it's very close to the royal palace, Wat Po & Ramchad artery towards the Chinatown side of town... I was here in low season - pay your respects & reflect a little - light an incense stick to your loved ones, as I did... ;)

Only Gold Buddha. The whole building is new building but is very striking on the golden roof. For old people, , just walk toward the back and lift is available to reach the highest level where the Buddha Hall is.

Probably the nicest and easiest to visit. A bit pricey to see a golden statue, with a lot of significance to the Thai people though. It was not too crowded and easy access. There are many smaller temples that imitate this one, so look for the real one, size tells all. It is a large one and made of real gold.

All that glitters here is gold. the intricate carving makes you wonder how skilled people can be. the place is absolutely clean and that probably adds the glitter to the place. the peaceful feeling in there give a feeling of calmness and makes one forget all the worries.visit it and feel it.

Golden Buddha Temple. Our first stop in Bangkok was at The Golden Buddha, officially titled Phra Phuttha Maha Suwan Patimakon is the world's largest solid gold statue. It is located in the temple of Wat Traimit, Bangkok (district of Samphanthawong, in Chinatown), Thailand. The statue is 3 metres (9.8 ft) tall and weights 5.5 tonnes (5.4 long tons; 6.1 short tons). The statue was housed in a wat in Ayutthaya until mid 19th century, and its provenance from Ayutthaya excludes the possibility of it having been made after about 1750. The school in the same primises was awsome.
:) wonderful temple. Modern and big temple. Beautiful and stunning, specially in the afternoon :)

An experience. Seeing the Golden Buddha was quite an experience. It is stunning, and my parents were really wowed by it. What I appreciated about the place (temple) was that even if there were many people the day we went, I did not feel suffocated - it still felt like there was space to move around (unlike in the Temple of the Reclining Buddha). This place is definitely worth visting if you are in Bangkok.Note: We went back in December 2010 but it was no longer available in the drop down
Over rated. Not much to see but the Golden Buddah. Harassed by sellers on the premises. Commercialised
Stunning. The Golden Buddha is simply amazing! Visitors are allowed to buy gold leaf & stick to the Buddha for merit
New and beautiful. We were fortunate to have a local guide who explained all the different meanings and parts to this temple. A must see but is very new and shiny - the Buddha itself is resplendent.
GOOD & PEACEFUL.. Temples are always peaceful and nice, this temple has it's special golden buddha and is abt peace and kindness.

A excellent place to visit. There is some thing for everyone at the golden mount. Will probable take half a day to walk round and see everything, gardens, golden Buddas and many other things of interest without costing anything in enterance fees etc...

Beautiful,Awesome..... The temple was very well kept and it gave one a great feeling.....very peaceful.The architecture was beautiful and being Sunday, everyone from locals to tourist had their own space.It sould be included in everyones itinieary.The temple was very colourful and the statue of Lord Buddha was breathtaking.The whole atmosphere was amazing.

Biggest Buddha made from Gold anywhere in the world. Temple of Buddha has been recently rebuilt and houses the biggest Buddha statue which is made of over 5 tonnes of pure Gold. When one sits in front of the Buddha idol and closes his eyes, one experiences amazing peace of mind and forgets all his worldly tensions and problems. Must visit temple in Bangkok.
WOW!. A very impressive temple! A must see in Bangkok. Quite a structure.
Beautiful and wonderful story about the Golden Buddha. This was also one out of 4 temples we had visited on our day tour Please respect Thai Buddhist culture on do's and don't while visiting.

solid gold. this buddha image is made of solid gold,weighing more than 5000 kgs.!!it was camoufleged with plaster covering but eventually came out by accident.
this is one of the most beautiful buddhist temples( wat in thai language) of bangkok.

Good looking. Wat traimit is an impressive temple made of marble and decorated with gold. I dragged my parents and sister there but in the end they loved it. The golden Buddha is amazing, but i think the temple it is housed in is more amazing.

Magnificient. May was warm so going in the afternoon did not prove to be a good idea. Before 11 or after 4 would have been better. But the temple of the Golden Buddha was so magnificient and the statue so beautiful that you cant take your eyes off it and want to stay with it for as much as as you possibly can. Getting back a replica of the Golden Buddha was the best buy from Thailand, I feel.
Must Visit. Highlight of our stay in Bangkok. Amazing place and to see 5.2 tonnes of solid gold. Great bulidings around the buddha so plenty else to see

Learn about how Bangkok's Chinatown came into being. Yes, you might have been attracted to Wat Traimit by the promised sight of the 5.5 ton of the golden Buddha, but pay an extra 100 baht to enter the museum and learn from the exhibition in the rooms on the 2nd and 3rd floors beneath the golden Buddha. Not only you will learn about the history of the golden Buddha, but also about the history of Thai of Chinese descent and how the Yaowarat Chinatown came into being, with some very (sometimes eerily) realistic displays.

Spectacular and definitely worth a visit. This is an extremely beautiful new temple built from white marble with golden decorations – the architecture is certainly very impressive.Once climbing up to the fourth floor and entering the temple, you are greeted with a spectacular sight – a 5.5 tonne, 3 metre tall solid gold seated Buddha image. It is something you cannot imagine without actually seeing it, and then to realise that it is one whole piece of solid pure gold!Sadly we were not able to visit the museum at the temple (with the history of the Golden Buddha) – something we will definitely do if we visit again.Just one thing to remember, as with any temple, you need to dress respectfully and you need to remove your shoes before entering the temple.
Interesting place. The temple is pretty crowded but still a must-see if you are in BKK. The golden buddha was spectacular but if I had to choose, I would definately see the reclining buddha.

Big, gold and worth a look.. If you've never laid eyes on a big gold Buddha before then jump on the MRT get off at Hua Lamphong walk a couple of hundred metres, pay 40 baht ( extra for exhibition) and feast your eyes on this one. It's big, it's gold and even for a cultural heathen like myself I found it a worthy visit.

Very popular and well maintained monument.. Very good building and imagery around here, like most tourist hot spots though street vendors are turned to stun, didn't go into the museum, which I wish now we had as the history bring places alive.
Beautiful. All the temple visits are breathtaking. Remember you must remove your shoes and not bare shoulders or shorts, your knees must be covered as a sign of respect

Culture. As I've already said,a lot of what you hear about Thailand is true but thats useless to tell someone who hasn't been there.All I'll say is I'm going back and Bangkok teems with culture and things to do and see.

Visit to the Golden Buddha. It was an amazing place but, sad to see the religion commercialized. There were chargers levied from devotes. Coming from a Buddhist background, I wish the devotes would be permitted to pay homage and facilitate for donations rather than selling tickets at the entrance to a temple - a place of worship.
The Stunning 5 1/2 ton golden Buddha. Serene temple. Visitors very orderly. Be careful of the vendors. they quote very high prices, so keep bargaining. You can get it redued by over 50%

Bangkok - Land of Buddha. If you come to Bangkok, it is important to visit the temple of Golden Buddha, where you can see Lord Buddha made of Solid Gold. It is located on 4th floor and one has to climb to reach the temple. Elevators are available for elderly and disabled persons.
Amazing. Don't why its not a priority in most itineraries I had read on the net but found buddha amazing. A must for the first timers to Bangkok
Beautiful. Get ready for a few flights of stairs, but definitely worth it... exquisite golden Buddha in a very nice temple.

An impressive amount of gold. Saw the Golden Buddha many years ago when it was at a much smaller location. Was very impressed with the new location. The Buddha is very large and the amount of gold it required was very impressive.

Spellbindingly elegant. Wat Traimit is the temple housing the statue of the Golden Buddha. It's located at the end of Bangkok's Chinatown, ie, Yaowarat Road. There are actually two temple buildings, the original structure, and a much newer and taller building. The Golden Buddha is found on the 4th level of the latter. You will be spellbound by the architecture of the temple and marvel at the sheer majesty of the Golden Buddha statue. Remember to make a donation to help in the temple's upkeep. On the 2nd level, there is a museum dedicated to the history of Bangkok's Chinatown.

goldilicious. it's a pure gold! yes, it is! wow! if i could only carry this one, i'm already rich by this time... hahahaha=) kidding! it's very nice! only, u have to climb the high stairs before you could see this. my mom almost gave up...

Holy water. My sister and I donated some money and obtained some blessed water from this temple, hoping for it to bring good fortune and prosperity. She drank hers, whilst I washed my hair in mine. The next day, we were scheduled to take a tour to Ayutthaya, but she fell sick (enough to have to go to hospital). We missed the tour, and saw on the news that evening that people had been killed in the flooding of Ayutthaya - the place we should have been that day. Divine intervention perhaps?

Seems to be a must!. It is a big statue of Buddha with many gold as we are informed. Apart from that, there is nothing much to see in the temple except money exchage in the place. But you should go to the back of the first exchange counter, there is a better rate fro the other one in the back.

Interesting. Found the temples a little disappointing as opposed to ones in China. No disrespect to Thai people. Would still recommend seeing them. Hawking is present but no comparable to China which was a pleasant reprieve.
Huge golden Buddha. The temple of course lives up to it's name, there is a huge golden Buddha that sits in the middle of the ornate temple.
Great visit!. A must visit for this beautiful Golden Buddha, remember bring long trousers, no mini skirts or shorts for guys. We loved it and worth taking some nice pictures, a place to meditate.
dont miss it..... camera happy folk love this.....any of the temples are worth seeing...

Magnificent Monument to Buddha. The new Temple building housing the Golden Buddha has 4 stories - the ground floor is being used for prayer and donation activities,the second floor has been decorated as a museum showing the history of Chinatown,the third floor is a museum of the discovery of the Golden Buddha and the construction and the fourth floor houses the Golden Buddha in a magnificent hall.Access is by wide stairways and there is an elevator for elderly persons and wheelchairs.There is a fee for visiting the Museums and the top hall but this is a must to visit and a perfect introduction to the development of Chinatown and the history of Chinese immigrants!

Its a lot of Gold!. This is the biggest seated Buddha statute which is fully made of gold. The very glimpse of the idol makes you mesmerize in the beauty of the structure. The temple is situated at a walking distance from the Hua Lamphong railway station and there is a metro station as well. While in Bangkok, it is a must visit place if you are interested in culture, architecture, art or religion. Just take care with the dress code, as it is a religious place and there are people who come there to prey and meditate.
Beautiful. Nice place to visit to experience thai culture? See the monks and great architecture of the Thai style
wow. just amazing, love the bud hist temples in Thailand and this one is superb, a must see, must do for all

Biggest standing Buddha in Bangkok. The standing Buddha was built with brick and cement decorated with gold leave mosaics in the reign of King Rama IV in order to keep the relics of the Buddha, and has been installed in Wat Intaraviharn ,
Impressive statue. The Buddha statue in itself is very impressive. The temple is completely overrun bin tourists and punters. Ignore them if you can.
Exciting. You should see it! It's different and exciting... The budha is small than my imagination but exciting..

Great spiritual place. If you're in Bangkok you should have to visit the Golden Buddha temple its really very spiritual place. I am a follower of the great Buddha Siddhartha. A nice spiritual exposure.

Amazing. Cant believe such a large statue is of solid gold! But then thats what every one said it is. Simply amazing. And so is the story behind it. But couldn't take good snaps as some construction work was going on inside the sanctum.
GOLD!!!. 5 tons of solid gold buddha!!!! WOW!!! nice to see the devotion of the buddhists

Awesome experience. A must see and visit for travelers. Just a slight warning for old aged people, there aint no escalator or lift to take you up four floors. But once you get there, it is indeed quite mystical. In front of you sits a 50 feet high statute of Buddha, claimed to be made in 40 tones of gold. Worth a visit.

Peaceful experience.. We did see the buddha on a day trip we went on which was almost free from the government we just had to pay the taxes only and they picked us up at the hotel, it was a beautiful and peaceful experience and worth it when you see the photos, I would definitely recommend it.
wonder of the world... should be on your must see places ...avisit to the golden Buddha ..great place

Very big and shiny golden buddha. Wat Traimit is about 10mins walk away from hua lamphong station. It is not easy to find this place however it was worth the visit. The golden buddha is really shiny and beautiful. There are lots of climbing before you will reach the top where the golden buddha is sited.
Beautiful place. If you Thailand wihtout visiting this place.... seems you have never been to Thailand.

Nice wat. Wat Traimit is another wat you might want to visit when in Bangkok. There is actually an entry fee of 40 bath to see the buddha on the 4th floor, some people just don't care about getting a ticket as nobody is checking them. Just Superb. Another amazing sight in the land of smiles. This temple is stunningly beautiful and so important. The golden buddha is a sight to behold. A very cultural attraction and worth seeing. No entry fee but you must dress accordingly.
Interesting and important. The first temple I have been to in BKK that was also a museum

Big Buddha similar disappointment. We went to the Big Buddha since every Thai person that stopped and spoke to us mentioned it. We walked there from our hotel and it took about 10-15 mins. This was a good thing since when we got there it was quite disappointing. I don’t know what we were expecting but it was just a very tall golden Buddha, impressively tall but the one in Wat Pho which is lying down is better. There also seemed to be a lot of stallls around it, they weren’t open when we went but seemed like it may be a bit of a tourist trap. Don’t go out your way to it but if your nearby or passing it will only take up 10 mins of your day.
beautiful. another must see for anyone in Bangkok, again, do this in a city day trip with a guide as fantastic as we has and you will learn a lot!

Nice. This is one you can see but if you miss it, it won't matter. I didn't find it very special to look at. It must have real significance becuase there were a lot of tour busses there. I didn't find this place very interesting.
A long hot climb. The view is spectacular from the top but in the heat it feels like the climb goes on forever. There is an admit fee here but it is very inexpensive
Impressive. The area is not great but one must see the Golden Buddha. Very impressive.

Worth the visit to see so much gold in one place. I have visited this temple many times and I certainly recommend you see the solid gold Buddha if you are in the China Town area. In fact, I remember when the solid gold Buddha statue was just housed in a smallish room and it was not perched as high up as it is today. The Temple of the Golden Buddha. The temple is an active worshipping site. The Golden Buddha is 5.5 tons of solid gold which is impressive to see. The temple is small in square footage and is tucked in a residential/business section of town. There is no designated parking area for the temple.There are a number of stairs which must be climbed but they are not difficult. No wheelchair access. No fee to get in. Photo opportunities both outside and inside the temple.

Golden Buddha. Much like the Emerald Buddha, remember that this buddha is gold and is not large "Reclining Buddha" sized. Take time to sit in the temple and mediatate on what an incredible expereince this trip offers.

sooo stunning!. the temple is beautiful from any angle you see it, there's no fee to enter inside and you can take pictures too, of course to entry you must dress properly (cover shoulders, no shorts, no flip flops). Chinatown walking tour. The golden buddha of 5 tons was interesting, but masses of tourists. While it was a beautiful place to go, I don't particularly like crowded touristy areas. Fortunately we we were there around 10am, any later and I think it would have been worse.

This was fascinating. I loved this, it was well worth the visit. The scenery around the area and the temple was amazing, from the top you can look around at nearby area's and the view is great.
very good. very good includes in our standard package. you can take photos but should be in proper clothes. shorts sleeveles dresses not allowed.

Real golden buddha. The statue is not really special, apart from the fact that it is solid gold.The museum is interesting, but many displays did not work. The temple next to it, which is really in use, is actually more interesting because it is 'alive'.
beautiful temple. There are many temples in Bangkok but this one is worth the visit. We were lucky to visit during Songkran and loved all the ceremony

A vista to Bangkok is not complete without visiting this template. I first saw the golden Buddha in 1981. It took mY breath away.31 years later it still was as awe inspiring and better kept. I would come back again

Now that was educational. The temple includes a chinese-thai history museum, a huge golden statue to adore and plenty of small shrines around it- asking for donations or just plain amusing. Some organized tours could add a bit to it, and it has no access for disabled, so you have to climb the stairs. But once you're up, you have something worth viewing and knowing.

Thailand is a golden place to visit. Can you imagine looking at a 5 1/2-ton solid gold Buddha? That's one of many attractions of Thailand, which has replaced Egypt as my favorite country. The rice fields. The pineapple plantations. The people, so friendly and trustworthy (one returned a wallet with $500 still in it to one of our SmarTours fellow travelers). Emerald Temple. The Monkey Temple. The Floating Market, a short river trip away from Bangkok. Petting tigers in a compound (not a cage!). Riding elephants for an hour through the jungle and river. The Longneck Hill Tribe. There's no end to fascination in Thailand. "The King And I" (Yul Brynner) son was so fascinated with England that signs in Thai and English abound so it helps to get around. If you go to one country, this is the one. Not for those with mobility problems, though.
Impressive!. This masterpiece of pure gold has a new home where it can be better appreciated in all its splendour.
Mind Blowing. Like the Emerald Buddha - this is something one must see in Thailand for the sheer beauty of it

Big Gold Buddah. It was good to see this big golden Buddha. I think it is a bit strange to have people starving outside and a gold huge Buddha inside but that is a different story. Bring a scarf if you are a lady as they will make you pay for one before you enter.
Has to be seen to be Believed. Facinating history surrounds the survival story of this solid gold Buddha. Ladies need to cover the shoulders and legs above the knees. A real eye opener

definite must if visiting Bangkok. Of the three Wats I visited during my short stay in Bangkok this was the most impresive with a 3 metre tall solid gold buddha being the main focal point of the Wat. Ok so it's all gold but there are far more beautiful temples and I could not bare how much you are pestered by the stupid idiots taking your photos on your way up and trying to flog them to you in the form of a badge on your way out rude I know people have to make a living but if this place is ment to be special the locals certainly don't seem to see it as that very disprispectable to it . And if you feel you have to go make sure you get your taxi to wait for you there .

Other than that, nothing special as it's just like any other temples but this you've got to pay admission fee.When we leave by the side door, there are two buddhist temples, one by the left side and the other on the opposite of the road. Both of these do not charge admission fees but "donate as you like".
Place to visit in Bangkok. One of the main temple to visit. nothing speficic to add ;-)
do it. a must see when in Bangkok close to otha attractions so can see a few in 1 day but do this one but wear flat shoes & ones that r easy 2 take on n off

Go for the Buddha, but enjoy the museum!. One of our last days in Thailand of a two week trip we decided to visit the temple of the golden Buddha after wandering a bit around Chinatown. By now we had been to plenty of Wats and seen plenty of Buddha statues. We were a bit apprehensive at first, because we kept thinking "how could this be any different than the others?" But my cousin (living in Bangkok) suggested we go for a visit anyway. The treasure of the Wat is actually the museum. The museum not only describes the story of how the golden Buddha was made and how it was found, but it also goes through the history of Chinatown and how it was formed. Both areas were well laid out, intriguing and interactive. The bonus to this museum is that all the exhibits are also in English. The Buddha itself is all the way at the top, which also gives you a bit of a look of the surrounding area. The golden Buddha itself was nice to see, but I wouldn't miss the museum (even though it cost a bit extra).

Golden memories. Temple of Golden Buddha is always a place to visit,to pay respect to Lord Buddha.Glorious feelings makes us proud about our glorious past.Spending time at the temple allow us to sit and pray to our beloved god.

The most gold you will ever see at one time!. The Golden Buddha is quite grandiose and it looks like real gold. The area is quite crowded and very touristy but, if you are a tourist, it is one of the top things to see in Bangkok.

Temple of the Golden Buddha. Most of this temple has been redesigned as a museum which recounts the immigration of the Chinese to Thailand. The exhibits are interactive. The story behind the Golden Buddha is almost as good as the museum.

Another 'wow'. The Golden Buddha is certainly the biggest piece of gold I'm ever likely to see but that would not do justice to this remarkable historic monument and the obvious reverence in which it is held.
Beautiful. Large large area, vert lovely spot..prepare to walk
worth seeing. again a must to visit if in Bangkok, in conjunction with the grand palace and other Buddha's.

A must see !. All visitors (especially Chinese) should tour the Yaowarat Chinatown Heritage Center that is included in the Wat (Temple). It has an excellent display showing the Chinese history of the first settlers in Bangkok.

Another Fantastic Buddha!. Another must see in Bangkok for sure. After seeing the reclining and emerald Buddha you had better make a point to see the Golden Buddha. Such a peaceful place in a busy city.
A definate. As with everything - gets hot & busy - get there early but well worth seeing.

Good to climb and worship. It takes about 5-10 minutes of climbing the stairs. But, as a result, you witness the golden statue of Buddha. What an amazing site filled with holy mantras coupled with tourists who can't just blink their eyes. Do not miss, if you can climb the stairs.

Five tons of gold. This was the first temple I visited upon arriving in Bangkok. The temple itself is beautiful, with a staircase in front. But the impressive thing is the huge statue of Buddha entirely made of gold weighing over 5 tons. Our guide told us that it was for many years covered by a thick layer of plaster due to the war with neighboring Thailand. Interesting that there are no security operation to protect the image, probably because it is impossible to carry it without using a crane. Outside, there are always many people making offerings of lotus flowers and incense.Stay ther for half an hour.
Mesmerising. I couldn't take my eyes of the Golden Buddha, it was so beautiful I had to be pulled away to leave the temple. I could have easily spent hours gazing, I felt so at peace.

really nice attarction in the chinatown. really nice attarction in the chinatown
very thai, nice attraction and cheap entry
5.5 tonnes of gold. Golden Buddha in gold. Well made, near china town, walking distance from MRT, well chisled buddha figurine

Visit from the end station of the Subway. The best way to visit from the Subway line end exit station called Hau Lampong, then ask your way to wat traimit. There is a golden Buddha image inside they discovered under a layer of plaster to evade stealing during the war with Birma. Perfect stopover on a Chinatown Visit which is only 10 minutes walk further down the road.
very good. it is a rather small temple comparing to others but is very nice. the story about the Buddha is very interesting
Local temple. Very beautiful - stunning buddha figure surrounded by floral tributes.

Good exhibition. Went here on the Metro, once again lot of development going on in the area.We found quite easy only 5 min walk from station,Went early morning, caught a service in temple, good facilities on site toilets etc.New exhibition centre built on site, worth checking built in 4 storey temple style building 2 show areas based on the history of old china town and bangkok.Lifts at rear of building we went up in the lift and down the stairs perfect.

Impressive!. This Buddha has a great story behind (so our guide told us): Long time ago, when Thailand was going through a war with some other countries, the Buddha was covered in cement to protect it. The story got lost in time until one king wanted to transfer the statue from one place to a new temple, the cement broke and the gold was revealed. Cool! :)Very crowded as all the other temples but still a must see.

Five tons of gold.. The Golden Buddha is five and a half tons of gold, with an interesting past. Usually other things going on in the temple area too. It is also a good entrance to Chinatown a few blocks away. Accessible from the metro. Forget about taking a taxi as the streets in the area are impassable. Be prepared to walk.

Amazing statue of Buddha .. Statue of Buddha made from pure gold, situated near to Chinatown (Bangkok). Wheelchair accessible as they have a lift at the back . It is fun for those who are able to climb . Kindly donate a small sum if visitors take bottles of drinking water within the temple.
Beautiful golden Buddha. Come to see a big golden buddha here in Wat Traimit near Chinatown. Don't miss to pay respect and wish for a happiness to your life.
So much gold. The size of the solid gold Buddha has to be seen to be believed. It was not discovered untill 1955 ! It was very crowded on our visit
Nice. This was a good one. But nothing like the sleeping Buddha or Wat Pho. Pls don't buy the tickets for it, as no one asks for them. Temples never have charged entry

Must to see.. Now we were there on a holiday, the entry was free now. I was here a few years ago, now the golden buddha is in a new storey building. I think this is the must see Buddha in Bangkok, 5,5 tons gold, do not even have anything to say.

Essential Temple. Wat Traimit is not the most spectacular temple you will see in Bangkok, or for that matter, Thailand, but it is essential for the simple reasons that it houses the fabulous Golden Buddha. The Buddha itselt is the world's largest solid gold statue, weighing in at 5.5 tons! It stands 3 meters tall, and is awe inspiring to view. This is especially true when it is considered that for hundreds of years the Golden Buddha had been disguised beneath a thick outer shell of plaster in order to protect the precious gold Buddha within. It was not until 1955 that the plaster stature was in the process of being moved to the new temple at Wat Traimit, that a cable broke and the statue tumbled to the mud. The plaster had cracked, and miraculously, the solid gold Buddha was discovered within. Now devout Buddhists come from all over the world to pray before the Golden Buddha, and Wat Traimit is no longer of temple of lesser importance.
Very Nice. This is a good stop. Very nice to see and lots of history here.

Beautiful looking Temple. This temple from the outside is just what I had imagined thailand temples to look like. The Golden Buddha is not as big as I imagined it would be but still worth seeing. You will not believe it. 5 Tons of solid gold!!! It has to be seen it is very central and easily accesses no need to do a formal tour if your hotel is in town just go along not expensive to get in and it is more trouble on a formal tour as the buses struggle to get in. Walk there and stroll in.
do some homework first. I like the story behind it. IF you don't know, it is just another golden buddha in Bangkok... you need to read about the story first. :)

Great Temple and museum. This temple is located in the China Town district of Bangkok. Its a nice temple with a museum about the golden Buddha and also about China Town and history. I thought it was insightful.
Yes must visit this beautiful place. Im glad I came here as the place was magical and well very calm and serene. The value was good but can I say I lost 2 kilos of sweat as it was so hot.

one of a hundred temples to see. try to see all details so you will enjoy and ask about the history of it it is enteresting

Very beautiful. In the midst of Chinatown, à tranquil place, beautiful set, an enormous temple, but easy to climb, you'll see the golden Buddha.

Hard to find but worth the effort. Amazing pure solid gold Buddha! Love the story on how they discovered it! check it out! Worth it!
Beautiful. We stumbled across this on the way back from the train station. Good exhibitions....air-con was very very welcome!!
One of the most spectacular things I have ever seen. This temple complex alone was worth the trip.I am at a loss of words, it must be seen

Scam artist central!. Be careful! This temple is know to have scam artists waiting for tourists! Do not follow anyone to any special clothing sales or tailors. We were harassed to go so much that it ruined the experience.
impressive.. worth a visit, although they do not allow samples to be taken !

A Grand Golden Experience. One of the landmarks in Bangkok, this temple of the Golden Buddha worth close to 3.5 million dollars, has a rich history to share. Among the facts, one of the interesting ones was that it was cast in parts in India and assembled at this site. At some point of time it was completely plastered to prevent it from being stolen. Untill in 1955 during the movement of the statue due to an accident the plaster was broken and the original composition was revealed after 200 years.There is indeed a divine feel around the statue and one should not miss visiting this temple.
impressive.. is impressive to see a 5 tons of gold Buddha. Don't miss it. Is on the way to China Town. Be sure you ware appropriate cloths.
Another must see temple IMHO. This temple to me encapsulated the Buddhist way of life to me serene peacefull and with so much unstated beauty
Gold so much gold. Fascinating history. was amazing to see the temple and hear the story of the budhha.

EXCELLENT. What can I say. All the Temples (Wats) are wonderful and a visionary experience. You have to visit the Wats whilst in bangkok, it goes without saying. Again the Buddha is massive and you can get up real close to it. You just want to keep staring at it it is so beautiful.
Small but a real pressure. This is the Fourth must see in Bangkok, a real gem.
Beautiful. Just amazing eye candy! The gold gilding and beautiful architecture make this worth the visit.
This is a must see!. Beautiful Buddha shrine well worth the time. Simply amazing shrine.

A very busy place but worth a visit to see.. A fascinating statue with a very interesting / mysterious history. It's one of the main attrractions pushed by guides and tuktu7k drivers (don't take the cheap tuk tuk tour if offered, set a price to go and back, never take their offers for 3 places only 50 baht or whatever, it's a scam and will waste half your day) All in all wat traimit is not an absolutly must do like the Grand Palace but if you are going to see 2 or more temples in Bangkok then I'd put this should be on the list.
Golden Buddha. You have to see this Buddha made out of the gold. The building the buddha is housed in is made of marble so its great to see too.

Must see in Thailand. i wish i was the owner of that place,i must be rich then:) many tourists and great design,what a great art made in gold:) that's a must visit i could recommand it for first time visitor

Good One. We chose a package tour from Bangkok airport and this was the first stoppage of the guided tour.
The temple was good to see. But there were some stairs to climb on. Also it was neat and clean. Overall the temple was nice and we enjoyed our visit.
Need to know. Very impressive but ideally you need to know a bit of its history and about the religion before going otherwise it's meaningless
That's alot of gold. They are really into the bling. I have never seen so much shiny stuff. Cool trip.

Close to chinatown and Hualong train station. Easy to get there either to BTS or MRT, few minutes walking from there. Statue is nothing special, since you've seen it before recliend Buddha, but it is part of main monument to visit in Bangkok. We went there just after a tuk-tuk tour to visit the royal king residence in the northern part of the city and it was very hot and sunny; we stayed there few minutes and we moved then with tuk-tuk into chinatown area to visit their volored strees because of Dragon year just started (23rd January).
Average. Was impressed to note that the statue was made from sold gold,but apart from that, nothing much impressed me about the place.
Excellent. This is a must see in Thailand! Stunning to see! Also very easy to find!
Obvious great photo spot. and excellent Pad Thai around the corner near the river/canal bridge.
Very interesting but full of people. This temple is definitely worth a trip but it is very busyAvoid the heat hours as it can get very hot
5 Ton Golden Budda. The 5-ton solid gold buddah is a sight to behold - story of it's discovery quite interesting. Right at the gateway to Chinatown too!
Awesome. So very beautiful and magical . You can feel the warmth and love in the area

Don't need to stay long but worth a look. In the heart of china town and a great temple to browse through before heading off to Sampang lane for some serious shopping. It doesn't take long to view the Golden Buddha but its quite an interesting wat to visit - all that gold!Shoes off before you enter, don't point your feet towards the buddha and use low inside voices. not usually too crowded with tourists.
Must see. It is in every guidebook - and has to be. You can not miss it on a trip in Bangkok.

Golden Buddha (Wat Traimit) - a must. If you have rented a car to take you around various sites, begin with the Temple of the Golden Buddha. Simply bought ticket for just to Pay respect to the Buddha , and is the least expensive of the various ticket options at the compound, and which is the highlight anyway. The temple compound was built recently and expanded to house the Golden Buddha. The solid gold buddha has no equal i.e. the only totally solid gold buddha.Renting a van which accommodate 8 - 10 people for 4 hours to 4 local sights costs from Baht 800 to 1000 total. Renting a car/van is the only option when one is limited to less than a day in Bangkok. Otherwise, others have managed on-your-own walking taking public water taxi to cross the river.
The day of many visits. What can I say an awesome sight, can't go to Thailand without seeing this.
amazing. simply awesome. bring shoes that are easy to take off when visiting temples.

Bangkok's Blinged out Wat. This wat is on all the tour guide itineraries and the reason for this is 'bling'. This temple houses the world's largest solid gold Buddha, which dates back to the Sukothai era and was hidden for centuries. Lovers of gold, glitz and extravagance generally will appreciate this statue, though what it has to do with Buddhist restraint and virtue is less obvious. On the down side, it has a bit of a tourist circus atmosphere, so don't plan on any quiet meditation.
Amazing. Definitely worth a visit. There are multiple levels of exhibits and interesting things about the history of the golden Buddha.
Incredible but a bit noisy.... We arrived to see the Golden Buddha and were quite impressed by the scale and size, but not so much by all of the street noise...
A gem!. The Thai people really know how to respect Buddha and all the temples are absolutely wonderful. Each one is unique and worth the trip. This one is no exception!

5.5 tons of gold Buddha is impressive!. Of the temples we visited in Bangkok, this was the busiest by far. The parking lot was jammed up and right up the stairs and even into the temple, there was a huge crowd as not a lot of room. It was worth it though as the sight of the Golden Buddha inside the top of the temple is amazing.
Wow...this is a must. This really was such a must do thing in Bangkopk and it was an amasing place.

after we lost our way, we found a small temple, with a Gold Buddha, good feellings.. We went there from our Hotel, we passed by Chinatown, Bangkok and we could see a litle of a real daily life, great experience.

Lovely, Tranquil Buddha.. In Chinatown so fun photographing shops full of curiosities including a shop full of brooms for sweeping! Also near The main rail terminal and the end of one of the Metro lines.Now the Temple is most beatiful and so are the external terraces even if the surrounding Chinatown is a bit grotty but fun.You take your shoes off to enter and no photos inside to be taken. But the air of peace as people squat, kneel and pray is palpable. I also found this depiction of the ideas of Buddha's character to be one of the most attractive in all Bangkok and as I expected this Buddha being solid Gold as opposed to Gold plate made no difference at all. I did not bother to pay extra for the various museums one can go to but if you are a culture vulture make sure that you allow at least 2 hours for this place. Not nearly as busy as the Imperial Palace and the offering areas outside, where people light incense and make offerings to their God or is it Gods is a great photo opportunity because you are outside. Shame about us foreigners, as we get everywhere and I cannot get them out of my photos. Hmmmm may be I should listen more to Jesus Christ where he says "Love thy neighbour as thyself". Hmmmmm it is ok loving God, it is the neighbours that challenge me. Maybe if I spent more time worshipping God in a quiet place, I would reach enlightenment but 30 minutes a day at dawn sets me up fairly well. A fair walk from the river but easily approached by Metro.Chris.

Breathless. For me one of the best places to visit in town. The feeling of visiting this temple was like seeing the Eiffel Tower for the first time. I had a very emotional feeling and it was a place to include in any tourist plans. Just take care of those who try to take you out of this place to drive you by tuk-tuk to the taylor shop (it was lost of time). Usually they are nearby and tell you the temple is temporary closed. Be careful.
tons of gold!. a solid golden buddha was interesting to see for a moment
Excellent!. A must see, only costs pennies and takes about 20mins (we didnt go in the museum, just saw the statue)- was a bit out of the way.
Great site seeing. Great photo opportunities of the buddhas.... loved all the architecture and buddhas
Unbelievable. Unlike anything else on earth, must be seen! You must cover for Temple and remove footwear so bare that in mind. A day of temple tours is best and then you see it all.

A must see as part of the temples tour. A must see as part of the temples tour and a facinating story of its dicovery. From the hussle and bussle of the street a few feet away, this is a peaceful and tranquel place.

Stunning temple!. This temple just one block away from he most vibrant district of Chinatown. Also just a walking distance from Hualamphong Train Station.Less popular among the tourists compared to Wat Pho, Wat Suthat and Wat Phra Kaeo. But it is the best place to stop in order to linger the local culture and ritual.
Huge. we did this very quickly on our way to the Grand Palace, very weird such a large buddha in the middle of a residential area
Very nice place to visit. Nice, new a clean. it's a very short walk from the Hua Lompong subway station and has been built w/in the past couple of years.

if you have time. It was interesting, but it looks the same as any gilded Buddha obviously. if you have time or are in the neighborhood, it's worth a look. Only takes a few minutes, if you only do the Buddha.

Amazing that much gold can go untouched. This solid gold buddha was hidden in clay and the gold interior discovered by accident. Must be worth a fortune even if it is not solid and there is little security. Another must

Well worth the visit. If you only visit one temple in Bangkok it this one as it houses a solid gold buddha said to weigh 5.5 ton of solid gold. It is set up on the 4th floor, up a flight of marble steps and the view of Bangkok is pretty good from up there.

Quick visit would do. Located at the end of Chinatown's Yaowarat Road, Wat Traimit houses the world's largest golden seated Buddha measuring nearly five metres in height and weighing five and a half tons. The entrance fee was 40bahts / person, but i am not sure if everyone bought the ticket to visit the 4th floor of the temple to see the Golden Buddha. There were plenty of students when we arrived and taking pictures was not so easy. But worth the visit for 30minutes. Only downside is that exiting chinatown is painfully slow with the traffic. Try going early in the morning to avoid the rush hour.

The five and a half Tonnes of pure solid gold. The High - Light is the Golden Buddha which was built over 700 hundred years ago at Sukhothai kingdom ( the first capital of Thailand 1238 AD. ) Initially, the Buddha was covered by Cement to conceal from the enamies, untill it was moved to Bangkok , also nobody know that the Buddha statue is in Gold, then came the Truth on the way of Transportation , the piece of cements were brocken , then the Golden Buddha was shining
Golden Buddha is believed to be 800 Years Old. Amazing, just think of a Buddha 5 1/2 tons of solid gold!! And there was no one guarding the Buddha!!!!!
Big Buddha Statue. This temple portrays the royal Heritage of Thailand. Temple is located in the heart of city. Close to the old royal palace of Bangkok.

This temple made our day !! A must see tourist attraction !!. The temples were beautiful!! It reveals the real buddhist traditional of Bangkok. Takes you away from the usual hustle and bustle in Bankok and shows you another element to this beautiful city. Apart from the heat, this was definitely a well worth visit tourist attraction.

Astonishing Golden Buddha Statue. At temple of Wat Traimit, sits the world's largest solid gold Buddha statue.The Golden Buddha statue was cast in parts & it was completely plastered to prevent it from being stolen. Made in GOLD, It is ten feet high, and weighs five and one half tons. Wat Traimit is located just off Odeon traffic circle, It's also an easy walk from the subway station at Hualamphong.
Huge. This Buddha was quite big, although there is no much else to see except the Golden One (quite amazing by itself), you can clear this quite quickly during your throughout visit of Chinatown.
Lots of gold in China town. It is a temple, so proper cloth are required to be worn. It is worth to see the exhibition and the Buddha, very impressive!

Extraordinary Sukhothai statue. The story behind the statue is fascinating - look it up before you go, as I don't want to spoil it! 700 years old, 3 meters tall, solid gold and beautiful! If you are 'elderly or disabled', it's worth going into the bottom of the building, where you'll be allowed to use the lift up to the 4th floor!The 40B entrance fee for foreigners is well worth it.

worth seeing. This very large Buddha is stunning and worth seeing. Make sure and drop coins in the baskets at end for good luck. Heads up....protect yourself against pickpockets

Luckily we were dressed appropriately so we had no problems getting into the temple. Its a short walk up the stairs to get to the top but it's worth it. The Buddha is lovely. Pictures are allowed. Golden Buddha. I like Wat Taimit. You can go there by bus (from MBK bus no. 25, 501, 547) (price for bus 8-12 THB so cheap) I like to prey in that.
Cheap attraction and close to grand palace. Around the corner from the grand palace but far cheaper and a fine attraction. Very busy all year.
A Top 3 pick for Bangkok. Loved the temple architecture as it ascends in stages to finally buddha temple, where the majestic golden statue is kept. Like reaching the mountain top to meet the saint.
Nice Temple, after the Reclining Buddha. Well this is another temple tour that completes the 3 most-viewed temples in BKK (Reclining, Emerald, Golden)..
very good. very good location in between commercial bangkok. dont miss it.
Enormous. When they say the Buddha is big, I didn;t realise that it would be that big, while long really, 25m. It lays on it's side, a must see.
Interesting. A gem - well worth a visit. Fairly crowded but not packed.

Still worth the visit. It's great view. Important is to respect the local tradition and not move in space forbidden to take pictures, as I saw many people doing. The Buddha is beautiful and certainly has to be considered.

The best of the temples. I don't have much time for boring temples. But if you're going to see at least one this should be it. Golden Buddha. * Impressive looking temple on the fringe of Chinatown.* Climb the steps a) to escape the touts (only negative of this temple) and b) to see the golden Buddha.* The Buddha is amazing and the views over Chinatown are prtty good too.* Walk into Chinatown from here and experience an amazing part of Bangkok.

Eintrittsgeld o.ä. wird nicht genommen. Sehr empfehlenswert zu sehen - ein schöner traditioneller Ort der Ruhe! Die Gongs benutzen!!!
Speechless. Speechless, this is what I can say about this from clay undone and found in the Chao Praya River / all Gold / beautiful Buddha.

Wow!. Five tons of gold! What is there to dislike. If you go on an arranged tour of these sites watch out for the overpriced gem store visits which seem compulsory. Take advantage of the free drink and toilets, but buy elsewhere and watch out for gem scams for the unwary.
You will find the world's largest solid gold Buddha statue here. This temple of Wat Traimit is located in district of Samphanthawong in Chinatown, Bangkok, Thailand.
got to see. amazing .The wonders of the culture come alive. Also go see the Emerald Buhda, the Royal palace is a must

Good to see. Considering the fact that Thailand has endless images of Buddha seeing the Golden buddha is a different image. The solid gold structure is definately unique and stands out to any other Buddha image you will see. There is a great story behind this so its worth the time to see.

fun, fine and famous place to visit. I liked that this place is so holy and everything here is awesome.I liked that there are so many tourists who like me- are all amazed by the wonderful site.I like that all Thai that I met are all friendly, soft spoken and very polite.I never like the fact that I cannot go as much as I want to Bangkok to visit some more other places, go shopping, and eat all the local thai foods that I can.
